I just started to use HtmlUnit and I couldn't get the link for an anchor text working. i.e. I tried to get an HtmlAnchor through getAnchorByText(...) and call the click, but it doesn't seem to get the new page. I came across this bug filed a few months ago, is this still relevant or is there something I could do to work-around this? http://old.nabble.com/-HtmlUnit----htmlunit-Bugs-3232488---Click-inside-anchor-doesn%27t-trigger-anchor-td31202457.html -- Deepak

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Upgrading JQuery Support
mail.body: Hey Everyone, We recently added the jQuery javascript library to our product and implemented some of the jQuery "ColorBox" features. Currently the HtmlUnit page claims full support for jQuery 1.2.6. That version was released on May 24, 2008. The JQuery version that we are using is 1.6.1, but we have also tried the current 1.7.1. In both versions the HtmlUnit 2.9 driver is finding empty DIVs in the Colorbox. We can see that the implemented features work correctly in current IE and current FF, but writing automated tests with HtmlUnit we seem to see problems. Those problems are related to DIVs inside the colorbox not getting their text content updated on JS events. Has anyone else ran into these issues? Is it possible to upgrade HtmlUnit to work with the current jQuery? do we need to get a newer version of the RhinoScript engine? Any help with this would be greatly appreciated! I have included a sample html snippet below, and the htmlunit code that i'm using. Thank you, in advance, -Jason- The html/javascript logic is like this: ----------------------------------------- http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml some code here... some code here... ----------------------------------------- the htmlunit logic is like this: ----------------------------------------- HtmlPage page = (HtmlPage) -----------------------------------------

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit: Cannot modify FORM element attributes via JavaScript
mail.body: I've posted a question regarding an issue I am having with HtmlUnit. I have a unit test demonstrating the issue. It's not a JUnit test but rather a JavaScript unit test using Jasmine. I would image a JUnit test would be similar. I'll copy the post content here. http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9008552/htmlunit-cannot-modify-form-element-attributes-via-javascript I am writing test for our JavaScript using Jasmine, Jasmine-JQuery, and the Jasmine-Maven plugin. While writing my tests, I came across this issue. After adding an attribute to a FORM element via jQuery, it seems the attribute's value can no longer be changed. This seems to only happen on a FORM element. I have tested this with a DIV element and a A (anchor) element, and both work as expected. An example: ... /* * fubar.html * ---------- */ ... When running this test through a maven test, which uses HtmlUnit, I get the following test results: 1.) myDescription add attribute, check value, change value, check value <<< FAILURE! * Passed. * Expected 'foo' to equal 'foo3'. * Expected 'foo' to equal 'bar'. * Passed. Anyone know what is going on here? Is this a jQuery issue or an HtmlUnit issue? I think its an HtmlUnit issue because this works fine in actual browsers. Any help would be appreciated. Thank you!

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] htmlunit and rich:autocomplete
mail.body: I am using htmlunit throught jsfunit to test an application with richfaces 4 components. htmlunit version is 2.8. I am having problems sending an xhttp request when the onchange event is triggered on the rich:autocomplete component. I traced the code unrolling up to EventListenersContainer.executeEventListeners, to this line: "final ScriptResult result = page.executeJavaScriptFunctionIfPossible(listener, jsNode_, args, node);", but the xhttp request does not seems to be executed. ( I put breakpoint in the jsf servlet .. ) The function is returning 'undefined'. Does anybody had this problem ? Laurent -- View this message in context: http://old.nabble.com/htmlunit-and-rich%3Aautocomplete-tp33155812p33155812.html Sent from the HtmlUnit - General mailing list archive at Nabble.com.

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] htmlunit-designer
mail.body: Hi Bernard, can you tell us a few words about this project? Cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com Le 13/01/2012 21:26, Bernard Łabno a écrit : https://github.com/blabno/htmlunit-designer

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] htmlunit-designer
mail.body: Take a look at https://github.com/blabno/htmlunit-designer/wiki/Quick-Tour . It's a short introduction with screenshots. Basically when we write tests (JSFUnit users), in order to run them, we have to deploy them to appserver and then execute them. This increases turnaround very much, so writing tests is slow and coders get frustrated that once test fails they have to change single line and rerun whole test to see results. This project aims to remedy this, by providing means to execute scripts at runtime and to easily observe state of web client. http://mguillem.wordpress.com https://github.com/blabno/htmlunit-designer http://p.sf.net/sfu/rsa-sfdev2dev2 https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Can HtmlUnit support to set the content to an online rich text editor?
mail.body: I am using HtmlUnit to test a web application. It uses an online rich text editor to collect the user input. (The iframe is used without src attribute ). I have to simulate the user input, but I find I have no way to set the content into this iframe. Can HtmlUnit support this functionality? I googled the web heavily, but found no clear answer. Best Regards, Gary Chen

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit in Crawling javascript site content
mail.body: Hi Chris, HTMLUnit typically processes mime type text/html from the web server. They also have minimal support for text/xml. HTMLUnit supports JSON for processing through Rhino JS engine. By default, HtmlUnit WebClient instance enables javascript processing. When JS engine executes the JS functions after receiving the HTML page, you need to wait for underlying JS engine to process the JSON response and constructs the DOM tree. After, the wait, you can process the DOM structure using XPATH. Read this link http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/faq.html#AJAXDoesNotWork My experience has been that with JSP sites, HTMLUnit works very well but with ASP.NET sites it has been a tough time for me. You have to play around with enabling/disabling Javascript and process the response for each site. Hope this helps. Cheers Vasu On Thu, Mar 1, 2012 at 10:55 PM, chris daniel <achris1985@...> wrote: http://www.chemistdirect.co.uk/ajaxSearch.php?q=clipper&page=1&ty=general&catid=0&ccnt=0&cname=&sort=&view=list&bw=&sid= http://www.chemistdirect.co.uk/search_results.php?q=clipper&page=1&ty=general&cty=&catid=0&catcnt=0&catname=&sort=&pp=&vv=list&sid=&bw=&showTab= http://www.chemistdirect.co.uk/search_results.php?q=cordless+hair+clipper http://foobar.com/ ") http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfnl/114/51521223/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://bit.ly/bSMWd7 . http://bit.ly/yQC1oD . http://bit.ly/bSMWd7 . http://bit.ly/yQC1oD . http://p.sf.net/sfu/learndevnow-d2d https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfnl/114/51521223/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfnl/114/51521223/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfnl/114/51521223/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Bug in handling a table cell.
mail.body: There is a HtmlTable and it's being parsed like this: HtmlTable logsTable = (HtmlTable) List l = cell.getByXPath("//a"); // this is a faulty one !! String destination = ((HtmlAnchor) TextPage log = destination = On the webpage there is one log file. However it was parsed 8 times. I was looking at the problem for 2 hours and then I realised that the table has 4 columns and 2 rows = 8. Which means that cell.getByXPath() searched entire html page 8 times and 8 times found that only possible log. I consider it a bug, because if I wanted to search whole webpage I would do currentPage.getByXPath instead of cell.getByXPath(). I'm sorry, but I won't provide you the webpage, because it's private. But the code is here (above) to test. Tom

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Bug in handling a table cell.
mail.body: tommmmmm wrote: Have you tried using: Even though you want to grab all anchor elements starting from the given cell, I don't think XPath's current node is set yet. So when you look for "//a", the current node defaults to the root node of the document. Starting the expression with a "." specifies that the cell you're searching from is the current node. Thus ".//a" should give you all anchors from whatever element you search from. At least. that's how XPath within HtmlUnit has behaved for me in the past. :) RBri, I think that's XPath working as intended, no? -- View this message in context: http://old.nabble.com/Bug-in-handling-a-table-cell.-tp33409906p33422193.html Sent from the HtmlUnit - General mailing list archive at Nabble.com.

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Bug in handling a table cell.
mail.body: On Tue, 28 Feb 2012 22:38:27 +0100 tommmmmm wrote: Hi Tom, maybe you found a bug. And maybe you spend 2 hours to understand the problem. And yes i know, some pages are not public. But please spend some more hours to build a simple reproducable test case. Providing a simple page maybe with a table containing only two cells and a simplified test code that clearly points to the problem will save some more hours here. And then open a issue and report the bug together with the test case. And if some time is left, submit a patch that soves the problem ;-) Please keep in mind that our time is really limited... RBRi -------------------------- Wetator Smart web application testing http://www.wetator.org

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] SSL Authentication Help
mail.body: Hi, I am accessing a page on my intranet . Now on logging to this page , a popup box appears where i need to enter my username and information. Now there is a particular page where i need to test the contents of the pdf/excel export file to be greater than 0 file length. However , i am not able to login to the page using html unit . I have tried several examples for NTLM/basic authentication etc. I am getting this error com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.FailingHttpStatusCodeException: 401 Unauthorized for https://domainname.com Also , in Google Chrome i can enter the username and password in the url ( https://username:password@...>) without me being prompted for password anywhere else. However, the browser version for chrome is not there , so i could not test this out.

mail.body: Hey Anshuman, Is it a popup window or a dialog box? If the Url is working with chrome then it is going to work will any browser, so you can use IE or Firefox setting in HtmlUnit. Still if you need chrome use following Regards, Raj Singh Sisodia From: ANSHUMAN BHATIA [mailto:fuzzy.anshuman@...] Sent: 27 February 2012 03:58 To: htmlunit-user@... mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] SSL Authentication Help
mail.body: Hey Raj, Apparently the problem was with the funny way the intranet was configured . The home page used NTLM authentication , and the page which i wanted to test used kerberos authentication. However , if i used webClient.setUseInsecureSSL(true); it works On 28 February 2012 18:36, Raj Singh Sisodia <raj.sisodia@...: https://domainname.com https://username:password@...>) without me being prompted for http://bit.ly/bSMWd7 . http://bit.ly/yQC1oD . http://p.sf.net/sfu/learndevnow-d2d https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit and SSL Certificate
mail.body: Hi, i need to access to a site using a valid SSL Certificate, i did it with htmlunit 2.6, but I don’t find any hint on how to put the certificate in use. In version 2.6 I used the Protocol object, which has been removed in the new version afaik. The code was Protocol authhttps = new Protocol("https", new org.apache.commons.httpclient.contrib.ssl.AuthSSLProtocolSocketFactory(keyStoreKeys, Any suggestion or a working example for version 2.9? Has this feature been removed? Thanks in advance

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit in Multi-Threaded Environment
mail.body: I am using HtmlUnit to screen scrape some webpages that are authentication protected. The way I am using HtmlUnit, I am caching an object that holds the WebClient as an instance variable. The cached object ("MyConnection") is returned for the same userid. This is to save processing time authenticating the user each time a page needed to be scraped (otherwise I would use stateless objects). I know that the WebClient is not thread-safe, and I am using synchronized on methods where it is accessed. However, is it necessary for me to synchronize the methods that do not manipulate the WebClient but do use other HtmlUnit objects (such as HtmlPage and HtmlTable)? Here is a simple example: // does this need to be synchronized since it is acting on a HtmlTable // object?? public String getTableCaption() throws FailingHttpStatusCodeException, // does this need to be synchronized since it is acting on a HtmlTable // object?? private HtmlTable getHtmlTable() throws FailingHttpStatusCodeException, return (HtmlTable) getHtmlPage(" http://foobar.com/ ") private synchronized HtmlPage getHtmlPage(String urlStr) thanks.

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit in Multi-Threaded Environment
mail.body: Hey Chris, If the intent is just to save the authentication time try caching the cookies and create new webClient per thread, this however can be a bit memory intensive depending upon the what you are browsing. To get the cookies after the authentication try Set<Cookie> cookie = webClient .getCookieManager().getCookies() To set the cookies to try Regards, Raj Singh Sisodia From: chris daniel [mailto:achris1985@...] Sent: 27 February 2012 10:30 To: apcausey@...; htmlunit-user@... Subject: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit in Multi-Threaded Environment Anyone help me out for with the sample program On Sat, Feb 25, 2012 at 2:58 PM, chris daniel <achris1985@...>> wrote: Hi All, Can any one give a sample program that crawl the javascript web page [ http://www.chemistdirect.co.uk/search_results.php?q=cordless+hair+clipper ] On Fri, Feb 24, 2012 at 11:36 PM, Adam Causey <apcausey@...>> wrote: I am using HtmlUnit to screen scrape some webpages that are authentication protected. The way I am using HtmlUnit, I am caching an object that holds the WebClient as an instance variable. The cached object ("MyConnection") is returned for the same userid. This is to save processing time authenticating the user each time a page needed to be scraped (otherwise I would use stateless objects). I know that the WebClient is not thread-safe, and I am using synchronized on methods where it is accessed. However, is it necessary for me to synchronize the methods that do not manipulate the WebClient but do use other HtmlUnit objects (such as HtmlPage and HtmlTable)? mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit in Multi-Threaded Environment
mail.body: Hi, The webclient (instance of a browser) facilitates the programmer to scrape web pages. By default, it provides one window for you. The HTMLPage object are held within a webclient object. If you are looking at multiple threads using a single instance of WebClient, create a New window for each thread and use them. The other option is to instantiate a webclient for each thread and operate on them independently. I hope it answers your question. Cheers Vasu On Tue, Feb 28, 2012 at 6:54 PM, Adam Causey <apcausey@...> wrote: http://www.chemistdirect.co.uk/search_results.php?q=cordless+hair+clipper ] http://foobar.com/ ") http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfnl/114/51521223/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://bit.ly/bSMWd7 . http://bit.ly/yQC1oD . http://p.sf.net/sfu/learndevnow-d2d https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit in Multi-Threaded Environment
mail.body: Hi Chris, Try with this URL http://www.chemistdirect.co.uk/ajaxSearch.php?q=cordless+hair+clipper&page=1&ty=general&catid=0&ccnt=0&cname=&sort=&view=list&bw=&sid=&_=1330435933827 The actual data to be rendered on the screen comes as a JSON object. If you are looking only for the data, then use the above url to the JSON object and use a JSON parser to extract the data. Regards Vasu raj.sisodia@...> wrote: http://www.chemistdirect.co.uk/search_results.php?q=cordless+hair+clipper ] http://foobar.com/ ") http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfnl/114/51521223/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://bit.ly/bSMWd7 . http://bit.ly/yQC1oD . http://p.sf.net/sfu/learndevnow-d2d https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit in Multi-Threaded Environment
mail.body: So it sounds like HtmlPage definitely need to be synchronized then (looking at my example)? Is it safe to assume that any methods handling HtmlUnit objects should be synchronized in a multi-threaded environment? I'm trying to avoid having a new WebClient on each thread since I would have to authenticate the user on the website each time, slowing things down. Instead, I am planning to cache a WebClient instance for each user that I can reuse after they are authenticated to the website. On 2/28/12 8:50 AM, Vasudevan Comandur wrote: http://www.chemistdirect.co.uk/search_results.php?q=cordless+hair+clipper ] http://foobar.com/ ") http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfnl/114/51521223/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://bit.ly/bSMWd7 . http://bit.ly/yQC1oD . http://p.sf.net/sfu/learndevnow-d2d https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit in Multi-Threaded Environment
mail.body: Hi, If your concern is on the user authentication for each webclient, I suggest the following. * Use a webclient instance to authenticate with the site. * Store the cookies sent by the web server. * For each thread that instantiates a new WebClient, add the stored cookie value as part of Request header and send it. This way, the web server will not send any challenge. By this approach, you can open a new webclient instance per thread and work independently without synchronization. Regards Vasu On Tue, Feb 28, 2012 at 7:31 PM, Adam Causey <apcausey@...> wrote: http://www.chemistdirect.co.uk/search_results.php?q=cordless+hair+clipper http://foobar.com/ ") http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfnl/114/51521223/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://bit.ly/bSMWd7 . http://bit.ly/yQC1oD . http://p.sf.net/sfu/learndevnow-d2d https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://p.sf.net/sfu/learndevnow-d2d https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit in Multi-Threaded Environment
mail.body: Adam, My bad I wrote Chris’s name instead of yours. The solution I am suggesting is for multithreaded environment only. I do not think that using synchronization will help as the internal state of the webClient and object it depends on (like JS Engine) need to change with user operations. From your question it seems you are more interested in avoiding re-authentication. The cookieManager approach suits best in such situation. Regards, Raj Singh Sisodia From: Adam Causey [mailto:apcausey@...] Sent: 28 February 2012 18:55 To: htmlunit-user@... Subject: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit in Multi-Threaded Environment Can anyone give advice on my original question regarding the use of HtmlUnit in a multi-threaded environment? I'm not sure Chris's comments were exactly related to the original question that I had. mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] random differences on asText() output
mail.body: Hi, I'm using htmlunit 2.9 to do regression tests comparing the asText() output of a Page. However, sometimes (and I mean at random times) I got different outputs for the same table html, for example. It seems to add or remove spaces at random, for example the following html 0 0 0 0 is translated to: FooBar A&T-Test Table Service 0 0 0 0 but sometimes as. FooBar A&T-Test Table Service 0 0 0 0 they look the same but there's a missing space after the third zero on the second case. This happens exclusively on tables, but the weird thing is that this difference happens at random times with a very low frequency. do you have any clue why this could be happening? Thanks

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] random differences on asText() output
mail.body: >However, sometimes (and I mean at random times) I got different Sounds interesting, if you are able to build a testcase that reproduces the problem, i will try to fix it. RBRi -------------------------- Wetator Smart web application testing http://www.wetator.org

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlPage.loadExternalJavaScriptFile throws an IOException (status 204) on a Google Maps api script call
mail.body: Hello everybody, I've created a web site using gwt 2.x and gwt google-maps api (v2). To make the website crawlable by Google, as advised by the spec "Making Ajax Applications Crawlable" (see http://code.google.com/intl/fr/web/ajaxcrawling/docs/html-snapshot.html ), I've tried to make an Html snapshot with HtmlUnit of my home page : /** * @param args */ final WebClient webClient = new //webClient.setAjaxController(new webClient.setAlertHandler(new final HtmlPage homePage = webClient.getPage(" http://www.mywebsite.org/?locale=en#!home The generated page is incomplete. mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] works for one site but not for another
mail.body: Hi HtmlUnit Users, I have had my share of issues with htmlunit, but mostly I have been able to resolve them, until this one which I cannot seem to get by with. As a test I am trying to parse this link : http://www.hyderabad.aero/liveflight-information.aspx And to see if the data for arrival flights has been loaded or not. I have tried : 1) NicelyResynchronizingAjaxController 2) waitForBackgroundJavaScript 3) waitForBackgroundJavaScriptStartingBefore For the third option it blocks infinitely. So I tried this bit after loading the page : int retry_idx = while (retry_idx > 0) if (retry_idx == 0) synchronized (page) try catch (InterruptedException e) But here the value in retry_idx was always 9, and I noticed there were nine external js / css / ico file links in <head> tag for the page. Now the interesting thing is my code works for another website that has same template applied to it : http://www.newdelhiairport.in/liveflight-information.aspx Now I am able to load the arrival flight data from this website, which is in the : Can anyone please check the reason for this inconsistency. One thing I have noticed is hyderabad.aero site has 2 css files loaded twice in <head> tag. Looking for some help. Thanks Prashant

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Regarding determination of downloads
mail.body: Respected sir, I have heard about the HTMLUnit a lot. I am doing research as part of my M.Tech. Thesis in cyber security. Sir, I would like to know if I initialize javascript and ActiveX (or rleated plugin), is it possible by any means to determine(using htmlunit) if the URL I visit through htmlunit downloads any binary/executable in my system or remotely or locally executes any binary on the system. Quite urgent. Warm Regards Anu

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Constructor of WebClient takes long time
mail.body: Hello, trying to use HtmlUnit from inside of my Web App. Looks like it works so far. The only thing with bothers me is that I need to create an instance of WebClient each request (since it is not thread save) and just this line takes almost a second Start time in mlsek: 1330709360264 After constructor time in mlsek: 1330709361074 I guess this is not normal, but I have no clue what could be wrong here. Does anybody has any idea how to fix it?

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Constructor of WebClient takes long time
mail.body: please provide the entire code On Fri, Mar 2, 2012 at 11:01 PM, Eugene Strokin <eugene@...> wrote: http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfnl/114/51521223/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user -- *" What we sow we will reap."*

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Constructor of WebClient takes long time
mail.body: 4 things, 2 good and 2 bad. Bad: Even if you disable javascript, css, and outputting all of the warnings - it will still take around a second or more (depending on as which browser you spawn). Bad: If you spawn a lot of webClients that perform a lot of simultaneous connections there is a chance that one of them is gonna hang. Theoretically there is webClient.setTimeout() but it doesn't work (I spent like 3 hours googling any workaround, without success), so a Thread that is without finish or possibility of error catch is dangerous. Good: it's a browser after all, so you can open many tabs at once (don't forget to use webClient.closeAllWindows() so garbage collector can collect). There isn't even much change in the code for you to make it work - just override the default constructor with one that gets you the same instance of webClient (such solution is called singleton). Good: if you have to browse really a lot of pages, and if the data you gather is not dependent on functionality of javascript - just spawn wget or curl - they are way faster (although without javascirpt support). Also, pattern + matcher to parse such downloaded file is faster too. Tom

mail.body: Hi, just to say that i too haven't overcome the same problem the problem is reported in http://code.google.com/p/googleappengine/issues/detail?id=5189 for two other web sites that return the sabe exception when fetched Thanks!

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Failed to Crawl the page
mail.body: Hi Guys, I tried to crawl the javascript page http://www.buy.com/sr/searchresults.aspx?qu=sony&qxt=home&display=col&&resultCount=5&gsap=1.Butam not getting the exact HTML Source code.please help me out -- *" What we sow we will reap."*

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Failed to Crawl the page
mail.body: Hi Chris, Please read: - http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/faq.html#AJAXDoesNotWork - http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/submittingJSBugs.html Yours, Ahmed ________________________________ To: htmlunit-user@... Sent: Friday, April 27, 2012 10:05 AM Subject: [Htmlunit-user] Failed to Crawl the page Hi Guys, I tried to crawl the javascript page http://www.buy.com/sr/searchresults.aspx?qu=sony&qxt=home&display=col&&resultCount=5&gsap=1.But am not getting the exact HTML Source code.please help me out -- " What we sow we will reap." ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Live Security Virtual Conference Exclusive live event will cover all the ways today's security and threat landscape has changed and how IT managers can respond. Discussions will include endpoint security, mobile security and the latest in malware threats. http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ _______________________________________________ Htmlunit-user mailing list Htmlunit-user@... https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Cookie set twice in Request Header
mail.body: All, I am using HTMLUnit to extract content from a web server and pass it back to the client. My application will instantiate a new WEBClient for every user request, send the request, receive the response, save the cookie for received for this host, pass the response to the end user and close the WebClient instance and the thread dies. When the user initiates another request to this website, I create a new WebClient instance, add the saved Cookie in the request header, send the request. This Website was re-directing the request to another URL and had set some cookies in the REsponse Header. When HTMLUnit was sending the redirected URL request, it was setting two cookie headers and the host was rejecting the request with 500 Internal Error. I don't want to retain a WebClient instance for every host the user connects and instead I store only cookies for that host and it would save memory consumption. Can you suggest me a solution? Thanks in advance. Regards VAsu

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Cookie set twice in Request Header
mail.body: Hi Vasudevan, - Please use latest snapshot. - Please provide test case (preferably with server-side code), to take this further. - Check many cases in HtmlUnit test suite for similar examples. Yours, Ahmed ________________________________ To: htmlunit-user@... Sent: Thursday, April 26, 2012 3:30 PM Subject: [Htmlunit-user] Cookie set twice in Request Header All, I am using HTMLUnit to extract content from a web server and pass it back to the client. My application will instantiate a new WEBClient for every user request, send the request, receive the response, save the cookie for received for this host, pass the response to the end user and close the WebClient instance and the thread dies. When the user initiates another request to this website, I create a new WebClient instance, add the saved Cookie in the request header, send the request. This Website was re-directing the request to another URL and had set some cookies in the REsponse Header. When HTMLUnit was sending the redirected URL request, it was setting two cookie headers and the host was rejecting the request with 500 Internal Error. I don't want to retain a WebClient instance for every host the user connects and instead I store only cookies for that host and it would save memory consumption. Can you suggest me a solution? Thanks in advance. Regards VAsu ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Live Security Virtual Conference Exclusive live event will cover all the ways today's security and threat landscape has changed and how IT managers can respond. Discussions will include endpoint security, mobile security and the latest in malware threats. http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ _______________________________________________ Htmlunit-user mailing list Htmlunit-user@... https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Cookie set twice in Request Header
mail.body: Hi Ahmed, I tried with the latest successful build 1955 and the problem exists. I am making calls to HTMLUnit from Clojure Programming language. I am making the following HTMLUnit Calls 1. Create WebClient Instance 2. Made getPage call with the URL passed 3. Extract the cookie using webclient.cookiemanager.getcookies. 4. Save the cookie as a String. 5. CloseAllWindows. Second Request comes from the client for the same host 1. Create a new WebClient Instance 2. Add Request Header ("Cookie") and passed the saved Cookie 3. getPage call with the URL Passed 4. mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Cookie set twice in Request Header
mail.body: Hi Vasu, I see your point, which is a potential bug. It is recommended to use webClient.getCookieManager().addCookie() instead, give it a try please till I investigate further how best to handle your original case. Yours, Ahmed ________________________________ To: Ahmed Ashour <asashour@...>; htmlunit-user@... mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] JavascriptException: TypeError: Cannot find function
mail.body: Hello, I have a GWT application and I am trying to make it crawlable using your library. I have the next Java code to do it: * @Override public void doFilter(ServletRequest request, ServletResponse response, // Comprueba si Google puede acceder al contenido de la web // Generamos un HTML para FIREFOX_3.6 // Espera un tiempo aleatorio para que el script haya podido terminar su ejecución // En el caso de que los HTML no estén completos será necesario incrementar el número // Envia al Crawler un HTML captura de la página real logger.info("Se va a proceder a generar una captura HTML de la página: out.println("<center><h3>"+textos.getString("MensajeHTMLGenerado")+" <a href=\"" logger.error("Se ha producido un error al capturar un HTML de una página. * * * In my HTML file I have some external javascript includes like google_adsense scripts. When the crawler tries to read my page, I get the next exception: ======= EXCEPTION START ======== Exception class=[net.sourceforge.htmlunit.corejs.javascript.JavaScriptException] com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.ScriptException: TypeError: Cannot find function R in object [object Object]. ( https://apis.google.com/_/apps-static/_/js/gapi/gcm_ppb,googleapis_client,plusone/rt=j/ver=jX0cOZjLD0U.de./sv=1/am=!-SXmuOx1_3GIepEFVA/d=1/rs=AItRSTMFNHi5PCal4c4gJM1RJYloNTYqig/cb=gapi.loaded0#3 ) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.JavaScriptEngine$HtmlUnitContextAction.run(JavaScriptEngine.java:601) at net.sourceforge.htmlunit.corejs.javascript.Context.call(Context.java:537) at net.sourceforge.htmlunit.corejs.javascript.ContextFactory.call(ContextFactory.java:538) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.JavaScriptEngine.execute(JavaScriptEngine.java:499) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HtmlPage.loadExternalJavaScriptFile(HtmlPage.java:970) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HtmlScript.executeScriptIfNeeded(HtmlScript.java:363) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HtmlScript$1.execute(HtmlScript.java:235) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.JavaScriptEngine.doProcessPostponedActions(JavaScriptEngine.java:644) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.JavaScriptEngine.access$400(JavaScriptEngine.java:78) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.JavaScriptEngine$HtmlUnitContextAction.run(JavaScriptEngine.java:596) at net.sourceforge.htmlunit.corejs.javascript.Context.call(Context.java:537) at net.sourceforge.htmlunit.corejs.javascript.ContextFactory.call(ContextFactory.java:538) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.JavaScriptEngine.execute(JavaScriptEngine.java:499) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HtmlPage.loadExternalJavaScriptFile(HtmlPage.java:970) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HtmlScript.executeScriptIfNeeded(HtmlScript.java:363) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HtmlScript$1.execute(HtmlScript.java:235) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HtmlScript.onAllChildrenAddedToPage(HtmlScript.java:245) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HTMLParser$HtmlUnitDOMBuilder.endElement(HTMLParser.java:578) at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.endElement(Unknown Source) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HTMLParser$HtmlUnitDOMBuilder.endElement(HTMLParser.java:536) at org.cyberneko.html.HTMLTagBalancer.callEndElement(HTMLTagBalancer.java:1132) at mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Reg HtmlSelect onchange, java script function call failure
mail.body: Hi All, Can any one help me please? It is very urgent requirement for me. My code is as follows : selectPrimaryAccount = (HtmlSelect) fedexBillOnlinePage. optionChangePage = (HtmlPage) ' the drop down is pointing to '2001'. I have printed 'fedexBillOnlinePage' as Text and noted this value also. When we change any option (let say, I selected "2002") in the drop down 'selectPrimaryAccount', the full form gets re submitted and returns new page. In the returned new page, the drop down points to the new changed value (i.e., "2002"). But in my code when I print HtmlPage as Text, the new returned page 'optionChangePage' is also pointing to '2001'. It means that I am not getting the new returned page, rather it was point to old page only. I could not to understand where is the problem. May be the defined java script functions are not getting called on changing the drop down option.... Can any one help me please? It is very urgent requirement for me. I even tried the following, but no use. Still 'optionChangePage' is pointing to '2001' only. for (HtmlOption optionAccount : selectPrimaryAccount. optionChangePage= (HtmlPage) The following is the drop down 'selectPrimaryAccount' definition on the webpage : float:right;width:180px;" size="1" onfocus="setFocus(this.id);" onchange="setFocus('');iceSubmitPartial(form, Thanks in advance. Regards, Kishore Babu M. N.

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] question regarding access shibboleth protected resource
mail.body: Hello: I am using HTMLUnit to access one of our website, basically log in and then strip the content of a page. Recently the website is switching to shibboleth, and the code can no longer access the resource ("You are not allowed"). Seems the shibboleth session (or credentials) passing is not transparent to HTMLUnit. Please help if you know how to use HTMLUnit to authenticate properly to shibboleth and keep the credentials during the session. Many thanks. -- Eric Zhao Application Developer IITS, University of Toronto Scarborough

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Urlencoding difference between Firefox and Htmlunit
mail.body: Hi all, Htmlunit (BrowserVersion.FIREFOX_3_6) and Firefox do not encode URL the same way: I have a UTF-8 file "charset.php": =========================== href="charset.php?a=è">LATIN SMALL LETTER E WITH GRAVE</a></body></html>=========================== And when I fetch it using htmlunit: =========================== HtmlElement a = (HtmlElement) ((HtmlPage) =========================== The link followed is "charset.php?a=%E8" but with Firefox, the link followed is "charset.php?a=%C3%A8". On the other hand, when the meta tag is not present in the HTML file, Htmlunit and Firefox fetch the same URL ("charset.php?a=%C3%A8"). Is this the intended behaviour, or is this a bug ? Regards, rmillet

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] FireFox3.6 - Disable Flash

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] FireFox3.6 - Disable Flash

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Understanding clicks
mail.body: Hello, I'm trying to understand how the click method works and why I'm getting different results with the same code in a semi-random way. Ok so first things first. I'll number my assumptions tell me if something is wrong: 1. When I use click() I'm triggering the onclick event in the page or doing a submit, depending on the input type. 2. The page the method outputs is the page the webclient currently has. This means that if the response hasn't come back yet it's just the old page. 3. You can only build WebRequests for posts and gets, not for javascript, ajax and such. 4. There is no method that waits until the response arrives. 5. In a HtmlSelect, the method setSelectedAttribute() triggers the onChange event. 6. The only ways to know the response has arrived is: - webClient.waitForBackgroundJavaScript(10000) or webClient.waitForBackgroundJavaScriptStartingBefore(10000); just after getting the page and before manipulating it. - Explicitly wait for a condition that is expected be fulfilled when your JavaScript runs 7. It is not necessary to use the HtmlPage output, somehow (how?) it points at the right object. All these are conclusions I reached while trying to work on the result of clicking on areas and dropdown boxes. They work perfectly if I run it in debug and have breakpoints. This I assume is a problem with time but I have sleeps of 10000 millis and it still doesn't work. If I use page.wait(1000) I get a: Exception in thread "main" java.lang.IllegalMonitorStateException at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method) If anyone could shine some light on the subject, even if it's just part of it, I would be very grateful. Sincerely, Margarida

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Understanding clicks
mail.body: Hi Margarida, have you tried using the NicelyResynchronizingAjaxController? try something like this causes htmlunit to process all JS before the click()-Method returns. The result of click() is the page after processing all ajax-Forwards, Redirect etc. Kind regards, Joey5337 -----Ursprüngliche Nachricht----- Gesendet: Fr 11.05.2012 13:12 Betreff: [Htmlunit-user] Understanding clicks http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Understanding clicks
mail.body: Thank you Joey! That totally worked! Margarida Date: Fri, 11 May 2012 15:55:04 +0200 Subject: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Understanding clicks To:htmlunit-user@... Message-ID: Content-Type: text/plain; charset=windows-1252 Hi Margarida, have you tried using the NicelyResynchronizingAjaxController? try something like this causes htmlunit to process all JS before the click()-Method returns. The result of click() is the page after processing all ajax-Forwards, Redirect etc. Kind regards, Joey5337 On 05/11/2012 02:12 PM, Margarida Faria wrote:

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlAnchor.click / Header Bug
mail.body: I'm looking into manually adding a header for Basic proxy authentication so I added this code: String userAndPasswordBase64 = Works great on my first webclient.getPage request. However, when you load the page and do an Anchor.click, it doesn't pass on the header with the web request. I wanted to do it this way because with my tests with authenticated http proxies and html unit, it seems like htmlunit is performing the request like so: request web page -> proxy server returns authentication request -> htmlunit re-requests the page with proxy authentication header. With current browsers (IE8, Latest FF), the browsers simply just add the proxy authentication on the first request thus saving a few seconds. thanks -- View this message in context: http://old.nabble.com/HtmlAnchor.click---Header-Bug-tp33763409p33763409.html Sent from the HtmlUnit - General mailing list archive at Nabble.com.

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlAnchor.click / Header Bug
mail.body: Hi Rey, There are two points you mentioned (if I correctly understood): 1- The first request, HTTP Header is sent, but further ones are not. Please provide minimal test case. 2- You want the first request to have the Auth header. From what I know, the real browsers first send empty request, and in the response they get the 'Realm' name, so they ask the user to put username/password and send them on the second request. I am not with changing the behavior of #2 unless we prove HtmlUnit behaves different than real browsers. Yours, Ahmed ________________________________ To: htmlunit-user@... Sent: Thursday, May 3, 2012 12:16 PM Subject: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlAnchor.click / Header Bug I'm looking into manually adding a header for Basic proxy authentication so I added this code: String userAndPassword = "username" + ":" + "password"; String userAndPasswordBase64 = Works great on my first webclient.getPage request. However, when you load the page and do an Anchor.click, it doesn't pass on the header with the web request. I wanted to do it this way because with my tests with authenticated http proxies and html unit, it seems like htmlunit is performing the request like so: request web page -> proxy server returns authentication request -> htmlunit re-requests the page with proxy authentication header. With current browsers (IE8, Latest FF), the browsers simply just add the proxy authentication on the first request thus saving a few seconds. thanks -- View this message in context: http://old.nabble.com/HtmlAnchor.click---Header-Bug-tp33763409p33763409.html Sent from the HtmlUnit - General mailing list archive at Nabble.com. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Live Security Virtual Conference Exclusive live event will cover all the ways today's security and threat landscape has changed and how IT managers can respond. Discussions will include endpoint security, mobile security and the latest in malware threats. http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ _______________________________________________ Htmlunit-user mailing list Htmlunit-user@... https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlAnchor.click / Header Bug
mail.body: Hi Ahmed, I think that I've already encountered the problem. If I correctly remember, it is correct for HtmlUnit to first send username/password when it has been asked for it BUT then it should be directly sent for all(?) requests for the domain (not sure wether domain is the right restriction here). Cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com Le 05/05/2012 13:47, Ahmed Ashour a écrit :

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlAnchor.click / Header Bug
mail.body: Hi all, I verified, and you are right. HtmlUnit always sends the request without authorization string. Only when the server asks for authorization, the header is sent. This should happen only once, per domain. I will check how to handle. Ahmed ________________________________ To: htmlunit-user@... Sent: Tuesday, May 8, 2012 9:12 AM Subject: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlAnchor.click / Header Bug Hi Ahmed, I think that I've already encountered the problem. If I correctly remember, it is correct for HtmlUnit to first send username/password when it has been asked for it BUT then it should be directly sent for all(?) requests for the domain (not sure wether domain is the right restriction here). mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlAnchor.click / Header Bug
mail.body: Hi Sorry, english is not my first language so my explanations may not be that clear. I apologize for that. 1. Sure. Should I just reply back here with the minimal test case or is there a section for that? 2. Yes, when you add an authenticated proxy to a browser and then go to a web page, it does pop up an empty web request and the proxy server sends a reply asking for authentication. However, this is only done once. Subsequent requests to webpages or other websites should then contain the authentication header. Htmlunit however doesn't do this. I have verified this with an http analyzer + latest internet explorer and firefox. I can post raw http logs for you if needed. Thank you for your time! Rey Ahmed Ashour wrote: http://old.nabble.com/HtmlAnchor.click---Header-Bug-tp33763409p33763409.html http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user -- View this message in context: http://old.nabble.com/HtmlAnchor.click---Header-Bug-tp33763409p33802819.html Sent from the HtmlUnit - General mailing list archive at Nabble.com.

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Click() on HtmlArea and nothing changes, why?
mail.body: Hello! I have ran into trouble when I try to click an area with javaScript. Here is the code: /** * @param args * @throws IOException * @throws MalformedURLException * @throws FailingHttpStatusCodeException */ page = webClient.getPage(" http://www.hidrografico.pt/previsao-mares.php | I don't show it here but I double-check in my full code that I'm really not in the page I want. What is happening? Why doesn't the click work? Thank you in advance, Margarida Faria

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Problems using getFirstChild on HtmlDivision
mail.body: Hello everyone! I'm building my first screenscrapper with HtmlUnit and ran into some trouble when I first needed the getFirstChild function. Here is the code: page = webClient.getPage(" http://www.hidrografico.pt/previsao-mares.php // Double check that we are in the right port I'm running this in Eclipse and the strange thing is that when I run it in Run mode it gives a NullPointerException but when I run it in Debug mode it runs just fine. Is there any tweak that I'm missing? Does the code need more time to run the getFirstChild method? Thank you for any help. Sincerely, Margarida Faria

com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.JavaScriptEngine$HtmlUnitContextAction.run(JavaScriptEngine.java:589) at net.sourceforge.htmlunit.corejs.javascript.Context.call(Context.java:537) at net.sourceforge.htmlunit.corejs.javascript.ContextFactory.call(ContextFactory.java:538) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.JavaScriptEngine.callFunction(JavaScriptEngine.java:545) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.JavaScriptEngine.callFunction(JavaScriptEngine.java:520) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HtmlPage.executeJavaScriptFunctionIfPossible(HtmlPage.java:896) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.background.JavaScriptFunctionJob.runJavaScript(JavaScriptFunctionJob.java:53) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.background.JavaScriptExecutionJob.run(JavaScriptExecutionJob.java:84) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.background.JavaScriptJobManagerImpl.runSingleJob(JavaScriptJobManagerImpl.java:313) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.background.JavaScriptExecutor.run(JavaScriptExecutor.java:148) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662) == CALLING JAVASCRIPT == The source of the problem is in this wicket javascript sniplet: // Completes the multipart ajax handling started via handleMultipart() var iframe=event.srcElement ... // process the response ... // remove the iframe and button elements Line 1275 is the removeChild(iframe). So is HtmlUnit right with the exception? The iframe is created in another part, and it turns out that it is added to the body of the document: ... ... Debugging handleMultipartComplete shows that iframe indeed has the body as the parent. So it seems that HtmlUnit is incorrect in throwing that exception. However, strange is that neither Chrome nor Firefox seem to execute line 1275, or at least a breakpoint in that block never breaks the execution. So my indecision on whether this is a Wicket or HtmlUnit problem is now leaning towards HtmlUnit. Any insights? Tom

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Cannot call method "removeChild" of null
mail.body: I've tested with the latest HtmlUnit and the issue is still present. I'm a bit hesitant trying to extract a minimal testcase, since the javascript code is all generated by the Wicket framework and I'm not very fluent in Wicket yet. Putting in the effort is also a questionable investment, because the code that I'm unit testing actually is a workaround ( https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/WICKET-4469 ) for a bug in GlassFish 3.1.2 ( http://java.net/jira/browse/GLASSFISH-18444 ), which I expect to be fixed very soon. mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Dynamic BrowserVersion
mail.body: Hello, I need HtmlUnit to mimic various Browsers, which usually could be done by customized instances of com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.BrowserVersion. Unfortunately, I don't have a fixed Set of Browsers, I need to dynamically construct new BrowserVersion-Objects according to a HttpServletRequest, I got from the browser. (Think of me as a man in the middle - whitehead) BrowserVersion's documentation points to a cgi which would be a good starting point for my code: http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/cgi-bin/browserVersion Question: Could anybody reveal the sources of the cgi-Script to me? Thanks in advance, htmlunit is a beautiful piece of software, Joey5337

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Dynamic BrowserVersion
mail.body: Hi Tilo, I have to say this is now obsolete. You should use one of the predefined BrowserVersion, otherwise you will have 'no features'. Ideally you should read the User-Agent header from the request, and get the corresponding BrowserVersion. Hope that helps. Just FYI, the code is below. ------------------------------------------- #!/usr/bin/perl print <<HTMLEND "<script type="text/javascript">document.write(navigator.appName)</script>", "<script type="text/javascript">document.write(navigator.appVersion)</script>", "<script type="text/javascript">document.write(version)</script>" HTMLEND ------------------------------------------- ________________________________ Sent: Wednesday, May 2, 2012 2:04 PM Subject: [Htmlunit-user] Dynamic BrowserVersion Hello, I need HtmlUnit to mimic various Browsers, which usually could be done by customized instances of com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.BrowserVersion. Unfortunately, I don't have a fixed Set of Browsers, I need to dynamically construct new BrowserVersion-Objects according to a HttpServletRequest, I got from the browser. (Think of me as a man in the middle - whitehead) BrowserVersion's documentation points to a cgi which would be a good starting point for my code: http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/cgi-bin/browserVersion Question: Could anybody reveal the sources of the cgi-Script to me? Thanks in advance, htmlunit is a beautiful piece of software, Joey5337 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Live Security Virtual Conference Exclusive live event will cover all the ways today's security and threat landscape has changed and how IT managers can respond. Discussions will include endpoint security, mobile security and the latest in malware threats. http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ _______________________________________________ Htmlunit-user mailing list Htmlunit-user@... https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Dynamic BrowserVersion
mail.body: Hello, thank you so far. The features-feature is pretty cool. Unfortunately BrowserVersion is somewhat restricted. * The public constructors are useless, because they return instances without 'features'. * The public static members FIREFOX_3_6, INTERNET_EXPLORER_6 etc. must not be modified, because they are singletons * BrowserVersion does not implement cloneable (imho a good thing) * It's hard to subclass, because features_ and initDefaultFeatures() are private, also isIE() and isFirefox() are final. Those problems could be addressed with a Copy-Constructor. Optional, a best-effort factory-Method taking an UserAgent-String would be very nice. Meanwhile I'm doing some workarounds. I plan to post working code if everything works as suggested. Thanks, Joey5337 -----Ursprüngliche Nachricht----- Gesendet: Mi 02.05.2012 12:13 Betreff: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Dynamic BrowserVersion Anlage: inline.txt,inline.txt http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/cgi-bin/browserVersion http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Merging Cache objects from different WebClients
mail.body: Hello guys, I participate in project where we need to create few objects of WebClients. After using them to fetch websites we need to merge their content. If needed we will use that "merged cache" to fetch other websites within the same domain. Is there any elegant way to merge two cache objects? Thanks in advance, Marcin Wcislo.

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Merging Cache objects from different WebClients

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] BrowserVersion-Object
mail.body: Hello, I suggest to extend the class com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.BrowserVersion with a copy-Contructor like this: /** * Copy constructor. * Creates a new BrowserVersion-Object copying all values from the given instance. * @param copyFrom BrowserVersion-Object to copy from. */ Motivation: BrowserVersion has public static members FIREFOX_3_6, INTERNET_EXPLORER_6, INTERNET_EXPLORER_7 and INTERNET_EXPLORER_8, which represent browser with different abilities. These members are initialized statically and are real singletons. It is possible to modifiy these objects, e.g. the User-Agent-String, if you need only one modified Object. If you need multiple modified Objects (e.g. dynamic UserAgent-Strings) you're on your own. You may use the regular public constructors, but then you have to specifiy all of its capbilities. The Copy-Constructor would allow you to use an existing (supported & bugfixed) Browser-Version-Object as template and just modify the things you want to change. There should be no impact on other classes. It is still possiblie to modify the public static singletons. What do you think about this suggestion? Thanks, Joey5337

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] BrowserVersion-Object
mail.body: Hi Tilo, You can construct using something like: What is the added value, other than changing the UserAgent? The 'features' is the main concern and their corresponding source code logic. Yours, Ahmed ________________________________ Sent: Tuesday, June 12, 2012 3:55 PM Subject: [Htmlunit-user] BrowserVersion-Object Hello, I suggest to extend the class com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.BrowserVersion with a copy-Contructor like this: /** * Copy constructor. * Creates a new BrowserVersion-Object copying all values from the given instance. * @param copyFrom BrowserVersion-Object to copy from. */ Motivation: BrowserVersion has public static members FIREFOX_3_6, INTERNET_EXPLORER_6, INTERNET_EXPLORER_7 and INTERNET_EXPLORER_8, which represent browser with different abilities. These members are initialized statically and are real singletons. It is possible to modifiy these objects, e.g. the User-Agent-String, if you need only one modified Object. If you need multiple modified Objects (e.g. dynamic UserAgent-Strings) you're on your own. You may use the regular public constructors, but then you have to specifiy all of its capbilities. The Copy-Constructor would allow you to use an existing (supported & bugfixed) Browser-Version-Object as template and just modify the things you want to change. There should be no impact on other classes. It is still possiblie to modify the public static singletons. What do you think about this suggestion? Thanks, Joey5337 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Live Security Virtual Conference Exclusive live event will cover all the ways today's security and threat landscape has changed and how IT managers can respond. Discussions will include endpoint security, mobile security and the latest in malware threats. http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ _______________________________________________ Htmlunit-user mailing list Htmlunit-user@... https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] BrowserVersion-Object
mail.body: Hi Tilo, What drawbacks of current BrowserVersion implementation, other than User-Agent? To really make a new browser, you should change many other places of the source code, which should be submitted as patches, not by changing only BrowserVersion class. To re-use features, you can use: BrowserVersion version = new BrowserVersion(ff.getApplicationName(), //change the behavior here Yours, Ahmed ________________________________ Sent: Thursday, June 14, 2012 12:17 PM Subject: AW: [Htmlunit-user] BrowserVersion-Object Hi Ahmed, As I read the code, the resulting Object "version" wouldn't have any features. OK, I could extract the feature-list of a BrowserVersion-Template by Iterating over BrowserVersionFeatures, use hasFeature(), create an Array of these and use as additional constructor-Parameter. But this is quite tedious and I don't want to see these BrowserVersion-Details outside of the BrowserVersion- or BrowserVersionFeatures Class. Also this option wasn't obvious to me. In my opinion, the 4-parameter constructor (params applicationName, applicationVersion, userAgent, browserVersionNumeric) should be abandoned/made deprecated, as it returns a rather useless object and there is no way to modify the features later. Alternatives to the copy constructor would be: 1. a static factory taking a BrowserVersion-Template. Personally I prefer this style and it is technically on par with the copy-Constructor, but the current creation-style is constructor, not static factories. 2. Additional static factories-Methods for Create_FIREFOX_x(), INTERNET_EXPLORER_x() etc. This would beautify the initialization of the static members, but bloats the public interface and code. 3. a clone()-Method - but this is very tricky to implement. I would never do this. I solved the problem by extending BrowserVersion and copying nearly all of it's code to my own class. Thank god you did't make BrowserVersion final. But this is a hack and will break if BrowserVersion is extended beyond the Features-Feature :-) My motivation here is to improve htmlunit - a really cool and useful library. Could I convince you? Thanks, Tilo

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] BrowserVersion-Object
mail.body: Hi Tilo, Hope you have read my last post. You can use: create a new web browser with exactly User Agent with almost similar features. BrowserVersion version = new BrowserVersion(ff.getApplicationName(), else .... ---- Blog: http://asashour.blogspot.com ________________________________ Sent: Saturday, June 16, 2012 1:04 PM Subject: AW: [Htmlunit-user] BrowserVersion-Object Hi Ahmed, thank you for your response. None. At least none I know of. Yes, I understand this and I don't want to do it. Perhaps I must explain my usage scenario and why I want to clone BrowserVersion Objects. My application is a Single-Sign-On-Setup running at a Proxy-Server. Users surf to my login-page and enter their credentials. I authenticate/authorize the credentials and redirect them to a third party Web-Application. When the users Browser opens this Web-Application, he should be magically logged in already. How does this work? My program uses htmlunit to open the Web-Application, fill in the users credentials and submit the form. I take the cookies htmlunit has collected and send them to the users browser by showing him 1x1-pictures for the domains the application is using. Finally I redirect the user to the application where he is already logged in. I want that the Third-Party-Application cannot distinguish me from the users Browser, so I have to configure the WebClient to behave like the users Browser. I don't know much about the differences between Browsers. I know there are many differences but the most obvious is the UserAgent-String. htmlunit contains some preconfigured BrowserVersion-Objects which perfectly emulate some popular Browsers. This is sufficient for me if I can change the userAgent-String. My first Idea was something like this: // returns one of BrowserVersion public static Members. Most simplest Implementation: 3. bv.setUserAgent(ua); // FORBIDDEN! // customize bv - UserAgent is the only thing I know of ... This code does not work, because I must not modify the bv-Object, because it is a global singleton. I need to defensively copy the bv-Object first and a copy-Constructor would be the easiest solution to this. Total effort (in my code) would be 1 line. The copy-Constructor respects BrowserVersion's encapsulation of it's inner details like _features and everything else I don't know about. At this point my alternatives are: A. Modify the BrowserVersion-Class and add the Copy-Constructor. I'm trying to convince you to do this for me. :-) B. Create a Proxying Facade for BrowserVersion which would intercept UserAgent and redirect everything else to a backing Object. Unfortunately there is no BrowserVersion-Interface. C. Create a BrowserVersion2-Class which extends BrowserVersion. Coding this class was easy: I copy-pasted EVERYTHING from the original BrowserVersion-Class, added a copy-Constructor (and a guessByUserAgentString-Factory-Method). Well, extend isn't the right word, it doesn't use anything of the superclass any more. The right word would be "stealing the interface", so it can be handed out to htmlunit. C. is how I bypassed the missing copy-Constructor. I've only done this hack because I needed a quick solution and I'm unable to change BrowserVersion itself. Others shouldn't be forced to go this way. Also I'm quite hesitant to extend other classes I don't fully understand. "Design and document for inheritance or else prohibit it" (Joshua Bloch, Effective Java). This is my reason why I want a copy-Constructor. I also think it may be useful to other people. A copy-Constructor or Factory-Method doesn't do any harm outside the BrowserVersion-Class. The single point against a copy-constructor is the need to maintain it, when BrowserVersion gets additional private members. But when you add new private members to a class you must check it's constructors anyway. I hope I could convince you for this change. Yours, Tilo

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] htmlunit cut html source when it's too long?
mail.body: Rural, On 6/16/12 1:58 AM, Rural Hunter wrote: I took a look at that URL and there is, indeed, javascript involved, including an window.onload function that appears to modify the document. mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] server side javascript
mail.body: I want to be able to run javascript on the server to manipulate the DOM before sending it to the client. Rhino can be used to run javascript on the server but my impression is that it does not also contain a browser DOM. So if I wanted to run some javascript that manipulates the DOM I would need some DOM api implementation. Does that sound right? I have heard that htmlunit's DOM implementation is pretty comprehensive. Is it something that can be easily pulled out of htmlunit and used alone? Mike Power

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] server side javascript
mail.body: Hi Mike, DOM is different than JavaScript. You can use HtmlUnit, and remove whatever not needed from it source code. Ahmed ________________________________ To: htmlunit-user@... Sent: Wednesday, June 20, 2012 7:07 AM Subject: [Htmlunit-user] server side javascript I want to be able to run javascript on the server to manipulate the DOM before sending it to the client. Rhino can be used to run javascript on the server but my impression is that it does not also contain a browser DOM. So if I wanted to run some javascript that manipulates the DOM I would need some DOM api implementation. Does that sound right? I have heard that htmlunit's DOM implementation is pretty comprehensive. Is it something that can be easily pulled out of htmlunit and used alone? mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] htmlunit cut html source when it's too long?
mail.body: Ahmed, On 6/20/12 3:28 PM, Ahmed Ashour wrote: I'm in favor of better emulation of actual browsers as default behavior, as long as it's simple and documented how to override that behavior. One thing I've found valuable with htmlunit in the past is the ability to do things that are difficult to do with a "real" browser. - George -- ---------------------------------------------------------------------- * George Dinwiddie * http://blog.gdinwiddie.com Software Development http://www.idiacomputing.com Consultant and Coach http://www.agilemaryland.org ----------------------------------------------------------------------

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] choose socks version?
mail.body: Hello I tried to use HTMLUnit with socks proxy and it worked, it looks like it uses SOCKS5 by default. Is there anyway to make it use SOCKS4a? Regards!

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] choose socks version?
mail.body: Hi, HtmlUnit uses the default implementation of HttpClient. Could you provide external access to your proxy, so we can test. Ahmed ________________________________ To: htmlunit-user@... Sent: Wednesday, June 20, 2012 6:36 AM Subject: [Htmlunit-user] choose socks version? Hello I tried to use HTMLUnit with socks proxy and it worked, it looks like it uses SOCKS5 by default. Is there anyway to make it use SOCKS4a? mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] [ANN] Wetator 0.9.6 released
mail.body: Wetator version 0.9.6 is available. Wetator is a tool for automatic Graphical User Interface (GUI) tests of web applications. It provides you with a simple command language for writing your tests, that * maps the typical user actions (open-url, click-on, select, set...) and * includes commands to check the page content (assert-content, assert-title...). This human readable language enables you to specify test cases that are easy to write and easy to read. Wetator tests are executed using HtmlUnit, a Java based framework which is able to simulate the most popular web browsers (Firefox, Internet Explorer). The test result is summarized in a well-arranged report containing detailed information about the test run and snapshots for each step. Read more about Wetator at http://www.wetator.org RBRi -------------------------- Wetator Smart web application testing http://www.wetator.org

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] using HtmlUnit 2.9 with HTML5
mail.body: Hello, Has anybody had any luck with using HtmlUnit 2.9 in an application that uses HTML 5 canvas? I'm not trying to test canvas-related functionality. I just want my tests to continue to run with canvas present. I've been investigating it for several hours without success. Here's what I found so far: - With default settings (which is currently BrowserVersion.INTERNET_EXPLORER_7), trying to open a page drawing on a canvas results in "TypeError: Cannot find function getContext in object [object]". - The only non-deprecated BrowserVersion with canvas support enabled in HtmlUnit 2.9 is FIREFOX_3_6. I have other issues with it related to XPath handling. - There are also FIREFOX_10 and CHROME_16 but they are available only in snapshot version and marked as experimental. - There is an option to setThrowExceptionOnScriptError(false) on WebClient but it only prevents Exception to be thrown in Java and the underlying JavaScript fails affecting test results. - I tried to create custom BrowserVersion in different ways but it didn't work. For example manually adding BrowserVersionFeatures.CANVAS to INTERNET_EXPLORER_8 is not enough to enable canvas support. It seems that it will work only with BrowserVersion's applicationName set to "Netscape". Has anybody had more luck than me in finding a solution? Perhaps the more generic question would be what is a recommended way to use modern browser features in the most recent stable version of HtmlUnit (2.9)? All provided BrowserVersion constants are quite old. Thanks, Piotr

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] using HtmlUnit 2.9 with HTML5
mail.body: Hi Piotr, - does IE7 support Canvas? If yes, then HtmlUnit should do the same when simulating IE7 (I don't have IE and can't test it). Feel free to open a bug for that. - please open an issue for XPath problems you have when simulating FF3.6 - snapshots are successful builds and therefore exactly as good as releases. FF10 and Chrome16 are still marked as experimental because we haven't yet had time to run all tests in these browsers and to verify (and fix) the expectations for these browsers. This being said, it may already be good enough for your use. - creating custom browser version is not that easy: it is not only setting an other User-Agent header. You have to configure the right settings in the JavaScriptConfiguration.xml as well as the right properties (see the FFxx.properties files). More generally the best way to help HtmlUnit to progress is to open an issue with a unit test (and even better with a patch fixing the problem ;-)). Cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com Le 03/06/2012 22:07, Piotr Jagielski a écrit :

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] using HtmlUnit 2.9 with HTML5
mail.body: Thank you for the response. - I don't have IE7 but it doesn't support canvas according to Wikipedia. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Html5_canvas#Support - I'll see if I can reproduce issues with FF3.6 on some minimal data set and submit a bug report with test case if I succeed. - I'm not comfortable with using snapshot version that may change behavior any time. Are you planning to do a release any time soon? - I figured out the properties file part but I wasn't aware that I have to configure some XML as well. Thanks. Regards, Piotr On 2012-06-04 08:32, Marc Guillemot wrote:

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit - 1. parsing JSON and 2. JavaScript Configuration-xml file
mail.body: Hi, I am developing an application using HtmlUnit v2.9. I ran into errors when the web-response was of type "application/JSON" and not JavaScript or ECMAScript I would greatly appreciate your help in: 1. How can I get HtmlUnit to process responses in JSON? Are there any hooks provide handlers, like ResponseHandler in Apache HttpClient API? 2. Preparing the JavaScript Configuration-xml file - Where is the schema available for this? Will such configuration help in processing JSON response of the type I described in the first para. Thanks, Satya

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit - 1. parsing JSON and 2. JavaScript Configuration-xml file
mail.body: Hi, HTMLUnit does not parse the JSON data sent by the server. You need to process the JSON data by integrating with some 3rd party JSON parsers. Regards Vasu On Mon, Jul 30, 2012 at 11:08 AM, Satyanarayana K <kri_satya@...: http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit Frameset page
mail.body: Hi, I am using htmlunit 2.9 in one of my applications to write test cases for a web aplication( http://groceries.asda.com/asda-estore/search/searchcontainer.jsp?trailSize=1&searchString=the+cook+book&domainName=Products&headerVersion=v1&_requestid=79230 ). I notice that the "frameset" tag is not getting parsed by htmlunit. I believe that "frameset" tag and "body" cannot be in the same html page and in case if that is the case the "body" should be ignored. Since "frameset" tag is not getting parsed the code in the "body" tag gets executed. Please let me know whether the support for "frameset" tag is planned for future releases. Regards, Christopher -- *" What we sow we will reap."*

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] How to best integrate spring-test-mvc and HtmlUnit?
mail.body: I am part of the Spring team and wanting to create an open source project that integrates HtmlUnit and spring-test-mvc [1]. At a high level, spring-test-mvc allows me to do end-to-end testing of my web and view layers without starting a container up. This allows me to easily test different results from my service tier while still running extremely fast. The problem is that it is difficult to parse the responses in these tests. Providing spring-test-mvc and HtmlUnit integration would not only allow me to easily validate my UI, but would permit me to reuse my PageObject's [2] in the end-to-end and integration tests when using HtmlUnitDriver. I have put together a proof of concept that supports very limited integration of HtmlUnit and spring-test-mvc [3]. It works using a custom WebConnection implementation that is set on the WebClient. The only problem is that while WebConnection is a public API, WebClient.setWebConnection is marked as "INTERNAL API - SUBJECT TO CHANGE AT ANY TIME - USE AT YOUR OWN RISK." I have seen quite a few examples on the web where others were using WebClient.setWebConnection method [4,5,6,etc]. I have seen discussions about removing the "INTERNAL API" warning [7] and discussions stating it should not be removed [8]. The API works rather well for my situation, but I am hoping for some feedback on my approach. Specifically I have the following questions: 1) Is there a better way to integrate HtmlUnit and spring-test-mvc (i.e. that avoids using internal APIs)? 2) Are there any thoughts to removing the "INTERNAL API" warning on WebClient.setWebConnection method? This choice seems to make sense to me for a few reasons. a) WebConnection is public and the only way (apparent to me) to integrate WebConnection in with the framework is using the setConnection method b) There are a number of provided public implementations of WebConnection (DebuggingWebConnection, FalsifyingWebConnection, WebConnectionWrapper) that can only be utilized by leveraging this method. Thank you for your time and for producing such an excellent product. [1] https://github.com/SpringSource/spring-test-mvc [2] http://code.google.com/p/selenium/wiki/PageObjects [3] https://github.com/rwinch/spring-test-mvc-htmlunit-showcase [4] http://old.nabble.com/Does-HtmlAnchor.click()-create-a-new-WebClient--td22683085.html [5] http://htmlunit.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/htmlunit/tags/HtmlUnit-2.9/src/test/java/com/gargoylesoftware/htmlunit/WebClientTest.java?revision=7042&view=markup#l165 [6] http://old.nabble.com/Does-HtmlAnchor.click()-create-a-new-WebClient--td22683085.html [7] http://markmail.org/message/cfwji5k6dbxqigx6 [8] http://old.nabble.com/-HtmlUnit--Cleanup%3A-deprecate-getPrintContentOnFailingStatusCode--td27402712.html#a27404098 Regards, Rob Winch

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] How to best integrate spring-test-mvc and HtmlUnit?
mail.body: Hi Robert, using custom WebConnection is the way to go. You're right, we should update this JavaDoc, it's surely quite old and the warning has no sense to me anymore. I wanted to have a look at your proof of concept but couldn't find time so far. I'll do it as soon as I can. Please let us informed about your progress and don't hesitate to ask in case of problems. Cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com Le 20/07/2012 17:45, Robert Winch a écrit : https://github.com/SpringSource/spring-test-mvc http://code.google.com/p/selenium/wiki/PageObjects https://github.com/rwinch/spring-test-mvc-htmlunit-showcase http://old.nabble.com/Does-HtmlAnchor.click()-create-a-new-WebClient--td22683085.html http://htmlunit.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/htmlunit/tags/HtmlUnit-2.9/src/test/java/com/gargoylesoftware/htmlunit/WebClientTest.java?revision=7042&view=markup#l165 http://old.nabble.com/Does-HtmlAnchor.click()-create-a-new-WebClient--td22683085.html http://markmail.org/message/cfwji5k6dbxqigx6 http://old.nabble.com/-HtmlUnit--Cleanup%3A-deprecate-getPrintContentOnFailingStatusCode--td27402712.html#a27404098

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] How to best integrate spring-test-mvc and HtmlUnit?
mail.body: Marc, Thank you for your response. While I would welcome any feedback, now that you have confirmed that setWebConnection can be interpreted as externally available I believe I have all I need for now. Therefore, don't feel bad if you don't find time to look over the code. I will be sure to post back with any questions and any significant updates on my progress. Thanks again for your response and congratulations on the release :) Cheers, Rob Winch On Tue, Jul 24, 2012 at 12:26 AM, Marc Guillemot <mguillemot@...: http://mguillem.wordpress.com https://github.com/SpringSource/spring-test-mvc http://code.google.com/p/selenium/wiki/PageObjects https://github.com/rwinch/spring-test-mvc-htmlunit-showcase http://old.nabble.com/Does-HtmlAnchor.click()-create-a-new-WebClient--td22683085.html http://htmlunit.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/htmlunit/tags/HtmlUnit-2.9/src/test/java/com/gargoylesoftware/htmlunit/WebClientTest.java?revision=7042&view=markup#l165 http://old.nabble.com/Does-HtmlAnchor.click()-create-a-new-WebClient--td22683085.html http://markmail.org/message/cfwji5k6dbxqigx6 http://old.nabble.com/-HtmlUnit--Cleanup%3A-deprecate-getPrintContentOnFailingStatusCode--td27402712.html#a27404098 http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Cookies while using WebRequestSettings
mail.body: Hello I'm made a custom post request using WebRequestSettings after I login to a website, but no cookies are passed when making the post request. Is there anyway to pass the cookies related to the session when using WebRequestSettings? Regards!
