mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] get elements of a list of divs
mail.body: I am using the .net wrapper for HtmlUnit (NHtmlUnit). Trying to get the individual elements and their text values for a list of Divs. Here is what I have so far. // return DIVs for listing results public static IList<object> getListingResultsDiv(HtmlPage page) // get div container for all listing(s) found // gets div element for each listing found IList<object> divListings = divResults.GetByXPath("//div[" + NHtmlUnit.Html.HtmlPage page = ListingScrapeUtility.getPage(" http://www.realtor.com/realestateandhomes-sear // gets div element for each listing found If I do the following I get a list of DIV elements. @foreach(NHtmlUnit.Html.HtmlDivision listing in divListings) Returns the following: (which is correct) HtmlDivision[<div class="resultsItem property dListData new" listingid="543114488">] HtmlDivision[<div class="resultsItem property dListData priceReduced" listingid="545922903">] If I do the following it gets the element for the first div in the list. @foreach(NHtmlUnit.Html.HtmlDivision listing in divListings) Returns the following: (not what I expect) 9110 177th Place NERedmond, WA 98052 9110 177th Place NERedmond, WA 98052 Any help would be greatly appreciated. Thanks, Shawn

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Frameset web page
mail.body: Hi, I am using htmlunit 2.9 in one of my applications to write test cases for a web aplication( http://groceries.asda.com/asda-estore/search/searchcontainer.jsp?trailSize=1&searchString=the+cook+book&domainName=Products&headerVersion=v1&_requestid=79230 ). I notice that the "frameset" tag is not getting parsed by htmlunit. I believe that "frameset" tag and "body" cannot be in the same html page and in case if that is the case the "body" should be ignored. Since "frameset" tag is not getting parsed the code in the "body" tag gets executed. Please let me know whether the support for "frameset" tag is planned for future releases. Regards, Christopher -- *" What we sow we will reap."*

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Frameset web page
mail.body: Hi Chris, FrameSet is supported, please have a look at current cases at http://htmlunit.svn.sf.net/viewvc/htmlunit/trunk/htmlunit/src/test/java/com/gargoylesoftware/htmlunit/html/HtmlFrameSetTest.java?revision=6994&view=markup And yes, Frameset and body should not exist on the same .html. Please provide minimal case if HtmlUnit behaves different than real browsers. Ahmed ________________________________ To: htmlunit-user@... I appreciate your help in solving the problem. THanks for your help in advance Regards Vasu ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Live Security Virtual Conference Exclusive live event will cover all the ways today's security and threat landscape has changed and how IT managers can respond. mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Cookie value not getting updated with new value after session timeout
mail.body: Hi Ahmed, Thanks for your reply. Here is my understanding of your test case. 1. Create a webclient and request page1. The response sets the cookie "SessionID" to ValueOne. 2. Calling Get page2 and the response sets the cookie "SessionID" to ValueTwo. 3. Calling Get Pag3 and you are printing the cookie values from the request header to check if it is ValueTwo. Here the same webclient instance is used to get different pages from the server. My scenario is slightly different. 1. Create a webclient and request page1 from a site and get the cookie values sent by the server and save it locally. 2. Create a webclient and set the cookie values for that site which were already saved using addcookie API and request page2. The response for page2 sends a cookiekey with a different value which does not seem to get updated. 3. Tried to get the cookie values after page2 response, but HTMLUnit was returning the cookie values of step-1 but not with the updated cookie value from step-2. I hope this scenario helps to identify the problem. Let me know if you need any additional information. Regards Vasu On Sun, Jul 8, 2012 at 11:21 PM, Ahmed Ashour <asashour@...> wrote: http://localhost :" + PORT http://localhost :" + PORT http://localhost :" + PORT http://www.jstor.org User-Agent Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows http://www.jstor.org User-Agent Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows http://www.jstor.org User-Agent Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows http://www.jstor.org ; path=/ Content-type text/html; charset=UTF-8 Server http://www.jstor.org User-Agent Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Cookie value not getting updated with new value after session timeout
mail.body: Hi Vasu, I am seeing the issue with your case, and it is due to null path of the cookie constructed. For the time being, please specify the cookie to have "/" path, and it will be correctly handled. Shortly, after some verification, HtmlUnit should be changed to let the Cookie constructor of (name,value) have "/" path instead of null. Yours, Ahmed ________________________________ To: Ahmed Ashour <asashour@...>; htmlunit-user@... Sent: Monday, July 9, 2012 9:56 AM Subject: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Cookie value not getting updated with new value after session timeout Hi Ahmed, Thanks for your reply. Here is my understanding of your test case. 1. Create a webclient and request page1. The response sets the cookie "SessionID" to ValueOne. 2. Calling Get page2 and the response sets the cookie "SessionID" to ValueTwo. 3. Calling Get Pag3 and you are printing the cookie values from the request header to check if it is ValueTwo. Here the same webclient instance is used to get different pages from the server. My scenario is slightly different. 1. Create a webclient and request page1 from a site and get the cookie values sent by the server and save it locally. 2. Create a webclient and set the cookie values for that site which were already saved using addcookie API and request page2. The response for page2 sends a cookiekey with a different value which does not seem to get updated. 3. Tried to get the cookie values after page2 response, but HTMLUnit was returning the cookie values of step-1 but not with the updated cookie value from step-2. I hope this scenario helps to identify the problem. Let me know if you need any additional information. Regards Vasu On Sun, Jul 8, 2012 at 11:21 PM, Ahmed Ashour <asashour@...> wrote: Hi, http://localhost http://localhost http://localhost http://www.jstor.org http://www.jstor.org http://www.jstor.org http://www.jstor.org http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Cookie value not getting updated with new value after session timeout
mail.body: Hi Ahmed, Thanks for your quick reply. My next question is when I make a call getCookies, I thought it would return the list of cookies with the domain and path included for each cookie value. I was saving the cookie value and used addcookie API in a loop thinking that the domain and path would also be set automatically. It looks like it is not setting those values. If I just set the domain, will that work or I need to set the path also. Shall try with your suggestion and thanks for your help. Regards Vasu On Mon, Jul 9, 2012 at 3:33 PM, Ahmed Ashour <asashour@...> wrote: http://java.io.io/>.IOException http://localhost :" + PORT http://localhost :" + PORT http://localhost :" + PORT http://www.jstor.org User-Agent Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows http://www.jstor.org User-Agent Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows http://www.jstor.org User-Agent Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows http://www.jstor.org ; path=/ Content-type text/html; charset=UTF-8 Server http://www.jstor.org User-Agent Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Cookie value not getting updated with new value after session timeout
mail.body: Hi Vasu, Cookie(name,value) is deprecated and will be removed later, as you have to set the domain. There is no way for HtmlUnit to know which domain, because cookie is originally sent from the server-side, and it knows which domain. Yours, Ahmed ________________________________ To: Ahmed Ashour <asashour@...>; htmlunit-user@... Sent: Monday, July 9, 2012 1:31 PM Subject: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Cookie value not getting updated with new value after session timeout Hi Ahmed, Thanks for your quick reply. My next question is when I make a call getCookies, I thought it would return the list of cookies with the domain and path included for each cookie value. I was saving the cookie value and used addcookie API in a loop thinking that the domain and path would also be set automatically. It looks like it is not setting those values. If I just set the domain, will that work or I need to set the path also. Shall try with your suggestion and thanks for your help. Regards Vasu

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Cookie value not getting updated with new value after session timeout
mail.body: Hi Ahmed, The cookie object that I had saved had the domain and path values set as well. I was printing in the console, the value of the cookie object and it displayed the value as follows However, when I had used addCookie API with the cookie object, looks like it did not take the domain & path values. Looks like, I need construct a new cookie object with those values to be set once again and make a addCookie call. Regards Vasu On Mon, Jul 9, 2012 at 4:27 PM, Ahmed Ashour <asashour@...> wrote: http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Cookie value not getting updated with new value after session timeout
mail.body: Hi Vasu, Cookie.equals() and hashCode() have been changed in SVN to treat null path as "/". Please retest and provide minimal case if you still have an issue. You can get latest snapshot after successful build from http://build.canoo.com/htmlunit Yours, Ahmed ________________________________ To: Ahmed Ashour <asashour@...>; htmlunit-user@... Sent: Monday, July 9, 2012 2:09 PM Subject: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Cookie value not getting updated with new value after session timeout Hi Ahmed, The cookie object that I had saved had the domain and path values set as well. I was printing in the console, the value of the cookie object and it displayed the value as follows However, when I had used addCookie API with the cookie object, looks like it did not take the domain & path values. Looks like, I need construct a new cookie object with those values to be set once again and make a addCookie call. Regards Vasu On Mon, Jul 9, 2012 at 4:27 PM, Ahmed Ashour <asashour@...> wrote: Hi Vasu, http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Cookie value not getting updated with new value after session timeout
mail.body: Hi Ahmed, The build with your changes has failed. What I did is the following? Most of the cookie objects that I had stored had cookie name, cookie value, domain and path. Some of them had expires field also. Earlier, I was calling the addcookie directly passing the stored cookie object and now I create a new cookie object from the values extracted from the stored cookie object and added the path as well. Even with this change, the cookie value for sessionID did not get updated. The set-cookie from the server had Cookie name(SessionID), Value(new value) and the path set as "/". The domain was not set. Will HTMLUnit handle this case as well?. Looking forward to your reply. Regards Vasu On Mon, Jul 9, 2012 at 4:48 PM, Ahmed Ashour <asashour@...> wrote: http://build.canoo.com/htmlunit http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Cookie value not getting updated with new value after session timeout

Please modify the servlet example I sent earlier, to test various scenarios and submit the one with HtmlUnit issues. Yours, Ahmed ________________________________ To: Ahmed Ashour <asashour@...>; htmlunit-user@... Earlier, I was calling the addcookie directly passing the stored cookie object and now I create a new cookie object from the values extracted from the stored cookie object and added the path as well. Even with this change, the cookie value for sessionID did not get updated. The set-cookie from the server had Cookie name(SessionID), Value(new value) and the path set as "/". The domain was not set. charset=UTF-8 Server MarkLogic Content-Length 12480 Connection close As you can see in the previous response from the server the sessionID cookie value is different and that value was not getting sent in the last HTMLUnit request. I am not holding onto the WebClient instance. I store the cookie value in memory and close the webclient instance. I use addCookie API to add the cookies to be set in the Cookie header for a new webclient instance. What I see is that the new value of SessionID does not contain the domain value and is it because of this the equals method can fail?. I hope this information is useful for you to identify where the problem is. Thanks for your help in advance and I really appreciate your support. mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Cookie value not getting updated with new value after session timeout
mail.body: Hi Vasu, You have to provide complete (minimal) case, not only the headers to take this further. Note that CookieManager is specific to WebClient, not static. Yours, Ahmed ________________________________ To: Ahmed Ashour <asashour@...>; htmlunit-user@... Sent: Wednesday, July 11, 2012 12:25 AM Subject: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Cookie value not getting updated with new value after session timeout Hi Ahmed, I downloaded the new build just now and tested it and the same problem persists. The new cookie value was NOT getting updated. Given below is the header exchange between HTMLUnit and the server

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Cookie value not getting updated with new value after session timeout
mail.body: Hi Ahmed, Thanks for your reply. I agree that CookieManager is specific to webclient and that is why I store the previous Cookie values gotten for a source before closing the Webclient Instance using getCookies API. When a new request comes,I create a new webclient instance, check if the cookie is already stored for that source. If yes, then use addCookie API of CookieManager to store all the cookies and I saw those values set in the Cookie header when the request is sent out. As part of the response, the server sets a new value for the old cookie name which I saw in the header and I used getCookies API to get the cookie list for this webclient and I update this new set before closing the webclient window. The getCookie API was giving me the old set and not the with the updated Value. Is there anything wrong in my logic? Kindly help me out to solve this problem. Regards Vasu On Wed, Jul 11, 2012 at 3:18 PM, Ahmed Ashour <asashour@...> wrote: http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Cookie value not getting updated with new value after session timeout
mail.body: Hi Ahmed, Let me tell you the sequence of HTMLUnit APIs calls that I make and you tell me if I am making any obvious mistake. 1. Create Webclient Instance. 2. Check if any cookies are already available for this source. If yes, I use addCookie calls to store all the cookie instance for that source. If no, don't do anything. 3. Send the request using the getPage API. 4. The response HTML is processed and I use the getCookies API to get the current cookie list and store it in Memory. 5. Close the webclient instance by calling closeAllWindows API. A new request comes from the client after an hour. 1. Followed the first three steps like before. 2. Saw the HTTP Response header and I found that one of the cookie values have been changed. When I used the getCookies API, I was expecting the updated cookie value in the cookie list but I got the cookie list with old value only. 3. Processed the HTMLPage and closed the webclient instance. Can you tell me if I am doing any obvious mistake? Thanks for your help in advance. Regards Vasu On Wed, Jul 11, 2012 at 3:44 PM, Vasudevan Comandur <vcomandur@...: http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] xpath bug?
mail.body: Hi, weirdly enough, this morning the same code works (on 2.9). I did some investigation and I noticed that the dom tree at hand mutates throughout the queries ,that is, the number of nodes on the page is different in the first two/three iterations as it increases and then stabilizes. I guess the error occurs when some of the newly introduced nodes is involved in the xpath query. Unfortunately it is difficult to reproduce. Does it make sense? How it is supposed to work HtmlUnit is such situations? It seems the situation described in https://developer.mozilla.org/en/Introduction_to_using_XPath_in_JavaScript where "Note however, that if the document is mutated (the document tree is modified) between iterations that will invalidate the iteration and the invalidIteratorState property of XPathResult is set to true, and a NS_ERROR_DOM_INVALID_STATE_ERR exception is thrown." On a different note, I was using the NicelyResynchronizingAjaxController hoping that it would cause the page completely loaded. Instead, what does work is using waitForBackgroundJavaScriptStartingBefore(1000). In this case, the number of nodes on the pages remains constant from the first xpath query. Best, Gio On 9 July 2012 15:03, Giovanni Grasso <giovannigrasso@...> wrote: http://www.amazon.co.uk/Bestsellers-Car-Motorbike/zgbs/automotive/ref=zg_mg_tab/

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] how to call HtmlAnchor.click() to get the url but not really load that url?
mail.body: hi all an anchor can be clicked and will visit a new page. I want to get his new page's url. but this url can't get from href, when I click the anchor, javascript will calculate and change href. I can use HtmlAnchor.click().getWebResponse().getWebRequest().getUrl(). but it will load that page. it's slow. I don't need load that url, I just need the url.

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] how to call HtmlAnchor.click() to get the url but not really load that url?
mail.body: Hi, you can configure your own WebConnection (for instance using a wrapper) to return an empty html page when you click the link. This would be fast as no http connection would be involved and you would get the url from getWebResponse().getWebRequest().getUrl(). Cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com Le 03/07/2012 12:17, Li Li a écrit :

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] WebClient and Threads
mail.body: Hi, First of all, thanks for this great tool :) Now, reading the WebClient javadoc I noticed the following note: "Note: a WebClient instance is not thread safe. It is intended to be used from a single thread." I have 2 questions regarding that note. My understanding about it is that I CAN NOT have a single WebClient instance that has TopLevelWindows, each controlled by a single thread (I mean that I can not have each TopLevelWindow get pages requested by only one thread). Is this correct? In case it is, the only way I can think of in order to workaround this issue is to work with many WebClient instances each controlled by a single thread. Now, the huge drawback of this solution (apart from memory consumption) is that there won't be any way to "share" session data between those instances. For example, if in a single WebClient solution I have to login to a site once, in a multi WebClient solution I will have to login multiple times and maybe repeat other procedures on all those instances. Is this correct or is there any other way to work this out? Thanks in advance.

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] WebClient and Threads
mail.body: Hi Mosty, indeed you shouldn't manipulate different TopLevelWindows of a single WebClient instance from different threads. Using one WebClient instance per thread is the way to go. I don't think that it makes a problematic difference concerning the memory consumption. If you want to share session data, you probably only have to look at replicating or sharing cookies but you may get strange results depending how the web site is programmed for such a use case cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com Le 03/07/2012 14:54, Mosty Mostacho a écrit : http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/apidocs/com/gargoylesoftware/htmlunit/WebClient.html http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/apidocs/com/gargoylesoftware/htmlunit/WebClient.html

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit behind an unreliable network
mail.body: Hi, I'm behind a highly unreliable network. This means sometimes I can not fetch a webpage by means of WebClient.getPage() or HtmlAnchor.click() because I get an exception. What would be the proper way to workaround this situation? The best way I could think of was creating 2 methods, something like (untested, just a draft I'm coding in my text editor): Is there any better way of doing this? Thanks in advance.

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit behind an unreliable network
mail.body: Hi, which kind of exceptions do you get? Cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com Le 23/08/2012 16:52, Mosty Mostacho a écrit :

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit behind an unreliable network
mail.body: Mosty, On 8/23/12 10:52 AM, Mosty Mostacho wrote: Is there a reason you choose to test through an unreliable network? I ask because one of my primary principles of test automation is to create tests that generally fail for the right reason, and not due to unrelated issue that I'm not testing. I would not test my application over an unreliable network any more than I would on a computer with an intermittent power source. If I wanted to test how the application handled an unreliable network, that would be a different story. Even in that case, I would probably introduce my own explicit unreliability rather than depend on chance. In a situation such as I imagine yours, I would be more likely to test a local instance in order to remove the unreliable network from the tests. - George -- ---------------------------------------------------------------------- * George Dinwiddie * http://blog.gdinwiddie.com Software Development http://www.idiacomputing.com Consultant and Coach http://www.agilemaryland.org ----------------------------------------------------------------------

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit behind an unreliable network
mail.body: Hi Mosty, if you're using HtmlUnit for test purposes, then you should follow George's advice. If you're using HtmlUnit for scraping, then you have to cope with these timeouts. You can configure the timeout on the WebClient. If you want to implement a retry strategy, then you should rather do it at the WebConnection level, not at the page level as a page may reference many resources, some may be loaded timely whereas other may get a timeout. Cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com Le 23/08/2012 19:50, Mosty Mostacho a écrit :

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] runtimeError: message=[Exceeded maximum stack depth]
mail.body: Hello I have multithreaded html program and for each thread I create a new WebClient. Usually I run 4 threads on each machine. A lot of times I've noticed that some threads just stop working without any exception. Today I implemented log4j in my project and I think I finally found the problem. "[2012-08-12 02:20:34,906] - - runtimeError: message=[Exceeded maximum stack depth]" this is the last message for that thread before the finally block was called. I have my code in a try/catch(Exception) block which is inside another while(true) loop, which should run indefinitely, but after that runtimeError that thread does not work anymore. I know that errors can occur in http programs, but why does the Thread stop all together? Is there anyway to make it start at top of the loop again after that runtime error? Regards!

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] runtimeError: message=[Exceeded maximum stack depth]
mail.body: Hi, You have a recursively calling function. This is the Rhino (core-js.jar) verification, in which the maximum stack depth is "Integer.MAX_VALUE" by default, which is a very big number. You should fix your JS logic, or use: Yours, Ahmed ________________________________ To: htmlunit-user@... mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] runtimeError: message=[Exceeded maximum stack depth]
mail.body: Hi Ahmed, As far as I know I did not get an Exception, I'm sure the problem will happen again and I'll check double check, but I'm 99% sure there is no Exception. The way the test is written is like below. Which will create a new webClient on every new turn in the loop. but I just noticed that in the and webClient.closeAllWindows(); which are outside of try/catch blocks, do you think that has anything to do with the while look not restarting over? I also realized that there is no need for WebWindow window = webClient.getCurrentWindow();, but could it be that after the stack error that line is throwing an exception but since I'm not catching it the thread stops? Regards! @Override public void run() while (true) try LogFactory.getFactory().setAttribute("org.apache.commons.logging.Log", ............... ............... ............... ............... ............... catch (Exception e) try catch (InterruptedException e1) finally try catch (Exception e) On Sun, Aug 12, 2012 at 4:58 AM, Ahmed Ashour <asashour@...> wrote: http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

The way the test is written is like below. Which will create a new webClient on every new turn in the loop. but I just noticed that in the finally block I have WebWindow window = webClient.getCurrentWindow(); and webClient.closeAllWindows(); which are outside of try/catch blocks, do you think that has anything to do with the while look not restarting over? I also realized that there is no need for WebWindow window = webClient.getCurrentWindow();, but could it be that after the stack error that line is throwing an exception but since I'm not catching it the thread stops? mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] runtimeError: message=[Exceeded maximum stack depth]
mail.body: Hi I've been playing around my my app and it looks like after adding everything in try/catch the Exceeded maximum stack depth does not crash it but I've found out that when I run 8 threads of it, some threads just stop working. After hours of research I found out that others have this problem too when running multiple threads, and it looks like its a deadlock. Here is the link to the bug page http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=3193004&group_id=47038&atid=448266 has this been fixed for 2.10 or are we still waiting for the bug fix? I'm still not 100% sure if its the deadlock causing my thread to stop working, I've looked at my logs and the finally block gets called for that thread but it never start again. What can this be? Regards On Sun, Aug 12, 2012 at 5:48 AM, Ahmed Ashour <asashour@...> wrote: http://main.logger.info/>(threadName + ": New Thread http://main.logger.info/>(threadName + ": inside http://main.logger.info/>(threadName + ": Closed http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] problem with xmlhttprequest

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] setting HTTPS Proxy
mail.body: I have set webConnection settings and implemented a socket that tunnels for HTTPS Proxy. it works, but some small details are not implemented, but they are easy to add. If it helps to fix it sooner, I will be glad to give you my code as my contribution. Let me know if you want the code. ________________________________ Sent: Friday, August 3, 2012 8:16 PM Subject: Re: [Htmlunit-user] setting HTTPS Proxy There is a bug in the proxy implementation involving HTTPS. I have replicated it on a Socks proxy. I am not sure about HTTPS proxy. It is on the list to be fixed, but may be 3-4 weeks yet. On Fri, Aug 3, 2012 at 10:38 AM, Saeed Zareian <saeed_zareean@...> wrote: http://bbc.co.uk/ http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] webClient.closeAllWindows() clear all cookies?
mail.body: Hello I was writing a test which requires logging in with different userids and I have it in a loop, I found out that with every new turn in the loop I'm still logged in to the site even though after I've finally Is there anything else I need to do to get rid of all cookies and cache? is webClient.getPage supposed to create a new window with no cookies and cache?

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] webClient.closeAllWindows() clear all cookies?
mail.body: Hi, webClient.CloseAllWindows() will clean up all resources that were used by webclient including the cookieManager. This call will not send out a logout URL to the sites. You have to explicitly send the URL to logout from the site and call webClient.closeAllWindows() subsequently. I hope this explanation helps. Regards Vasu On Thu, Aug 2, 2012 at 2:40 AM, Arya <arya6000@...> wrote: http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] webClient.closeAllWindows() clear all cookies?
mail.body: Thanks for your reply The site I use uses cookies to stay logged in, and I checked my http traffic monitor software (Fiddler) and found out that cookies in htmlunit do not get cleared after calling webClient.closeAllWindows() I even called cookieManager.clearCookies(); and the cookies still are stored in webClient. Should I file a bug for this? On Thu, Aug 2, 2012 at 7:26 AM, Vasudevan Comandur <vcomandur@...: http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] webClient.closeAllWindows() clear all cookies?
mail.body: Are you trying to reuse the same webclient instance or you are instantiating a new webclient instance for each turn in the loop.? The Webclient instance will clear all the cookies when you call clearcookies in its cookie Manager but the HTTPClient does not clear the cookies for that site. It will retain the cookies like how the browser behaves. Hence it is not a bug. I hope this answers your question. Regards Vasu On Thu, Aug 2, 2012 at 11:21 PM, Arya <arya6000@...> wrote: http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] webClient.closeAllWindows() clear all cookies?
mail.body: I wrote this small test to show you what I'm exactly doing, the cookies don't get removed for the next turn in the loop, is that a bug? if not what can I do to delete all the cookies? public class Main public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception WebClient webClient = new WebClient(BrowserVersion.FIREFOX_10, "127.0.0.1", LogFactory.getFactory().setAttribute("org.apache.commons.logging.Log", while (true) try HtmlPage page = webClient.getPage(" http://mail.yahoo.com catch (Exception e) finally On Thu, Aug 2, 2012 at 2:01 PM, Vasudevan Comandur <vcomandur@...: http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] webClient.closeAllWindows() clear all cookies?
mail.body: It looks to me that you are NOT using the CookieManager class of HTMLUnit. Remove the first line. WebClient creates an instance of cookieManager and it stores all the cookies that it receives from HTTPClient for that webclient instance. Here, you are reusing the webclient instance wherein the HTTPClient will still retain all the cookies for this webclient instance. You create new webclient instance everytime you enter the loop. You move that initial code inside the while loop and try. Regards Vasu On Thu, Aug 2, 2012 at 11:55 PM, Arya <arya6000@...> wrote: http://mail.yahoo.com http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] adding custom javascript object implementation
mail.body: Hi Is there a way to plug-in a custom implementation of a javascript object? for example: if I run this: I get an exception: com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.ScriptException: TypeError: Cannot find function canPlayType in object [object HTMLVideoElement]. (injected script#1) likely because canPlayType(). Can I extend HTMLVideoType, add some methods and plug it in somewhere to get it to work (preferably without forking)? thanks again -- ~sanjay

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] adding custom javascript object implementation
mail.body: Hi Sanjay, Your needed method was added in SVN. There is no way to customize the javascript objects, as they are internal because: - They are not meant for usage normal user - Usually associated DOM classes (and logic) need change, for example HtmlMedia and HTMLMediaElement was added for the recent change. Whenever you have a good patch, it can go to SVN in few days (if not hours). Yours, Ahmed ________________________________ Sent: Friday, September 28, 2012 9:19 PM Subject: [Htmlunit-user] adding custom javascript object implementation Hi Is there a way to plug-in a custom implementation of a javascript object? for example: if I run this: I get an exception: com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.ScriptException: TypeError: Cannot find function canPlayType in object [object HTMLVideoElement]. Created a webclient Instance. 2. In a loop, I added cookies to the cookieManager. The domain was given as "www.sciencedirect.com". The name value pairs were set correctly. 3. I was calling getpage method (first call to the site with the URL having http://www.sciencedirect.com plus other params) and I didn't see the cookie values set in the HTTP header. Am I missing some settings? I appreciate your help in advance. Regards VAsu

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Problems with HTMLUnit page refresh
mail.body: Hello together, I've got some problems with the simple use of page.refresh(). The purpose of the test-class is as follows: * Init WebClient * Get Page (small page, only showing your IP) * Set a SOCKS Proxy * Get the page again - with another IP shown * Close Here's the code (ready to run): //****************************************************************** // Getting Page without Proxy page = webClient.getPage(" http://www.myip.ch // Testing the Cache... // With the two following lines it works correctly - most times... // Setting a SOCKS - Proxy (could be down/offline) ProxyConfig proxyConfig = new ProxyConfig("87.106.92.61", 1082, // Setting a RefreshHandler // Getting Page with new set Proxy page = webClient.getPage(" http://www.myip.ch // Close WebClient //*********************************************************** Here is the result from the console: ///////////////////////////////////////////////////// Current IP Check Current IP Address: 95.157.58.27 Powered by Micro Solutions AG com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.Cache@... com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.Cache@... Current IP Check Current IP Address: 95.157.58.27 Powered by Micro Solutions AG ///////////////////////////////////////////////// As you can see: 1) IP-Address has not changed. page.refresh() has no effect either. 2) The cache seems not to be used. Would you please try my little code on your system and tell me, if it works? Can anyone explain me this behaviour? Is it possible, to "unset" a proxy with ProxyConfig(null, 0, false)? What is the right way to show the proxyfied Website / IP without closing webClient? When I'm using two different sites to show my IP, then it works. I'm really tired of asking google and trying strange codes... Greets, CM

Current IP Check Current IP Address: 95.157.58.27 Powered by Micro Solutions AG ///////////////////////////////////////////////// As you can see: 1) IP-Address has not changed. page.refresh() has no effect either. 2) The cache seems not to be used. mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Problems with HTMLUnit page refresh
mail.body: I've had a look: the problem is that HttpClient is caching the connection. The proxy config is only used when opening it. We probably have to shutdown the ClientConnectionManager and to use a new one if we want to handle this case. I'm not sure that it makes sense to have such a feature. @Max: why do you need to do this from the same WebClient instance? Can't you instantiate a new one? Cheers, Marc. Le 26/09/2012 10:08, Ahmed Ashour a écrit : http://mguillem.wordpress.com http://www.myip.ch http://www.myip.ch http://www.myip.ch/ http://www.myip.ch/

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Problems with HTMLUnit page refresh
mail.body: Hi Marc, I'm using HtmlUnit 2.10. Well, I can instantiate a new WebClient for every new refresh of the site behind a new proxy (testing some security stuff). Let's see, if or how it affects the performance of my little app. But there's something I don't understand: Example: Without Proxy => Website 1 (www.myip.ch) => Normal IP Set Proxy Next Page, same Client => Website 2 (whatever other (!) site shows the ip) => Proxy IP Without closing WebClient or changing Connection or whatever. Code: (Ready to run) //********************************************************* // Getting Page without Proxy page = webClient.getPage(" http://www.myip.ch // Setting a SOCKS - Proxy ProxyConfig proxyConfig = new ProxyConfig("80.63.56.146", 1080, // Getting Page with new set Proxy page = webClient.getPage(" http://fhfmuc.tipido.net/Test.php // Close WebClient //************************************************************************************* Output: ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// Current IP Check Current IP Address: 95.157.58.27 Powered by Micro Solutions AG --- 80.63.56.147 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// So, with two different sites it works to change(?) / set a proxy. Trying to read the SAME page again, brings the cached site back. What could be the reason? Greetz, Max Am 26.09.2012 10:29, schrieb Marc Guillemot: http://mguillem.wordpress.com http://www.myip.ch http://www.myip.ch http://www.myip.ch/ http://www.myip.ch/ http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Problems with HTMLUnit page refresh
mail.body: Hi Max, this is because HttpClient is caching the connection per host. For WebSite 2, a new connection has to be built which is respecting the new proxy settings. Cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Flash Support
mail.body: Hi everybody, I would like to take you opinion about supporting Flash in HtmlUnit. This could allow the user to: - Run Flash in web pages, just like real browsers do - Retrieve Flash content (images, videos, etc), similar to HtmlImage.saveAs() As you can imagine, this is a new area with huge effort to simulate ActionScript Virtual Machine, with big reference [1] Do you think this feature is really needed, or the current scope of HtmlUnit is enough? Yours, Ahmed [1] http://help.adobe.com/en_US/FlashPlatform/reference/actionscript/3/

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Browser minimize
mail.body: Hi Mohamed, Please explain more, what you mean be minimal resized? From what I understand, if the window is 'minimized', the window will not be visible in the first place. Does your site uses JavaScript to detect window.innerWidth/outerHeight? Firefox ignores setting those values by JavaScript. Providing a minimal case that works with real browser, but not with HtmlUnit will be very helpful. Yours, Ahmed ________________________________ To: htmlunit-user@... Cc: asashour@... Sent: Tuesday, September 25, 2012 7:56 PM Subject: Browser minimize Hello, My Test case: a column will not appear when the browser is minimal resized. I want to test this Bug with htmlUnit... Is there a way to do that??? Thanks Mohamed

Then I iterate through them and use the if statement to look for a specific node <tr class="away">. The if statement below looks like it should work, but does not. I have an alternative way in comments that DOES work, but I would prefer to locate the node using the way not in comments. Let me know if you need more info or you have an idea to try. Thanks! /** * @throws IOException * @throws MalformedURLException * @throws FailingHttpStatusCodeException */ public static void main(String[] args) throws final HtmlPage page = webClient.getPage(" http://mlb.mlb.com/mlb/scoreboard/index.jsp?c_id=det if (object.getAttributes().getNamedItem("class").getNodeValue().toString().equals("away")) // if (object.getAttributes().getNamedItem("class").getNodeValue().toString().equals("away")) // -- View this message in context: http://old.nabble.com/Iterating-through-DomNodes-looking-for-specific-node-tp34448546p34448546.html Sent from the HtmlUnit - General mailing list archive at Nabble.com.

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Problems with HTMLUnit when going from jQuery 1.7 to 1.8.1
mail.body: Hi. First of thanks for a great product. I'm using HtmlUnit 2.10 at the moment to automate tests for a very big web application. It has worked very well when it comes to Ajax-synchronization, until jQuery was updated to 1.8.1. Now I need waits and checks all over the place, while with 1.7 it ran smoothly. Another problem has also arisen, it seems to be with redirects. I have a page where I click a link, this link goes to .json file. The page uses json2js to interpret the JSON, then redirects using window.location to a new page. This worked smoothly with jQuery 1.7, but not with 1.8.1. Looking at the requests, they are sent the exact same way as before, and the responses look the same. The content for the new page is recieved, but it long time after clicking the link, but the new page still does not load. Any suggestions as to how to debug this problem further? Currently I use a writePageToDisk method which writes pages in different states asXml() to html pages, and I can see what's displayed. The page shown AFTER the button is clicked looks a lot like the "loading page" that is usually shown when executing Ajax, even though the loading-animation (a little spinner) is not displayed... so it's as if it just stops trying to load the new page. I've experimented some with the newest snapshot, but it doesn't seem to solve the problems.

Please read http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/submittingJSBugs.html Yours, Ahmed ________________________________ To: htmlunit-user@... mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Problems with HTMLUnit when going from jQuery 1.7 to 1.8.1
mail.body: Hi Ahmed! Thanks for your swift reply, much appreciated. Yes, 1.8.1 was just recently released. The alerthandler-trick seems like a good idea, I will try to debug my local version further today using alert(). Sincerely, Lauritz On Mon, Sep 17, 2012 at 8:39 AM, Ahmed Ashour <asashour@...> wrote: http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/submittingJSBugs.html http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Problems with HTMLUnit when going from jQuery 1.7 to 1.8.1
mail.body: Hello again. After some more debugging without being able to pinpoint the problem more accurately, I went with an easier solution, although not entirely best-practise: when the request for jQuery-1.8.1.js came I just replaced the response with the contents from jQuery-1.7.2.js. This works perfectly, but is pretty hacky. Hopefully a temporarily solution until next version of HtmlUnit. Lauritz

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Problems with HTMLUnit when going from jQuery 1.7 to 1.8.1
mail.body: Hi Lauritz, the probability that it gets fixed for next version will surely be higher if you help to isolate the root cause ;-) Cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Problems with HTMLUnit when going from jQuery 1.7 to 1.8.1
mail.body: Hello Marc! I appreciate that, I will try to find some time to find the root cause. Any educated guesses as to where to start looking? The tip about adding alerts is a decent one, but there is quite a bit of code in the jQuery javascript. Is there a way to analyze what exact javascript methods are being executed? Like a Firefox plugin or something. Would make it easier to see what it is that fails, I could compare executions from jQuery 1.7 to jQuery 1.8. Lauritz On Thu, Sep 20, 2012 at 11:54 AM, Marc Guillemot <mguillemot@...: http://mguillem.wordpress.com http://ad.doubleclick.net/clk;258768047;13503038;j? http://info.appdynamics.com/FreeJavaPerformanceDownload.html https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Problems with HTMLUnit when going from jQuery 1.7 to 1.8.1
mail.body: Hello Lauritz, I would not try to involve 1.7 at all, but use only 1.8.1. For example, start by the method which is called in jquery, and put alert in there (jquery.js), and compare the output of real browser against HtmlUnit, both invoking the same URL. After some digging, you will mostly be able to find a single statement which behaves differently. Hope that helps. Ahmed ________________________________ To: htmlunit-user@... mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Reading friends timeline using HtmlUnit
mail.body: Greetings, I'd like to read and get my friends whole Facebook timeline using HtmlUnit. Already I've successfully done login functions. When we scroll down the timeline and we are close to the bottom of the page, new content is being loaded to timeline. I would like to simulate that operation in HtmlUnit. I'm pretty sure that scroll event don't trigger new content loading. My second idea was to check event listeners on DOM elements within class="hidden_elem". None of them corresponded with scrolling action nor I didn't find any elements with visibilitychange'ish event listeners (which are used at http://www.imgur.com/gallery ). At the moment I ran out of ideas. Maybe manually unpack content of BigPipe < !-- comments -->? How would you do that? I'd not like to do this way, because it's not universal approach such dynamic content loading mechanisms. I mean BigPipe is just Facebook technology used there and nowhere else. Anyway if you have any ideas, please let me know. Best regards, igleyy

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Reading friends timeline using HtmlUnit

List of events: DOMContentLoaded DOMMouseScroll blur change click focus focusin keydown keypress keyup mousedown mousemove mouseout mouseover mouseup mousewheel scroll submit I'm pretty sure that scrolling don't trigger it, but maybe I just made a mistake in my tests.

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] disabling auto loading of iframe in htmlunit
mail.body: Hello Guys, I am facing the same problem as mentioned here in this stackoverflow post: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7200886/extremely-simple-code-not-working-in-htmlunit-2-9-stable Is there any plan to implement the solution mentioned here in the release? On another note, I have two issues with htmlunit 2.10 1) My First problem with htmlunit 2.10 is, now I am unable to use one instance of WebClient to parse my webpages. I have 4-5 pages that I parse, each of them on a different site. With htmlunit 2.10, I have seen that when getting page once any one of the pages errors out, none of the ones after that are loaded, and they all show the same exception as the first one and the url of first failed page in stack trace. 2) Second problem I have is, my code which was working fine with htmlunit 2.9, now gives errors when parsing few pages with htmlunit 2.10 like this : java.util.zip.ZipException: incorrect header check at java.util.zip.InflaterInputStream.read(InflaterInputStream.java:164) at org.cyberneko.html.HTMLScanner$PlaybackInputStream.read(HTMLScanner.java:3511) at sun.nio.cs.StreamDecoder.readBytes(StreamDecoder.java:283) at sun.nio.cs.StreamDecoder.implRead(StreamDecoder.java:325) at sun.nio.cs.StreamDecoder.read(StreamDecoder.java:177) at java.io.InputStreamReader.read(InputStreamReader.java:184) at org.cyberneko.html.HTMLScanner$CurrentEntity.load(HTMLScanner.java:1814) at org.cyberneko.html.HTMLScanner$CurrentEntity.read(HTMLScanner.java:1835) at org.cyberneko.html.HTMLScanner$ContentScanner.scan(HTMLScanner.java:2000) at org.cyberneko.html.HTMLScanner.scanDocument(HTMLScanner.java:917) at Source) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HTMLParser$HtmlUnitDOMBuilder.parse(HTMLParser.java:798) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HTMLParser.parse(HTMLParser.java:234) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HTMLParser.parseHtml(HTMLParser.java:180) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.DefaultPageCreator.createHtmlPage(DefaultPageCreator.java:267) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.DefaultPageCreator.createPage(DefaultPageCreator.java:155) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.WebClient.loadWebResponseInto(WebClient.java:440) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.WebClient.getPage(WebClient.java:315) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.WebClient.getPage(WebClient.java:380) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.WebClient.getPage(WebClient.java:365) For the time being I have reverted to htmlunit 2.9, and I might just make the change mentioned in stackoverflow post in htmlunit 2.9 code and use that instead. regards

Cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlPage does not contain expected results
mail.body: I'm using the latest htmlunit version and have had much success with it in the past. For some reason, I'm not getting the search results page I expect from submitting the web form with the following code. // Get the first page final HtmlPage page1 = client.getPage(" https://locator.chase.com // Get the form that we are dealing with and within that form, // find the submit button and the field that we want to change. // set the zip code we want to search on // Now submit the form by clicking the button and get back the second page. You'll see the 'searchResultsPage' is no where close to what I'm expecting. It seems to reference this URL and I have no idea why. HtmlPage( https://www.chase.com/online/locator/article/lctr_ad_resultspg_eng.htm ) Any ideas as to what I'm doing wrong? Thank you.

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlPage does not contain expected results
mail.body: Hi Billy, - Use latest HtmlUnit 2.10 - Try to remove NicelyResynchronizingAjaxController(), it sometimes prevents correct JavaScript handling with jQuery - Have a look at http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/faq.html#AJAXDoesNotWork - Try to isolate a minimal test case as hinted in http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/submittingJSBugs.html Yours, Ahmed ________________________________ To: htmlunit-user@... Sent: Thursday, September 6, 2012 11:28 PM Subject: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlPage does not contain expected results I'm using the latest htmlunit version and have had much success with it in the past. For some reason, I'm not getting the search results page I expect from submitting the web form with the following code. // Get the first page final HtmlPage page1 = client.getPage(" https://locator.chase.com // Get the form that we are dealing with and within that form, // find the submit button and the field that we want to change. // set the zip code we want to search on // Now submit the form by clicking the button and get back the second page. You'll see the 'searchResultsPage' is no where close to what I'm expecting. It seems to reference this URL and I have no idea why. HtmlPage( https://www.chase.com/online/locator/article/lctr_ad_resultspg_eng.htm ) Any ideas as to what I'm doing wrong? Thank you.

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlPage does not contain expected results
mail.body: Ahmed, Genius! Removing the NicelyResynchronizingAjaxController did the trick (I was already using the 2.10 release)! Thank you so much for the response! - Billy - On Sep 7, 2012, at 5:21 AM, Ahmed Ashour <asashour@...> wrote: http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/faq.html#AJAXDoesNotWork http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/submittingJSBugs.html https://locator.chase.com https://www.chase.com/online/locator/article/lctr_ad_resultspg_eng.htm ) http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ _______________________________________________ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlPage does not contain expected results
mail.body: Hi Ahmed, I've hit another roadblock I'm hoping you can assist me with. The form submit is working great after removing the NicelyResynchronizingAjaxController that you suggested below. The next function I need to perform is a 'hover' or 'mouseOver' event on a specific div that I already have a handle to (as an HtmlElement). I've tried the mouseOver like this: The problem is, I don't believe the mouseover is working or triggering the balloon popup (which happens in a browser experience) which under the hood seems to make an ajax request and manipulates the DOM (adds another div to the DOM), without a page refresh whatsoever. I need the data/html that's being inserted into the DOM after the hover takes place. How do I handle such a thing? I found this interface (DomChangeListener), but I can't seem to find any examples for using it. If you submit a search (in a browser) to the following URL with zip code 80602, and then just hover over one of the results on the right-hand side, this is the exact same function I need to reproduce with htmlunit. Thanks so much for your help, I truly appreciate it. - Billy - On Sep 7, 2012, at 5:21 AM, Ahmed Ashour <asashour@...> wrote: http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/faq.html#AJAXDoesNotWork http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/submittingJSBugs.html https://locator.chase.com https://www.chase.com/online/locator/article/lctr_ad_resultspg_eng.htm ) http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ _______________________________________________ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Problems with dynamically generated HTML code

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Your opinion about Configurations
mail.body: Hi all, We would like to have your input for the configurations currently used by HtmlUnit. - There is BrowserVersionFeatures [1], which is used to control the logic according to browser-specific features. The actual configurations are in flat files e.g. [2] - There is JavaScriptConfiguration.xml [3], which is used to define all JavaScript getters/setters/functions, and their corresponding browser configurations. There are two directions in question: 1 - Move those flat files to annotations: - Pros: for HtmlUnit developers it is better, as there is no need to search into different flat files to know the compatibility, a sample implementation in [4] - Cons: Users will not easily change the browser logic, and they will need to change the java code. 2 - Keeping flat files (as currently is) What do you think? Do you need to change one of those configurations, and why? Yours, Ahmed [1] http://htmlunit.svn.sf.net/viewvc/htmlunit/trunk/htmlunit/src/main/java/com/gargoylesoftware/htmlunit/BrowserVersionFeatures.java?revision=7346&view=markup [2] http://htmlunit.svn.sf.net/viewvc/htmlunit/trunk/htmlunit/src/main/resources/com/gargoylesoftware/htmlunit/javascript/configuration/FF3.6.properties?revision=7346&view=markup [3] http://htmlunit.svn.sf.net/viewvc/htmlunit/trunk/htmlunit/src/main/resources/com/gargoylesoftware/htmlunit/javascript/configuration/JavaScriptConfiguration.xml?revision=7346&view=markup [4] http://htmlunit.svn.sf.net/viewvc/htmlunit/trunk/htmlunit/src/main/java/com/gargoylesoftware/htmlunit/BrowserVersionFeatures.java?revision=7336&view=markup&pathrev=7336

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlAnchor with javascript in the Href attribute
mail.body: I am browsing a web site, using the HtmlAnchor object to click on buttons. As long as the site takes me to a different page, the click() method works just fine. I encountered a problem clicking on a link which triggers a drop down, and changes the page (adding buttons) without taking me to a different address. This is the anchor code (I stripped down the "<" so it can appear here..): a style="color: black; font-weight: bold;" details /a As you can see there is a certain Javascript call in the href. I tried calling click(). I tried using the javascript engine with - I tried enabling and disabling the Javascript related attributes of the webclient. I tried changing the browser - chrome_16/IE/FF. none of them works for none of the above methods. Nothing! The page never changes. and none of the desired buttons residing after the link click is visible to the program. I'm desperate and very close to giving up. can someone please offer me a fresh way of thinking? what am I doing wrong? how can I get the HtmlUnit engine to click on a anchor with a javascript in it's href attribute? Thanks, Uzil24 -- View this message in context: http://old.nabble.com/HtmlAnchor-with-javascript-in-the-Href-attribute-tp34376888p34376888.html Sent from the HtmlUnit - General mailing list archive at Nabble.com.

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlAnchor with javascript in the Href attribute
mail.body: Dear uzil24, As far as I understand they use Ajax to display new content. I would propose you several options. (timeout is up to you to choose - that will wait until background code worked. Than you just call smth. like: client.getCurrentWindow().getEnclosedPage() and se what you get. 2. Try to check how many WebWindows you have - client.getWebWindows().size() and then you will be able to choose one with a new content. What I mean here is - maybe they open a new pop-up window with its "javascript:show_me(...)" code. The main point is you should let it wait for a while - the time when JS plays its role. Saturday, September 1, 2012, 1:56:36 PM, you wrote: -- With best regards, Roman Dushko skype: rodush Rodush mailto:rodush@...

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlAnchor with javascript in the Href attribute
mail.body: Hi Roman, Thank you for those new ideas. after reading your message, I used both wait method defined in WebClient. one before the click() action, and one after it. I gave it 30 sec timeout. There was no pause at all. as if nothing is going on on the background. I also checked the number and contents of the Web windows I have. Before the click I have one TopLevelWindow and 2 FrameWindows. Right after the click() there is an additional FrameWindow. I tried switching the currentWindow to any one of the frames, but the enclosed page that each of them has (including the last one just added) is a blank html page. So unfortunately, the main window is still not changed, the added window is just blank, and I still wonder how to make HtmlUnit press this link and reveal the buttons... Any more ideas anyone? mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Not expected result code from htmlunit
mail.body: Hi at all! I'm from Spain (sorry for my English faults). I'm new using HtmlUit (wich is a great tool). I'm testing a web page, submitting a form, and then is loaded a new page wich loads dynamically content with Ajax or Javascript, but uses JSON too. This is my code: public static void main(String[] arguments) throws FailingHttpStatusCodeException, MalformedURLException, IOException, final HtmlPage page = (HtmlPage) browser.getPage(" http://www.muchoviaje.com final HtmlSubmitInput button = (HtmlSubmitInput) The response contains the source code from the page, but not the dynamically content, but i don't know why. I don't know if is becase Ajax or Javascript is not loaded or because JSON. ¿What cuold be the problem? Thanks!

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Not expected result code from htmlunit
mail.body: Hi, You shouldn't use WebResponse, which is meant to get the actual content from the server. You should use htmlPage.asText() or .asXml() Yours, Ahmed ________________________________ To: htmlunit-user@... mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Application terminating while executing getPage
mail.body: Hi everyone, I've been facing something a bit unexplainable. I'm using HtmlUnit 2.10 under Debian using OpenJdk 1.6. Take a look at the following code: webClient.getPage(" http://www.proxynova.com/proxy-server-list/ At first sight the while (true) seems to be unbreakable. And it actually is as the last line outside the while block is never executed. When I execute this, most of the times (around 90% of them) I get the appropriate output (PRE, Exception catched!, Closing, PRE, Exception catched!, Closing, etc). The exception is a JS exception so disregard it as I don't actually care about it. When the loop is executed for 3 or 4 times, then it keeps going (as it should!). HOWEVER, in the very first attempts I might get the following output "PRE" or maybe also "PRE, Exception catched!, Closing, PRE". Anyway it ends with "PRE"... and that just can't happen by looking at the code. The application just exits and nothing is redirected to the standard nor error output. Whatsmore, the output seems to be similar to the one you'd get by doing a System.exit(0); in HtmlUnit's getPage method. Do you have any ideas about what's going in here? Thanks in advance.

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Application terminating while executing getPage
mail.body: Hi Mosty, If faced similar issue few times with a java dump generated. The reason was a bug in JDK, which needs upgrade to latest version 1.6.x for your case. BTW, your code is non-compilable with eclipse, it says "unreachable code". Ahmed ________________________________ Sent: Saturday, October 27, 2012 11:07 PM Subject: [Htmlunit-user] Application terminating while executing getPage Hi everyone, I've been facing something a bit unexplainable. mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] got no response for URL: http://7401157377357303.securesignupoffers.org
mail.body: Hi, setting WebClientOptions.setTimeout(x) with x > 0 should avoid infinite wait. For the rest, try to compare the http traffic of HtmlUnit with the one of the simulated browser (try first with a recent 2.11 snapshot: http://build.canoo.com/htmlunit/artifacts/ ). Cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com Le 26/10/2012 07:29, KimSean a écrit : http://7401157377357303.securesignupoffers.org . http://7401157377357303.securesignupoffers.org ") is http://securesignupoffers.org/a/

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Use in crawling
mail.body: I'm doing a web mining application which loads pages from a site that has JS based pagination. When you scroll to the bottom of a page, more data is loaded automatically. Nice UI but hard to crawl. Using org.apache.http.impl.client.DefaultHttpClient now. Their JS is large so I'm still digging through it. Assuming the custom JS library executes properly in HtmlUnit, can I trigger events tied to scrolling from my java crawler?

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Use in crawling
mail.body: Hi Pat, Just identify the needed event, make a minimal case as hinted in [1], and it should be fixed quickly. Ahmed [1] http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/submittingJSBugs.html ________________________________ To: htmlunit-user@... Sent: Wednesday, October 24, 2012 11:42 PM Subject: [Htmlunit-user] Use in crawling I'm doing a web mining application which loads pages from a site that has JS based pagination. When you scroll to the bottom of a page, more data is loaded automatically. Nice UI but hard to crawl. Using org.apache.http.impl.client.DefaultHttpClient now. Their JS is large so I'm still digging through it. Assuming the custom JS library executes properly in HtmlUnit, can I trigger events tied to scrolling from my java crawler? ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Everyone hates slow websites. So do we. mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Use in crawling
mail.body: Thanks much, Seems like here are two ways to approach this: 1) fetch and render the page then tell the rendered view to scroll down. Does this cause the proper events to get triggered? If so it would very closely mimic the UI interaction with the user. This seems like a resilient solution since the JS code can change but scrolling a view will not. Not sure if this is possible with HtmlUnit? 2) identify the code to be executed and trigger it directly from java (this is what is suggested below). The method for doing this is fairly clear but doesn't mimic the UI interaction and so secondary functions will not be triggered unless I'm very careful to understand all the page code. This could be a brittle solution because any change to the JS code may have unforeseen side effects. I ask because I need to reimplement the fetcher in my crawler to wrap the HtmlUnit class and this will be a bit of work. I use the apache client now so I'll need to mimic the same interface with HtmlUnit. I then need to redesign the fetch methods and how to detect when the fetching is done. Whether I use #1 or #2 will affect the crawl client design. I'm starting to look at that today. On Oct 24, 2012, at 11:00 PM, Ahmed Ashour <asashour@...> wrote: Hi Pat, Just identify the needed event, make a minimal case as hinted in [1], and it should be fixed quickly. Ahmed [1] http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/submittingJSBugs.html To: htmlunit-user@... mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Use in crawling
mail.body: Hi Pat, I have to say I couldn't understand much. What I meant is to isolate the javascript/html scenario that words in real browsers but doesn't work with HtmlUnit, e.g. even "onscolldown" of 'div' is not triggered by HtmlUnit, and "sampleJsFunction()" is not called on scrolling down by HtmlUnit. Digging in HtmlUnit code is ok, but spending effort in isolating only "html/javascript" is more worthy. mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Use in crawling
mail.body: Just my personal suggestion: This is what I would have done - I would have analyzed the request being fired when the user scrolls down and repeat that request with with WebRequest. mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Use in crawling
mail.body: Le 25/10/2012 18:56, Pat Ferrel a écrit : I'm not sure. It may be what gives you the fastest results now but may not be so resilient. Ideally HtmlUnit should be able to mimic the simulated browser here. If it is not the case, then it should be fixed ;-). Finding how to do it may be fast... or may take some time. As a workaround you can perhaps trigger the event by yourself on HtmlUnit, this would surely be better than calling the JS function(s) directly. Cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Android
mail.body: Hi, I was wondering if anyone had any experience of using HtmlUnit on Android. I'm finding it very difficult to get up and running. The console spits out hundreds of messages that look like this: [2012-10-25 19:19:24 - BrunelLibraryApp] Dx warning: Ignoring InnerClasses attribute for an anonymous inner class (org.apache.html.dom.SecuritySupport$1) that doesn't come with an associated EnclosingMethod attribute. This class was probably produced by a compiler that did not target the modern .class file format. The recommended solution is to recompile the class from source, using an up-to-date compiler and without specifying any "-target" type options. The consequence of ignoring this warning is that reflective operations on this class will incorrectly indicate that it is *not* an inner class. Thanks for your help. Kenan.

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Android
mail.body: Hi, You don't need to cross-post This class is in one of the dependencies, not in HtmlUnit proper. I guess you should follow the suggestion. If this is encountered with HtmlUnit classes, then we can look into it. Ahmed Ashour On Oct 25, 2012, at 21:27, Kenan McGrath <kenan.mcgrath@...> wrote: http://p.sf.net/sfu/appdyn_sfd2d_oct https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] "java.net.SocketException" How to make program continue trying?
mail.body: I am writing code to load different pages of a website. It works smoothly with a wired internet under Linux system. But with wireless internet under Windows, it always gets the "java.net.SocketException: Connection Reset" and the whole program just stops. I've tried with all the firewall turn off. Nothing improved. It does load some pages, but stops occasionally because of the "java.net.SocketException". My conclusion is that: the wireless internet is not as stable as the wired one. I can stay with the wired internet and Linux. But my little laptop is using wireless internet in my dorm and I want to figure out the solution. Is there anyway to keep the program trying to load the webpage where it gets "java.net.SocketException"? I am a newbie to java, so the question may be silly. However I do search online and did not find the solution I need (perhaps I am not using the correct key words). I guess something should be done in exception throwing, but not sure about the details. Thank you for your patience to read my question! Any suggestion would be appreciated! -- View this message in context: http://old.nabble.com/%22java.net.SocketException%22-How-to-make-program-continue-trying--tp34535567p34535567.html Sent from the HtmlUnit - General mailing list archive at Nabble.com.

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] problems parsing a html file
mail.body: Ken, The page does, indeed, have style and script blocks before the <html> tag. If you want the page to parse without errors, you need to create a conformant page. See http://www.htmlhelp.com/cgi-bin/validate.cgi?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.radioshack.com%2Fproduct%2FinStoreAvail.jsp%3FproductId%3D15590866&warnings=yes - George On 10/10/12 11:18 PM, ken wrote: mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Latest source
mail.body: Hi , I downloaded the latest HtmlUnit svn (build.2098). Where can i find the source for htmlunit-core-js-2.11-20121004.070154-27.jar ? I need to debug to isolate a Javascript issue. I am getting Exception: 'Exception invoking open'. Thanks Raj

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Latest source
mail.body: Thank You. Appreciate your prompt reply. On Wed, Oct 10, 2012 at 1:42 AM, Ahmed Ashour <asashour@...> wrote: https://github.com/HtmlUnit/htmlunit-core-js . http://p.sf.net/sfu/newrelic-dev2dev https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://p.sf.net/sfu/newrelic-dev2dev https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] FailingHttpStatusCodeException when using custom WebRequest settings
mail.body: Hello I have a part of my code which I'm manually making WebRequest settings and with that WebRequest HTMLUnit fetches some JS pages which it ends up throwing a FailingHttpStatusCodeException and I have webClient.setThrowExceptionOnScriptError(false); and it should not throw Exception, but it seems when ever custom WebRequests are made exceptions are still thrown. If I use HTMLUnit without the custom WebRequest no exception is thrown. Is there any way around this? is this a bug? Regards!

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] FailingHttpStatusCodeException when using custom WebRequest settings
mail.body: Hi Arya, Please provide test case against latest snapshot. Ahmed On Oct 9, 2012, at 18:25, Arya <arya6000@...> wrote: http://p.sf.net/sfu/newrelic-dev2dev https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] FailingHttpStatusCodeException when using custom WebRequest settings
mail.body: Hi Ahmed My project consisted of many files and sections I've put everything needed in pastebin to reproduce the error http://pastebin.com/Ud9G0PAS Let me know if I have missed anything. On Tue, Oct 9, 2012 at 11:30 AM, Ahmed Ashour <asashour@...> wrote: http://p.sf.net/sfu/newrelic-dev2dev https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://p.sf.net/sfu/newrelic-dev2dev https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] FailingHttpStatusCodeException when using custom WebRequest settings
mail.body: I just realized set javascriptenabled is set to false in the pastebin link but it should be set to true or commented out to produce the Exception. On Tue, Oct 9, 2012 at 12:05 PM, Arya <arya6000@...> wrote: http://pastebin.com/Ud9G0PAS http://p.sf.net/sfu/newrelic-dev2dev https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://p.sf.net/sfu/newrelic-dev2dev https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] FailingHttpStatusCodeException when using custom WebRequest settings
mail.body: Ahmed If I have JS support disabled it should work, but when I disable it Yahoo somehow finds out its disabled even when I'm making the custom WebRequests and it redirects me to page saying JS support is disabled which is needed to use Yahoo mail. But when I do the same thing with httpwebrequest(c#) which does not have JS support it does not redirect me to that page. Is there anyway to have JS support disabled in HTMLUnit and prevent it from telling the site that the "browser" does not have JS support? On Tue, Oct 9, 2012 at 12:12 PM, Arya <arya6000@...> wrote: http://pastebin.com/Ud9G0PAS http://p.sf.net/sfu/newrelic-dev2dev https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://p.sf.net/sfu/newrelic-dev2dev https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] FailingHttpStatusCodeException when using custom WebRequest settings
mail.body: Hi Ahmed I think I found what the problem is. As I set the "host" header parameter in the WebRequest and that WebRequest fetched other JS pages with a different host caused the problem. I modified my WebConnectionWrapper to set the host parameter on the fly and the error does not happen anymore. On Tue, Oct 9, 2012 at 12:33 PM, Arya <arya6000@...> wrote: http://pastebin.com/Ud9G0PAS http://p.sf.net/sfu/newrelic-dev2dev https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://p.sf.net/sfu/newrelic-dev2dev https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Problem with the web site
mail.body: Hi, I used HtmlUnit (without Java Script) and HttpClient to connect to the HSBC (UK) web site to download my statements in a background, but they had made some changes recently and I can't even pass the first link now. I'd appreciate if someone could try this and post a solution. The URL is http://www.hsbc.co.uk . When you open it, you can see the "Log on" link (top right corner) to login to the personal Internet banking and this is the one which I can't pass. I open the home page OK but when I try to "click" the link I'm getting a JavaScript error (index -1) when I use HtmlUnit with Java script switched on. When I switch JavaScript off or use HttpClient directly I'm getting a small "Problem" screen instead of the actual login page. I know that the link works fine from all browsers with or without Java Script. I had no problems before neither. All I need is a solution to pass this link and to see the actual login page. I guess, I should be able to take it from there. Could someone try? Thanks

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Problem with the web site
mail.body: I got it sorted and apparently, there is a bug somewhere in HtmlUnit or HttpClient and it can be related to the JVM version. The web site sets a cookie with expiry date defined as e.g. "19-Dec-94 ... " in the header. This is captured in the Cookie Store as 19/12/2094 instead of 19/12/1994. As a result, the cookie is sent to the server while it must not. I think this problem started when I moved to JDK 7, but I have not done any investigation. Anyway, everything works fine if I manually change dates of the cookies. On 2012-10-02 04:37, Ahmed Ashour wrote: http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/submittingJSBugs.html http://www.hsbc.co.uk [1]. When you open it, you can see the "Log http://p.sf.net/sfu/newrelic-dev2dev https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user [3] http://www.hsbc.co.uk/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user
