mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Uploading newest snapshot to Sonatype Nexus
mail.body: Hello. I have been trying to use the newest snapshot of HtmlUnit, but having some difficulity. What I need to do is get it uploaded to the Nexus that we are using as a Maven Repository, but I am struggling. I have tried selecting the pom from the snapshot and upload artifact through that, but then the .jars aren't included. I have tried uploading the .jars, but then the dependencies aren't included. Does anyone how to build HtmlUnit into a format that I can upload to a Nexus? Sincerely, Lauritz

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] [ANN] Wetator 0.9.9 released
mail.body: Wetator version 0.9.9 is available. Wetator is a tool for automatic Graphical User Interface (GUI) tests of web applications. It provides you with a simple command language for writing your tests, that * maps the typical user actions (open-url, click-on, select, set...) and * includes commands to check the page content (assert-content, assert-title...). This human readable language enables you to specify test cases that are easy to write and easy to read. Wetator tests are executed using HtmlUnit, a Java based framework which is able to simulate the most popular web browsers (Firefox, Internet Explorer). The test result is summarized in a well-arranged report containing detailed information about the test run and snapshots for each step. Read more about Wetator at http://www.wetator.org RBRi -------------------------- Wetator Smart web application testing http://www.wetator.org

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Browser minimize
mail.body: Hi Ahmed, To explain my use case a take the facebook site as example . in facebook if the browser resolution is small the user can see the friends panel but with a large resolution this panel (at right) will disappeare. That mean the page content depend with the browser dimensions, the problem with HtmlUnit is that the browser dimensions is a dummy value because the browser will only be simulatet and not opened: outerHeight: 755 innerHeight: 605 is there a way to implement such test cases with HtmlUnit? PS: i don t want to test facebook, this is only an example to explain my use case :-) Thanks Mohamed Ahmed Ashour wrote: http://www.accelacomm.com/jaw/sfrnl04242012/114/50122263/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user -- View this message in context: http://old.nabble.com/Re%3A-Browser-minimize-tp34480984p34499007.html Sent from the HtmlUnit - General mailing list archive at Nabble.com.

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlImage's "download image if needed" doesn't timeout
mail.body: I download html pages then I try to rank all the images included in the page by their size. I run this from many threads. After several days of running it happens that one of the threads gets stuck in the following call. My question is, how can we set a timeout on the the HtmlImage download. I already set WebClient timeout, but it seems that this particular Connection (that gets the htmlimage is needed) is not obeying the same setting as for the connection that obtained the HtmlPage. So as i said this issue appear very rarely but when it happens it blocks the whole application as it seems that there is no way to forcefully end it. Sometime it takes more than an hour to continue the processing from the "socketConnect" (if it can recover by itself), and some other times i need need to shut the whole thing down after 2 hours of idling. FYI, I can notice via linux's "lsof" that there are quite a few "CLOSE_WAIT" threads from the htmlunit connections (reaching a steady arpox 200 for most of the time) however, even so, I never run out of file handles. Thus I exclude the freezing being caused by OS running out of handles. And the stack trace from the thread dump is: "Pool-3-thread-6" daemon prio=10 tid=0x0a64a800 nid=0x492 runnable [0x7985c000] java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.socketConnect(Native Method) at java.net.AbstractPlainSocketImpl.doConnect(AbstractPlainSocketImpl.java:339) - locked <0xa5f27a50> (a java.net.SocksSocketImpl) at java.net.AbstractPlainSocketImpl.connectToAddress(AbstractPlainSocketImpl.java:200) at java.net.AbstractPlainSocketImpl.connect(AbstractPlainSocketImpl.java:182) at java.net.SocksSocketImpl.connect(SocksSocketImpl.java:391) at java.net.Socket.connect(Socket.java:579) at org.apache.http.conn.scheme.PlainSocketFactory.connectSocket(PlainSocketFactory.java:127) at org.apache.http.impl.conn.DefaultClientConnectionOperator.openConnection(DefaultClientConnectionOperator.java:180) at org.apache.http.impl.conn.ManagedClientConnectionImpl.open(ManagedClientConnectionImpl.java:294) at org.apache.http.impl.client.DefaultRequestDirector.tryConnect(DefaultRequestDirector.java:640) at org.apache.http.impl.client.DefaultRequestDirector.execute(DefaultRequestDirector.java:479) at org.apache.http.impl.client.AbstractHttpClient.execute(AbstractHttpClient.java:906) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.HttpWebConnection.getResponse(HttpWebConnection.java:171) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.WebClient.loadWebResponseFromWebConnection(WebClient.java:1484) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.WebClient.loadWebResponse(WebClient.java:1402) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HtmlImage.downloadImageIfNeeded(HtmlImage.java:397) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HtmlImage.readImageIfNeeded(HtmlImage.java:404) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HtmlImage.getWidth(HtmlImage.java:347) Any idea greatly appreciated. -- Bogdan

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Supported Browsers
mail.body: Hi all, The team would like to get your feedback about Browsers that HtmlUnit should support. As you know, there are many versions, and because of very limited capacity, we need to restrict them to the minimum. So, the main questions are: What best suits your need, and how you define that? By global browsers statistics [1], by customer requirements (e.g. banks), or by what? I will hint about main points: Internet Explorer: - IE8 released 2009, IE9 in 2011 - Should we consider 6/7/8? Firefox: - Recently, a release every two months. - There is ESR for organizations, which is released every year (currently 10.0.11) - Is FF 3.6 relevant? should we have Firefox_Latest? Chrome: - Can't be ignored anymore, since it is consistently increasing its market share. - Release every couple months. Appreciate your feedback. Yours, Ahmed [1] http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Usage_share_of_web_browsers

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Supported Browsers
mail.body: It seems that nobody cares :-( In this case, what about dismissing the current FF and IE simulation as well as the emerging Chrome one and concentrate the effort only on Galeon [1] for instance? Or on Lynx [2]? ;-) Cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com [1] http://galeon.sourceforge.net/ [2] http://lynx.isc.org/lynx2.8.7/lynx2-8-7/lynx_help/Lynx_users_guide.html Le 27/11/2012 11:01, Ahmed Ashour a écrit : http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Usage_share_of_web_browsers

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Supported Browsers
mail.body: For my use cases i need functionality over browser replication since i do web scrubbing to send data and not to test sites. However, in my opinion IE 6/7 should be considered dead. Concerning Firefox I dont have enough data to respond since i just dont follow the changes made, Firefox_Latest is surely nice, but can be mantained? Chrome: I dont need it, but surely many others will. Nice try with Galeon and Lynx ;) http://mguillem.wordpress.com http://galeon.sourceforge.net/ http://lynx.isc.org/lynx2.8.7/lynx2-8-7/lynx_help/Lynx_users_guide.html http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Usage_share_of_web_browsers http://goparallel.sourceforge.net https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit 2.11 jquery 1.8.2 An invalid or illegal selector was specified (selector: '[test^='']')
mail.body: Hello, I'm running into an issue with HtmlUnit 2.11 and jquery 1.8.2. I'm seeing the following error logged: [testng] 1290 ERROR [main] com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.StrictErrorReporter - runtimeError: message=[An invalid or illegal selector was specified (selector: '[test^='']' error: Invalid selectors: [test^='']).] sourceName=[ http://localhost:7001/jquery/1.8.2/jquery.js ] line=[5213] lineSource=[null] lineOffset=[0] Taking a look at jquery 1.8.2 at line 5213, I see: // Opera 10-12/IE9 - ^= $= *= and empty values // Should not select anything I've written a small test case, and can recreate the error without jquery: My source is: public static void main(String[] args) I can post the full stack trace if you need it. Firefox 16.0.2, IE 9, Chrome 23 and jsfiddle don't show an issue. This looks a lot like Rhino 1.7R4 bug 684131 AstNode missing operator name "^=" (ASSIGN_BITXOR), but this looks like it was fixed in 2011. Any thoughts about next steps? Thanks for your help. Regards, Dave

Why is that? If I request completely diferent page2, for example: HtmlPage page2 = webClient.getPage(" http://google.com/ I will get google page. What is wrong?

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Problem submitting https form in 2.11

This is the correct button and works in 2.10 I create the webclient like so: WebClient webClient = new WebClient(randomBrowser()); //tried with various user agents XTrustProvider.install(); // Allow all certs webClient.addRequestHeader("referer", " http://www.google.com And XTrustProvider is similar to what is at this address: https://devcentral.f5.com/weblogs/joe/archive/2005/07/06/1345.aspx Has anyone seen this behavior before? Thanks a lot, Ben

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Does HTMLUnit construct the DOM when content-type is text/plain
mail.body: Hi, I would like to know if HTMLUnit construct the DOM when the content-type received from host is "text/plain" using neko parser. Appreciate your answer in advance. Regards Vasu

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Does HTMLUnit construct the DOM when content-type is text/plain
mail.body: Hi, if content type is set to text/plain then it won't be parsed as HTML. If content type is not set, HtmlUnit will try to sniff the content type by examining the content. Cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com Le 14/11/2012 10:44, Vasudevan Comandur a écrit :

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Does HTMLUnit construct the DOM when content-type is text/plain
mail.body: Thanks Marc for your answer. Regards Vasu On Wed, Nov 14, 2012 at 6:37 PM, Marc Guillemot <mguillemot@...> wrote: http://mguillem.wordpress.com http://p.sf.net/sfu/zoho_dev2dev_nov https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Simulating Browser Back Button
mail.body: First off, HTMLUnit has proven effective and error free while running selenium tests from jenkins. It's a luxury to not need selenium grid or sauce labs, not to mention the large speed improvements. The challenge for which I need help is simulating the browser back button. With HtmlUnit.navigate().back() issues a GET request to the previous URI, but a "real" browser will simply display the previous page (from cache I assume) which with no server interaction . This "re-get" method does not work if the URL doesn't change during navigation. I was about to start experimenting with Page objects from the history, but would appreciate any guidance.

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Simulating Browser Back Button
mail.body: Hi Don, thanks for the kind feedback. Would you allow us to quote you if we start a page with user feedback? after a quick look I suppose that HtmlUnit is guilty and not the HtmlUnitDriver. Could you open an issue for it? Cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Simulating Browser Back Button
mail.body: Hi Mark, you are welcome to use my comments. I found a workaround by caching Page objects. Shall I submit a patch? mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit 2.11 released
mail.body: Hi all, It is always a pleasure to announce a new release of HtmlUnit. 2.11 is particular in its short duration but rich changes, thanks to all contributors: - Java 6 is now required - HtmlPage.getElementById(): return type changed from HtmlElement to DomElement - HtmlElement: support special keys for .type(int). - Initial WebSocket support - Initial SVG support - Primitive Geolocation support - SOCKS proxy for HTTPS - Cross-origin resource sharing - And as always, bug fixes You can get it from: https://sourceforge.net/projects/htmlunit/files/htmlunit/2.11/ The changes are in: http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/changes-report.html#a2.11 Maven will take few hours to update all mirrors. Please don't hesitate to provide your valuable feedback to the team. Happy testing, Ahmed Ashour

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Building DOM tree using custom data-* attributes
mail.body: Greetings, I am trying to visit facebook.com using the newest HtmlUnit 2.11. Getting main page and logging in works very well. When I try to read someone's page whole DOM tree is not built properly. Every element in DOM tree is built correctly, until it gets to the element that contains data-referrer attribute. Since that point, every sub-element of element that contains data-referrer attribute are not added to the DOM tree. Simply it just doesn't exist in HtmlPage object DOM tree. My question is, how could I fix that? Do you have any ideas?

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Building DOM tree using custom data-* attributes
mail.body: Hi Marcin, Because HtmlUnit doesn't currently support HTML5 dataset property. Stay tuned. Ahmed ________________________________ To: htmlunit-user@... mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Building DOM tree using custom data-* attributes
mail.body: Hi Marcin, ".dataset" property was just implemented in latest snapshot (which you can get from http://build.canoo.com/htmlunit/ after a successful build). Please note that it is supported by only FF10+, not IE. mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] How to click an anchor with incomplete href?
mail.body: Hi at all. After resolving previos question, i come again with another question. I have an anchor whose href is like this: "../car/page.html", and i can't click it. How can i resolve this? Thanks!

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] How to click an anchor with incomplete href?
mail.body: Hi Ruben, If you mean you can't 'find' it, you can use htmlPage.getAnchorByHref("../car/page.html").click() If you get an error on clicking, please provide minimal test case. Ahmed ________________________________ To: htmlunit-user@... Sent: Friday, November 2, 2012 8:52 PM Subject: [Htmlunit-user] How to click an anchor with incomplete href? Hi at all. mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] How to click an anchor with incomplete href?

Now my code is working smoothly as before. Good luck! mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] htmlunit starts to get error randomly when using multithreading
mail.body: I use multi threading model, for each thread I allocate one WebClient. Runs fine in one thread, when number of threads increase, it starts to give error randomly on findElementById, it sometimes return null. The pattern is unpredictable. I understand that WebClient is not threadsafe, but by sticking an instance to each thread, this theoretically should work. I suspect there is something underneath in the htmlunit framework that is global and shared and not thread safe. The htmlunit developers should look into this.

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] htmlunit starts to get error randomly when using multithreading
mail.body: Please, no need to cross-post. Providing a minimal test case that periodically shows the error is the first step. Ahmed ________________________________ Sent: Friday, November 2, 2012 6:06 PM Subject: [Htmlunit-user] htmlunit starts to get error randomly when using multithreading I use multi threading model, for each thread I allocate one WebClient. Runs fine in one thread, when number of threads increase, it starts to give error randomly on findElementById, it sometimes return null. The pattern is unpredictable. I understand that WebClient is not threadsafe, but by sticking an instance to each thread, this theoretically should work. I suspect there is something underneath in the htmlunit framework that is global and shared and not thread safe. Subject: Re: [Htmlunit-user] htmlunit starts to get error randomly when using multithreading Please, no need to cross-post. Providing a minimal test case that periodically shows the error is the first step. Ahmed ________________________________ Sent: Friday, November 2, 2012 6:06 PM Subject: [Htmlunit-user] htmlunit starts to get error randomly when using multithreading I use multi threading model, for each thread I allocate one WebClient. Runs fine in one thread, when number of threads increase, it starts to give error randomly on findElementById, it sometimes return null. The pattern is unpredictable. I understand that WebClient is not threadsafe, but by sticking an instance to each thread, this theoretically should work. I suspect there is something underneath in the htmlunit framework that is global and shared and not thread safe. The htmlunit developers should look into this. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ LogMeIn Central: Instant, anywhere, Remote PC access and management. mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Multi-threads Problems.
mail.body: Hi, I have some problems when i use htmlunit in multi-threads environment. I call one WebClient per thread. But i found the response isn't the data what i wanted. Some responses are the same as other returns. So, i think maybe WebClient isn't thread-safe. So i write a test. Here is my idea. I call every webclient using different user-agent String. The right response should be the same as what i set. I test it with three methods. 1. using htmlunit with multi-threads. The result is some is same, others different. 2. using httpurlconnection with multi-threads.All results is same. 3. using htmlunit with single thread. Same as 2. So, htmlunit must has some problem in multi-threads environment. The attachment is my test file. Can anyone help me to take a look? Thanks. TobyBaxter

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Multi-threads Problems.
mail.body: Hi Toby, You are reusing the BrowserVersion, which is incorrect: this uses BrowserVersion.getDefault(), which is static. As documented in BrowserVersion [1] , you need to create a new one, like: BrowserVersion browserVersion = new BrowserVersion(ie.getApplicationName(), ie.getApplicationVersion(), Yours, Ahmed [1] http://sourceforge.net/p/htmlunit/code/7669/tree/trunk/htmlunit/src/main/java/com/gargoylesoftware/htmlunit/BrowserVersion.java ________________________________ Sent: Friday, November 2, 2012 7:36 AM Subject: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Multi-threads Problems. Hi Toby, Thanks for your test case. I am able to see the issue, hope to be resolved soon. Ahmed ________________________________ Sent: Thursday, November 1, 2012 10:11 AM Subject: [Htmlunit-user] Multi-threads Problems. Hi, I have some problems when i use htmlunit in multi-threads environment. I call one WebClient per thread. But i found the response isn't the data what i wanted. Some responses are the same as other returns. So, i think maybe WebClient isn't thread-safe. So i write a test. Here is my idea. I call every webclient using different user-agent String. The right response should be the same as what i set. I test it with three methods. 1. using htmlunit with multi-threads. The result is some is same, others different. 2. using httpurlconnection with multi-threads.All results is same. 3. using htmlunit with single thread. Same as 2. So, htmlunit must has some problem in multi-threads environment. The attachment is my test file. Can anyone help me to take a look? mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Problem with post
mail.body: Hi All, I am trying to use HtmlUnit against at&t.com site. HtmlPage page = webClient.getPage(" https://www.att.com/olam/loginAction.olamexecute?fromdlom=true // the page that I receive back is the same as the original. And if I asText() it, it shows the viewable page along with my userid and credentials in cleartext. What am I going wrong here?? I need help doing a post against this specific site. Thanks! @SuppressWarnings("unchecked") throw new IllegalStateException("no field named '" + name + "'

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Problem with post
mail.body: Hi there! is not a system-wide configuration directive. You need to call this method each time if you have JS event handler attached to control been clicked, or html form, etc. So, in your case, you should remove assigning to "page" variable the result instead do this: page = webClient.getCurrentWindow().getEnclosedPage() you should be good with it. Another notice is about credentials - do not use setValueAttribute(), it is much better to _simulate real user_, who actually _types_, so, just call loginInput.type( "username" ), the same for password. Hope all this will help you! -- With best regards, Roman Dushko http://rodush.com/ skype: rodush

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Problem with post
mail.body: Ooops, sorry - very long timeout - should be 2 seconds == 2000 :) Btw, use `waitForBackgroundJavaScriptStartingBefore()` - it is much clever method :) http://rodush.com/ -- With best regards, Roman Dushko http://rodush.com/ skype: rodush

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Problem with post
mail.body: Is there a way to get notified once the page is ready? Letting the timeout to be 10-20 seconds. mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] (no subject)
mail.body: Hi There, This is not a bug report, but more a small complaint about syntax and its use. I am having a problem with the logic of the method: com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HtmlElement.hasHtmlElementWithId(String) It’s logic is : Returns true if there is an element in this element's page with the specified ID. Now I want to test it to see if a row with a given id is present in the given table: In my case I create an HtmlTable object with the table with the id “t4”. Here is my test: @Test publicvoidtestGetLastCellById_withoutId() throwsFailingHttpStatusCodeException, HtmlTable l_currentTable = (HtmlTable) ((HtmlPage) webClient.getPage(getClass().getResource( My goal is that if the “id” is not present in the table I return the last cell of the first row. Here is the code of DBExelTestTools.getLastCell. I look for an id = “row1” in a table with the id “t3”that does not have that id. /** * This method returns the last cell in the given row in the given table, * given the id of the row. If not rows have id's it is the very first row * that is returned * * @paramin_table * @paramin_id * @return */ publicstaticHtmlTableCell returngetLastCell(in_table, What happens is that in the condition “if(in_table.hasHtmlElementWithId(in_id))” is “true” because there is a row in another table that contains that id. Although it is according to the specification, it does not seem very intuitive. I could solve this with a try/catch for ElementNotFound, but that is not considered as good practice… Best regards Baubak Gandomi Visit the wonderful : http://www.uglycityguide.com

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] (no subject)

Here is the code of DBExelTestTools.getLastCell. I look for an id = “row1” in a table with the id “t3”that does not have that id. /** * This method returns the last cell in the given row in the given table, * given the id of the row. If not rows have id's it is the very first row * that is returned * * @paramin_table * @paramin_id * @return */ publicstaticHtmlTableCell returngetLastCell(in_table, What happens is that in the condition “if(in_table.hasHtmlElementWithId(in_id))” is “true” because there is a row in another table that contains that id. mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] (no subject)
mail.body: Hi folks, New to this list, and relatively new to htmlunit, been using for about six months now. I have ran into a problem that i cannot seem to resolve, no matter how much googling/forum scanning i tried. Here's the issue I have a page with html and javascript. The page has a button on it, that when clicked does a POST and logs the user into his account. The problem is that Right after the button is clicked, there is a javascript action that does a GET call to a logging server, that logs the action.. So the sequence of events goes like this. BUTTON CLICKGET -- logging server callPOST -- info to log user inACCOUNT PAGE LOAD The GET and POST both happened on the first button click. Now using HTMLUnit, what i am trying to test that code by doing this However, what i get back for HtmlPage is from the GET (first action) call, when what i want is from the POST (second action). What is the recommended way to get around something like this? Thanks! ------------------------------------------------------- Steve Tang

Though the page loads correctly in a browser like Chrome, HtmlUnit seems to be unable to load the page. I observe that there are warning-messages thrown by the IncorrectnessListenerImpl - notify() method: either "Obsolete content type encountered: 'application/x-javascript" or "Obsolete content type encountered: 'text/javascript". None other windows is opened when you use a normal browser, I mean the browser use the same window to load the new page. Can anyone help me? I really appreciate it. Thank you all. -- View this message in context: http://htmlunit.10904.n7.nabble.com/click-on-the-node-doesn-t-return-the-page-onClick-Event-in-Node-tp29467p29474.html Sent from the HtmlUnit - General mailing list archive at Nabble.com.

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] NullPointer exception when submitting a form
mail.body: I'm using HtmlUnit with Selenium. The way that Selenium use HtmlUnit is different from the one described at HtmlUnit project 'Get Started' page ( http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/gettingStarted.html ): Selenium uses a PageFactory pattern and passes an instance of WebDriver to the page constructor: private static final Logger logger = @Before At HtmlUnit project Get Started you use a WebClient instance: @Test final HtmlPage page = webClient.getPage(" http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net Assert.assertTrue(pageAsText.contains("Support for the HTTP and The problem I have when using HtmlUnitDriver happens when submitting a page/form: ... searchBox.sendKeys("=" + task + "\n"); //calling submit doe not work either. The above code works without problem with FirefoxDriver. But wih HtmlUnitDriver I got the below error: java.lang.NullPointerException at org.openqa.selenium.htmlunit.HtmlUnitWebElement.submitForm(HtmlUnitWebElement.java:194) at org.openqa.selenium.htmlunit.HtmlUnitWebElement.submit(HtmlUnitWebElement.java:174) at org.openqa.selenium.htmlunit.HtmlUnitWebElement.sendKeys(HtmlUnitWebElement.java:333) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597) at org.openqa.selenium.support.events.EventFiringWebDriver$EventFiringWebElement$1.invoke(EventFiringWebDriver.java:327) at $Proxy29.sendKeys(Unknown Source) at org.openqa.selenium.support.events.EventFiringWebDriver$EventFiringWebElement.sendKeys(EventFiringWebDriver.java:350) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597) at org.openqa.selenium.support.pagefactory.internal.LocatingElementHandler.invoke(LocatingElementHandler.java:41) at $Proxy28.sendKeys(Unknown Source) As you see, it fails because the input textfield was not in FORM element. Any idea to solve that ? Thank you.

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] NullPointer exception when submitting a form
mail.body: Hi Serguei, HtmlUnitDriver is part of Selenium/WebDriver, and relevant issue should be submitted there. Ahmed ________________________________ To: htmlunit-user@... Sent: Wednesday, December 12, 2012 3:03 PM Subject: [Htmlunit-user] NullPointer exception when submitting a form I'm using HtmlUnit with Selenium. The way that Selenium use HtmlUnit is different from the one described at HtmlUnit project 'Get Started' page ( http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/gettingStarted.html ): Selenium uses a PageFactory pattern and passes an instance of WebDriver to the page constructor: @Before At HtmlUnit project Get Started you use a WebClient instance: @Test http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net The problem I have when using HtmlUnitDriver happens when submitting a page/form: ... searchBox.clear(); searchBox.click(); searchBox.sendKeys("=" + task + "\n"); //calling submit doe not work either. The above code works without problem with FirefoxDriver. But wih HtmlUnitDriver I got the below error: java.lang.NullPointerException at org.openqa.selenium.htmlunit.HtmlUnitWebElement.submitForm(HtmlUnitWebElement.java:194) at org.openqa.selenium.htmlunit.HtmlUnitWebElement.submit(HtmlUnitWebElement.java:174) at org.openqa.selenium.htmlunit.HtmlUnitWebElement.sendKeys(HtmlUnitWebElement.java:333) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597) at org.openqa.selenium.support.events.EventFiringWebDriver$EventFiringWebElement$1.invoke(EventFiringWebDriver.java:327) at $Proxy29.sendKeys(Unknown Source) at org.openqa.selenium.support.events.EventFiringWebDriver$EventFiringWebElement.sendKeys(EventFiringWebDriver.java:350) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597) at org.openqa.selenium.support.pagefactory.internal.LocatingElementHandler.invoke(LocatingElementHandler.java:41) at $Proxy28.sendKeys(Unknown Source) As you see, it fails because the input textfield was not in FORM element. Any idea to solve that ? Thank you. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ LogMeIn Rescue: Anywhere, Anytime Remote support for IT. mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Expecting hasHtmlElementWithId to look only in sub-nodes
mail.body: Hi Sorry for this mess up. There seems to be a bit of bad formatting of my code that also causes a bit of a problem. I do understand your comments Ahmed. My problem arizes when I am testing the method rather than in an actual page. Here is a better example: My problem is that if I perform the following. For an HtmlPage object called "myPage", encompassing the two tables above: I execute the following: tableObject2.hasHtmlElementWithId("r1") I get true. Yet there is no element with the id "r1" in the table "t2". I.e. tableObject1.hasHtmlElementWithId("r1") == tableObject2.hasHtmlElementWithId("r1") == myPage.hasHtmlElementWithId("r1") Now looking at your explanations and diddling with javascript's getElementById I see that "hasHtmlElementWithId" is not for nested DOM objects. I think it a bit unituitive, but it is working as you say. Best regards and thanks, Baubak ---------------------------------------------------------------------- Message: 1 Date: Sat, 8 Dec 2012 02:11:49 -0800 (PST) Subject: Re: [Htmlunit-user] (no subject) To: "htmlunit-user@..." Message-ID: Content-Type: text/plain; charset="utf-8" Hi Baubak, Having two elements with same ID is very bad. Did you try the real browsers behavior of .getElementById() in this case? Because we follow what real browsers do. Yours, Ahmed ________________________________ From: Baubak To: "htmlunit-user@..." Sent: Friday, December 7, 2012 12:01 PM Subject: [Htmlunit-user] (no subject) Hi There, ? This is not a bug report, but more a small complaint about syntax and its use. ? I am having a problem with the logic of the method: com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HtmlElement.hasHtmlElementWithId(String) ? It?s logic is : Returns true if there is an element in this element's page with the specified ID. ? Now I want to test it to see if a row with a given id is present in the given table: ? ????????????? ???????????????????? ?????? ???????????????????? ? In my case I create an HtmlTable object with the table with the id ?t4?. Here is my test: ? @Test ?????? publicvoidtestGetLastCellById_withoutId() throwsFailingHttpStatusCodeException, ???????????????????? ? ????????????? HtmlTable l_currentTable = (HtmlTable) ((HtmlPage) webClient.getPage(getClass().getResource( ?????????????????????????? ? ????????????? assertEquals("e", DBExelTestTools.getLastCell(l_currentTable, ? My goal is that if the ?id? is not present in the table I return the last cell of the first row. Here is the code of DBExelTestTools.getLastCell. I look for an id = ?row1? in a table with the id ?t3?that does not have that id. ? /** ?????? ?* This method returns the last cell in the given row in the given table, ?????? ?* given the id of the row. If not rows have id's it is the very first row ?????? ?* that is returned ?????? ?* ?????? ?* @paramin_table ?????? ?* @paramin_id ?????? ?* @return ?????? ?*/ ?????? publicstaticHtmlTableCell ???????????????????? ???????????????????? ????????????? ???????????????????? returngetLastCell(in_table, ????????????? ? What happens is that in the condition ?if(in_table.hasHtmlElementWithId(in_id))? is ?true? because there is a row in another table that contains that id. Although it is according to the specification, it does not seem very intuitive. ? I could solve this with a try/catch for ElementNotFound, but that is not considered as good practice? ? Best regards ? Baubak Gandomi ? mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Expecting hasHtmlElementWithId to look only in sub-nodes
mail.body: Hi Baubak, I get your point. I don't see any value of HtmlElement.hasHtmlElementWithId(), since it should be at HtmlPage level. BTW, there isn't a single usage of it, and no test cases. Unless someone complains, it will be deprecated, to be marked for removal. Yours, Ahmed ________________________________ Sent: Monday, December 10, 2012 4:34 PM Subject: [Htmlunit-user] Expecting hasHtmlElementWithId to look only in sub-nodes Hi Sorry for this mess up. There seems to be a bit of bad formatting of my code that also causes a bit of a problem. I do understand your comments Ahmed. My problem arizes when I am testing the method rather than in an actual page. Here is a better example: My problem is that if I perform the following. For an HtmlPage object called "myPage", encompassing the two tables above: I execute the following: tableObject2.hasHtmlElementWithId("r1") I get true. Yet there is no element with the id "r1" in the table "t2". I.e. tableObject1.hasHtmlElementWithId("r1") == tableObject2.hasHtmlElementWithId("r1") == myPage.hasHtmlElementWithId("r1") Now looking at your explanations and diddling with javascript's getElementById I see that "hasHtmlElementWithId" is not for nested DOM objects. I think it a bit unituitive, but it is working as you say. Best regards and thanks, Baubak

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] page.getElementById.click() not available in 2.11?
mail.body: I just changed one of my projects from HTMLUnit 2.10 to 2.11 and all the page.getElementById.click()s are underlined in red and eclipse recommends that I cast it, I have tried casting it and after running it I get a "NoSuchMethodError" exception. Am I making a mistake on my side or do I need to do something differently in 2.11?

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] page.getElementById.click() not available in 2.11?
mail.body: Hi Arya, As documented: "INCOMPATIBLE CHANGE: change the return type of HtmlPage.getElementById(), .getElementByName(), .getElementsByName(), .getElementsByTagName(), .getElementsByIdAndOrName() and HtmlElement.getChildElements() from HtmlElement to DomElement." You can use htmlPage.getHtmlElementById() instead. Ahmed ________________________________ To: htmlunit-user@... Sent: Saturday, December 8, 2012 9:28 PM Subject: [Htmlunit-user] page.getElementById.click() not available in 2.11? I just changed one of my projects from HTMLUnit 2.10 to 2.11 and all the page.getElementById.click()s are underlined in red and eclipse recommends that I cast it, I have tried casting it and after running it I get a "NoSuchMethodError" exception. Am I making a mistake on my side or do I need to do something differently in 2.11? ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ LogMeIn Rescue: Anywhere, Anytime Remote support for IT. mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Issue using CSS Selectors with '*', '$', '^'
mail.body: Hi All, We are in the process of creating an automation framework using HTMLUnit (and Selenium too). This requires us to make use of CSS Selector to identify objects and perform subsequent operations on them. In order to efficiently fetch the objects, there are quite a few places that requires CSS Selectors to make use of regular expressions. For example: On the web page: http://www.google.com/ Lets say I need to access the Google Logo: QuerySelector: div#hplogo QuerySelector (with Regular Expression): div[id*='logo'] The one with the regular expression does not work and gives an exception. com.steadystate.css.sac.TestCSSParseException: Error in attribute selector. Invalid token "*". Was expecting one of: <S>, "=", "]", "~=", "|=". In fact, either of the symbols $, ^, * return the same exception and as a result the best use of CSS is not utilized. Can you please provide some help on this issue, as making use of CSS Selector is very efficient for our object identification. (As a fall back, we move to Xpath, however, want to avoid it as much as possible). We are using htmlunit-2.11 jars with all dependencies (Esp. CSS Parser jar - cssparser-0.9.8.jar). *Please provide some inputs on the same at the earliest.* Regards, Dharmesh

This requires us to make use of CSS Selector to identify objects and perform subsequent operations on them. Invalid token "*". Was expecting one of: <S>, "=", "]", "~=", "|=". In fact, either of the symbols $, ^, * return the same exception and as a result the best use of CSS is not utilized. Can you please provide some help on this issue, as making use of CSS Selector is very efficient for our object identification. (As a fall back, we move to Xpath, however, want to avoid it as much as possible). We are using htmlunit-2.11 jars with all dependencies (Esp. CSS Parser jar - cssparser-0.9.8.jar). Please provide some inputs on the same at the earliest. Regards, Dharmesh ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Keep yourself connected to Go Parallel: BUILD Helping you discover the best ways to construct your parallel projects. http://goparallel.sourceforge.net _______________________________________________ Htmlunit-user mailing list Htmlunit-user@... https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Issue using CSS Selectors with '*', '$', '^'
mail.body: Hi Ahmed, Based on the code you have given, the query selector should be 'id1' then it returns length as 1. Normal regular expressions like * works good with browsers. The issue lies when its used with HtmlUnit. Thanks, Dharmesh *Re: [Htmlunit-user] Issue using CSS Selectors with '*', '$', '^'* From: Ahmed Ashour <asashour@......> - 2012-12-05 07:46 Hi, Can you provide a JavaScript example, the below doesn't work with real browsers: Yours, Ahmed On Mon, Dec 3, 2012 at 4:29 PM, Dharmesh Vaya <dharam.vaya@...> wrote: http://www.google.com/

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Issue using CSS Selectors with '*', '$', '^'

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Supported Browsers
mail.body: I think if the latest HTMLUnit supports the big three that are two years old or less, that would be awesome. I do not think that supporting the absolute latest is really necessary. Supporting anything older than two years seems unnecessary as fast as browsers are moving and with the automatic updates most operating systems have. Thanks! Tony Z On Fri, Nov 30, 2012 at 8:14 AM, Rural Hunter <ruralhunter@...> wrote: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Usage_share_of_web_browsers http://p.sf.net/sfu/zoho_dev2dev_nov https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://goparallel.sourceforge.net https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Supported Browsers
mail.body: What i like to see supported by HtmlUnit in 2013 Firefox supported ESR version (FF 17) best effort current version IE supported IE8 best effort IE9, IE10 Chrome best effort current version I think we have to focus on the quality and stability of some major version (at least one FF and one IE). Additionally we can try to be in sync with the latest release, but because of the frequent releases, this will always be a 'best effort' solution. RBRi -------------------------- Wetator Smart web application testing http://www.wetator.org

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Supported Browsers
mail.body: Hi Ronald, As suggested by Tony, two years is a reasonable time to disregard a browser. Why IE9 is best effort? And how about supporting only IE9, and ignoring IE8. When IE10 is released, we take one year to adapt it, then deprecate IE9 (since it will be more than 2 years of release). Ahmed ________________________________ Sent: Monday, December 3, 2012 11:08 PM Subject: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Supported Browsers What i like to see supported by HtmlUnit in 2013 Firefox supported ESR version (FF 17) best effort current version IE supported IE8 best effort IE9, IE10 Chrome best effort current version I think we have to focus on the quality and stability of some major version (at least one FF and one IE). Additionally we can try to be in sync with the latest release, but because of the frequent releases, this will always be a 'best effort' solution. RBRi -------------------------- Wetator Smart web application testing http://www.wetator.org ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Keep yourself connected to Go Parallel: BUILD Helping you discover the best ways to construct your parallel projects. http://goparallel.sourceforge.net _______________________________________________ Htmlunit-user mailing list Htmlunit-user@... https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Supported Browsers
mail.body: >As suggested by Tony, two years is a reasonable time to disregard a browser. Thats Tony's point of view. But my one is different. I think i have stressed my point serveral times here. Wetator is used by large companies for testing there in house custom made applications. And this componies do not adapt every new IE version as soon at it is available. We are talking about thousands pc's. So you can like it or hate it but this is the environment i have to live with. BTW i got a new laptop two weeks before and this one still has IE8. Simple answer. Because the number of HtmlUnit developers is that small. We can support whatever is around, but supporting a browser makes only sense if we are able to really support that one including testing and bugfixing. Otherwise it is best effort. ronald http://www.wetator.org http://goparallel.sourceforge.net https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Supported Browsers
mail.body: Thanks all for your feedback. @Ronald: Tony point was the most voted suggestion. Anyhow, we will do the following: IE: - Deprecate IE6/7, and stop running their tests in the build server. The functionality will exist for some time, as per deprecation policy [1] - Make IE8 the default one. - Start to support IE9 FF: - Deprecate FF3.6 and FF10, same as IE6/7 - Focus on FF 17 ESR - No current need for FF_Latest, since ESR is released every 10 months [2]. We can add it later if needed. Chrome: - Deprecate Chrome 16 - Focus on Chrome_Latest Yours, Ahmed [1] http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/codingConventions.html#Deprecation [2] http://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/organizations/faq/ ________________________________ Sent: Tuesday, December 4, 2012 9:08 PM Subject: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Supported Browsers Thats Tony's point of view. But my one is different. I think i have stressed my point serveral times here. Wetator is used by large companies for testing there in house custom made applications. And this componies do not adapt every new IE version as soon at it is available. We are talking about thousands pc's. So you can like it or hate it but this is the environment i have to live with. BTW i got a new laptop two weeks before and this one still has IE8. Simple answer. Because the number of HtmlUnit developers is that small. We can support whatever is around, but supporting a browser makes only sense if we are able to really support that one including testing and bugfixing. Otherwise it is best effort. ronald http://www.wetator.org http://goparallel.sourceforge.net https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Supported Browsers
mail.body: Hi Vasu, Limited capacity! Browser statistics shows it is 4-8%. You can join the development team and update the test cases, and help supporting it. IE9/FF17/Chrome support some of them, so we follow. BTW, HtmlUnit with FF10 already has primitive supports for few, open a case if you encounter an issue. Yours, Ahmed ________________________________ To: Ahmed Ashour <asashour@...>; htmlunit-user@... Sent: Wednesday, December 5, 2012 9:50 AM Subject: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Supported Browsers This set is good enough. How about support for Safari? Also, is there any plan to support HTML5 tags. Regards Vasu

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Thread waits endlessly.
mail.body: Hi, I believe this is Java/DNS related issue, You can: - Use InetAddress.isReachable() as hinted in: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6999306/java-quickly-check-for-network-connection - Check firewall as hinted in http://stackoverflow.com/questions/13025957/java-applet-behind-proxy-experiences-temporary-freezes-when-instantiating-new-cl Yours, Ahmed ________________________________ To: htmlunit-user@... mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlImage's "download image if needed" doesn't timeout
mail.body: Hi, Can you use latest snapshot and advise? [1] From checking the source code, the same WebClient is being used. Ahmed [1] http://build.canoo.com/htmlunit/artifacts/ ________________________________ To: htmlunit-user@... Sent: Friday, November 30, 2012 9:27 PM Subject: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlImage's "download image if needed" doesn't timeout I download html pages then I try to rank all the images included in the page by their size. I run this from many threads. After several days of running it happens that one of the threads gets stuck in the following call. My question is, how can we set a timeout on the the HtmlImage download. I already set WebClient timeout, but it seems that this particular Connection (that gets the htmlimage is needed) is not obeying the same setting as for the connection that obtained the HtmlPage. So as i said this issue appear very rarely but when it happens it blocks the whole application as it seems that there is no way to forcefully end it. Sometime it takes more than an hour to continue the processing from the "socketConnect" (if it can recover by itself), and some other times i need need to shut the whole thing down after 2 hours of idling. FYI, I can notice via linux's "lsof" that there are quite a few "CLOSE_WAIT" threads from the htmlunit connections (reaching a steady arpox 200 for most of the time) however, even so, I never run out of file handles. Thus I exclude the freezing being caused by OS running out of handles. And the stack trace from the thread dump is: "Pool-3-thread-6" daemon prio=10 tid=0x0a64a800 nid=0x492 runnable [0x7985c000] java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.socketConnect(Native Method) at java.net.AbstractPlainSocketImpl.doConnect(AbstractPlainSocketImpl.java:339) - locked <0xa5f27a50> (a java.net.SocksSocketImpl) at java.net.AbstractPlainSocketImpl.connectToAddress(AbstractPlainSocketImpl.java:200) at java.net.AbstractPlainSocketImpl.connect(AbstractPlainSocketImpl.java:182) at java.net.SocksSocketImpl.connect(SocksSocketImpl.java:391) at java.net.Socket.connect(Socket.java:579) at org.apache.http.conn.scheme.PlainSocketFactory.connectSocket(PlainSocketFactory.java:127) at org.apache.http.impl.conn.DefaultClientConnectionOperator.openConnection(DefaultClientConnectionOperator.java:180) at org.apache.http.impl.conn.ManagedClientConnectionImpl.open(ManagedClientConnectionImpl.java:294) at org.apache.http.impl.client.DefaultRequestDirector.tryConnect(DefaultRequestDirector.java:640) at org.apache.http.impl.client.DefaultRequestDirector.execute(DefaultRequestDirector.java:479) at org.apache.http.impl.client.AbstractHttpClient.execute(AbstractHttpClient.java:906) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.HttpWebConnection.getResponse(HttpWebConnection.java:171) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.WebClient.loadWebResponseFromWebConnection(WebClient.java:1484) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.WebClient.loadWebResponse(WebClient.java:1402) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HtmlImage.downloadImageIfNeeded(HtmlImage.java:397) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HtmlImage.readImageIfNeeded(HtmlImage.java:404) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HtmlImage.getWidth(HtmlImage.java:347) Any idea greatly appreciated. -- Bogdan ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Keep yourself connected to Go Parallel: TUNE You got it built. mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlImage's "download image if needed" doesn't timeout
mail.body: Sorry Ahmed, I think I figured out what is happening. My code currently was not expecting an IOExpetion to be thrown in the getwidth(). Now, I surrounded the getWidth with a start end logging step or debugging and i noticed that there is timeout indeed occurring every minute, but the getwidth in this case throws an IOException (the actual timeout i guess) that confuses the comparator I use. This expection seems to push the sort alogorithm in a infinite loop inside the Arrays.sort. I can see in my code multiple attempts to get the width. I'm sorry to disturb you, I think the issue is solved now. I'll confirm later when I get it all fixed. Thanks anyway, Bogdan On Sun, Dec 2, 2012 at 9:41 PM, Yamigo Support <support@...> wrote: http://build.canoo.com/htmlunit/artifacts/ http://java.net.plainsocketimpl.so/>.PlainSocketImpl.socketConnect(Native http://java.net.abstractplainsocketimpl.do/ http://java.net.so/ http://java.net.abstractplainsocketimpl.co/ http://java.net.sockssocketimpl.co/ http://java.net.socket.co/ http://goparallel.sourceforge.net https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://goparallel.sourceforge.net https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user -- Bogdan Onoiu Yamigo | 358 50 386 6491 | Skype: bogdanonoiu

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlImage's "download image if needed" doesn't timeout
mail.body: Maybe on more question though. Is there any way to decrease the amount of CLOSE_WAIT connections? I start to believe that this may actually have something to do with the fact that timeouts in "HtmlImage downloadifneeded" start to occur. As far as I know, CLOSE_WAIT is a sign that the htmlclient is not finally releasing the socket even if the server signaled the wish to terminate the connection. Any thoughts on this one? Cheers, Bogdan On Sun, Dec 2, 2012 at 10:10 PM, Yamigo Support <support@...> wrote: http://build.canoo.com/htmlunit/artifacts/ http://java.net.plainsocketimpl.so/>.PlainSocketImpl.socketConnect(Native http://java.net.abstractplainsocketimpl.do/ http://java.net.so/ http://java.net.abstractplainsocketimpl.co/ http://java.net.sockssocketimpl.co/ http://java.net.socket.co/ http://goparallel.sourceforge.net https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://goparallel.sourceforge.net https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user -- Bogdan Onoiu Yamigo | 358 50 386 6491 | Skype: bogdanonoiu

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Yahoo Mail Login
mail.body: hi folks I'm tryin to create a simple script which logs into yahoo mail (ymail.com). But it does not work with htmlunit. My code: public public static void main(String[] args) throws WebClient webClient = new HtmlPage page = (HtmlPage) webClient.getPage(" http://www.ymail.com HtmlForm page = (HtmlPage) ((HtmlElement) I have verified the username and password which I'm using very often, so this can not be the mistake. Does somebody has an idea? regards erhard

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Yahoo Mail Login

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Yahoo Mail Login
mail.body: haven't used htmlunit in a bit. bear with me, if i say something that's basic, that you already know/have tried!! make sure you're actually emulating the response/request that the server is expecting. do a traffic analysis (linux/ff - use livehttpheaders) windows/ie, pick some other tool.. once you have the to/from traffic, see if there's something else going on aside from what your sample code test has. yahoo/mail should be straightforward... also, do a check with google, to see if anyone else is doing yahoo mail or google gmail with either htmlunit, selenium, phantomjs, or casper any solution for these would probably help you out as well. you could also post to stackoverflow if you haven't already. On Wed, Jan 30, 2013 at 3:16 PM, Arya <arya6000@...> wrote: http://www.ymail.com http://p.sf.net/sfu/appdyn_d2d_jan https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://p.sf.net/sfu/appdyn_d2d_jan https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] REPOST: Help to Get a Page from javascript onclick event into a new WebWindow
mail.body: Hi everybody. Right now I have a WebClient with 2 WebWindows. (Main and Review). In the Review one Enclosed Page (let's say ReviewPage) I have *several links * like this: To get another page. When I click on it, the current WebWindow (Review) gets the new page as it should be. But I need to go back to the previous page (ReviewPage) to continue clicking the rest of the links. I would like to open the new page in a NEW WebWindow. I tried this Where linkNode is the And it opened the new window (UserPage) with the right page, but it still open the new Page in the Review WebWindow too. I need to know how can I open a new window for the new page (called with javascript not with an anchor) and how can I go back to previous page in an specific window. I really appreciate any help. -- View this message in context: http://htmlunit.10904.n7.nabble.com/REPOST-Help-to-Get-a-Page-from-javascript-onclick-event-into-a-new-WebWindow-tp30001.html Sent from the HtmlUnit - General mailing list archive at Nabble.com.

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] problem with downloading page
mail.body: Hi Alek, if you get this exception all the time, then I suppose that the server closes the connection intentionally because it is not happy with what he has received. Can you give a try to a recent 2.12 snapshot? Many bugs have been fixed since release 2.11 and perhaps your problem has gone. http://build.canoo.com/htmlunit/artifacts//htmlunit-2.12-SNAPSHOT.jar Cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com Le 29/01/2013 10:29, Alek Barszczewski a écrit : http://ekw.ms.gov.pl

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] problem with downloading page
mail.body: After 2 nights and writing my own little http client and sending RAW requests I finally figured it out. 1. When sending POST request data are sent like this: field1=value1&field2=value2&field3=value3 The problem was that fields were send in different order (different than they appear in html form), like this: field3=value3&field1=value1&field2=value2 This is strange because it should be no matter of order those fields I think - in HtmlUnit/Apache HttpClient they are probably kept in something like Map<String,String> so their order is not the order they are put in Map<String,String>. 2. Connection reset Always on second request I get Connection reset on my socket. I dont know why - maybe its checking if its a browser since as far as I know browser has to reconnect and repeat request - I do the same and it works. Thanks for your answer, Cheers, Alek http://build.canoo.com/htmlunit/artifacts//htmlunit-2.12-SNAPSHOT.jar http://mguillem.wordpress.com http://ekw.ms.gov.pl http://p.sf.net/sfu/appdyn_d2d_jan https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] problem with downloading page
mail.body: Hi Alek, > After 2 nights and writing my own little http client and sending RAW this is interesting. Can you provide an example where the order differs between HtmlUnit and simulated browser. is the connection reset for a normal browser too? Cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] problem with downloading page
mail.body: 1. I will try, but now I have some work to do 2. I don't know - it doesnt say that, but maybe it handles it silently, repeating request - but it's strange anyway as the server should send CONNECTION response instead of reseting it - but I am not expert I just looked inside HTTP RFC. Alek http://mguillem.wordpress.com http://p.sf.net/sfu/appdyn_d2d_jan https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] problem with downloading page
mail.body: Hey, the problem with data order in POST is not appearing in HtmlUnit - it was my mistake :) To solve problem with connection reset I wrote this simple and dirty code: public WebResponse getResponse(WebRequest settings) throws So its just catches "Connection reset" exception and retries request. The line "webClient.setJavaScriptEnabled(false);" is just because HtmlUnit throws some exception on JS which I don't care about. I have one question, maybe you know the answer - how I can save (serialize) HtmlUnit session and then bring it back? Session I mean cookies,referer and last Response. I know how to get/set cookies and Referer - the problem is with page. Lets say I get some page " http://www.google.pl " - I would like to save html of this page (somwhere on disk) and during next program run read it from disk and "apply" to WebClient so I can use page DOM parser to submit form on it for example... http://mguillem.wordpress.com http://p.sf.net/sfu/appdyn_d2d_jan https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] form-url-encoded PUT parameters

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] form-url-encoded PUT parameters

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] DomElement or HtmlElement (Help with the correct use)
mail.body: Hi everybody. I'm updating a crawler and moved HtmlUnit from 2.9 to 2.11. Most of Child's search methods now return DomElement instead of HtmlElement. I got some weird behavior, so I need to undestand whether I should use DomElement or HtmlElement. Any help would be very appreciated. Thank you very much. Rutilio -- View this message in context: http://htmlunit.10904.n7.nabble.com/DomElement-or-HtmlElement-Help-with-the-correct-use-tp29820.html Sent from the HtmlUnit - General mailing list archive at Nabble.com.

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] DomElement or HtmlElement (Help with the correct use)
mail.body: Hi Rutilio, we had to change the return type from HtmlElement to DomElement because an HTML page can contain not only HTML nodes (for instance SVG) and HtmlUnit is now able to handle (a part of) it. If you know the type of the nodes you're retrieving, you can safely cast them to HtmlElement. Cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com Le 18/01/2013 12:09, rutiliol a écrit :

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] BrowserVersion FIREFOX_3_6 / FIREFOX_10 differences and problems
mail.body: Hello. As I notice FIREFOX_10 (for WebClient.BrowserVersion) is marked as Experimental. I'm updating a java software where INTERNET_EXPLORER_8 but I noticed some problems with Javascript generating pages that are not presented when I use FIREFOX_3_6 so I decide to change the Browser. Could someone tell me what kind of problems can I have by using FIREFOX_10 or if it's better to use the FIREFOX_3_6 version? Thank you very much. -- View this message in context: http://htmlunit.10904.n7.nabble.com/BrowserVersion-FIREFOX-3-6-FIREFOX-10-differences-and-problems-tp29797.html Sent from the HtmlUnit - General mailing list archive at Nabble.com.

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] BrowserVersion FIREFOX_3_6 / FIREFOX_10 differences and problems
mail.body: Hi, BrowserVersion.FIREFOX_10 is marked as experimental because we haven't had the time to verify / adjust the behavior for all our tests. This means that the simulation is not so near to the real browser as it is with BrowserVersion.FIREFOX_3_6: in some cases BrowserVersion.FIREFOX_10 will rather behave like BrowserVersion.FIREFOX_3_6 than like the real FF10. Note that we don't continue work on BrowserVersion.FIREFOX_10 but next release should contain a good BrowserVersion.FIREFOX_17 Cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com Le 14/01/2013 18:15, rutiliol a écrit :

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] BrowserVersion FIREFOX_3_6 / FIREFOX_10 differences and problems

I would like to click one of the drop down links and grab the web page that is associated with that link. The problem seems to be that the Anchor has JavaScript and also it is a drop down list. If the Anchor did not have JavaScript and drop down then I would not have any problems. Here is the pertinent JavaScript Code: window.mm_menu_0805151542_0 = new Menu("root",211,23,"Arial, mm_menu_0805151542_0.addMenuItem("View&nbsp;Tax&nbsp;Sales","window.open('TCTaxSaleBrief.asp', mm_menu_0805151542_0.addMenuItem("Registration&nbsp;Renewal&nbsp;Reprint","window.open('vrRenewal.asp', mm_menu_0805151542_0.addMenuItem("Drivers&nbsp;License","window.open(' http://www.dds.ga.gov/ ', Here is the pertinent Anchor: onmouseover="MM_showMenu(window.mm_menu_0805151542_0,104,0,null,'link11')" Here is the snippet of Java Code that I am using to make this work. mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Accessing dynamic .js files
mail.body: Dear HtmlUnit experts, When I load a news story from CBC.ca ( example link http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/story/2013/03/01/pol-ei-investigators-manual.html ) in Firefox and "save as" a "complete webpage", among all the other stuff I receive a series of files called e.g., REL-5_004.js that contain all the comments from the article. This is true even though those files are not directly cited in the HTML source page: I am guessing they must be retrieved dynamically based on javascript commands. Using HtmlUnit and page.getByXPath, I am able to return exactly what I would see in a browser, which is the first five comments (code below; h/t matt@...). But what I would really like to do is fetch the various REL-5_00X.js files ... and if possible, skip loading the rest of the page, though that's less important. Is there some kind of "get" command I can run on the HtmlPage to obtain these files (as in firefox), or do I have to figure out the javascript that loads the comments? In the page HTML, there are a few scripts where a unique articleKey is passed as a parameter, which leads me to believe it is the comment loader, but I don't know how to use those to grab the content. Thanks in advance for any suggestions you can offer. Cheers, Jordan String url = " http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/new-brunswick/story/2013/02/28/nb-ei-.html final HtmlDivision div = (HtmlDivision) -- View this message in context: http://htmlunit.10904.n7.nabble.com/Accessing-dynamic-js-files-tp30227.html Sent from the HtmlUnit - General mailing list archive at Nabble.com.

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit/OSGi/Spring - Issues with DocumentBuilderFactory
mail.body: Hello, I am trying to deploy a Spring-enabled bundle in an OSGi container that has HtmlUnit as a dependency, but it fails when Spring tries to instantiate my beans in the application context: [2013-02-15 12:02:49.146] ERROR region-dm-13 o.s.osgi.extender.internal.activator.ContextLoaderListener Application context refresh failed (OsgiBundleXmlApplicationContext(bundle=myBundle, config=osgibundle:/META-INF/spring/*.xml)) org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanDefinitionStoreException: Unexpected exception parsing XML document from URL [ bundleentry://229.fwk260449011/META-INF/spring/bundle-context.xml ]; nested exception is javax.xml.parsers.FactoryConfigurationError: Provider org.apache.xerces.jaxp.DocumentBuilderFactoryImpl not found I noticed that in the OSGi-ified version of HtmlUnit the DocumentBuilderFactory is set to the above implementation which means that when Spring tries to get a DocumentBuilderFactory in my HtmlUnit dependent bundle, it tries to get the above one and can't find it, so it fails. My other bundles (also Spring enabled) use the implementation that is provided by the JDK: [2013-02-15 12:02:32.281] DEBUG start-signalling-1 org.springframework.beans.factory.xml.DefaultDocumentLoader Using JAXP provider [com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.jaxp.DocumentBuilderFactoryImpl] I can partially get around this issue by creating OSGi-ified versions of the Xerces jar and the xml-apis jars and adding those to my OSGi repository, but they include a lot of duplicate classes and packages that the core OSGi and Spring bundles already export and I would rather not do this. Does anyone know if there is a reason that the DocumentBuilderFactory is set in this way? Does anyone have any suggestions on how to fix this without having to add more Xerces stuff to my container? Thanks, Petras

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit/OSGi/Spring - Issues with DocumentBuilderFactory
mail.body: I can also work around the issue by updating the HtmlUnit jar and removing the setting of the DocumentBuilderFactory service: jar uf htmlunit-2.11.jar javax.xml.parsers.DocumentBuilderFactory is empty Does anyone know if this will have ill effects? On 2/15/13 12:23 PM, "Kuprys, Petras" <Petras.Kuprys@...> wrote: bundleentry://229.fwk260449011/META-INF/spring/bundle-context.xml http://goparallel.sourceforge.net/ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Using HtmlUnit and RequireJS
mail.body: Hi Barry, please note that you have to subsribe first before to post to an HtmlUnit mailing list. I think that the problem you report has been fixed for a few weeks. You can try to pick a recent HtmlUnit-2.12 snapshot (with all dependencies) and use it through the HtmlUnitDriver but I can't promise that it works. Cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com Le 15/02/2013 09:16, Barry Pitman a écrit :> Hi, > I have a WebDriver test suite of around 400 tests which run using > HtmlUnitDriver (using version HtmlUnit version 2.10, but I get the same > issues in 2.11). I have found HtmlUnit(Driver) to be reliable for > running the tests, and really fast. > I have recently modified our application to use RequireJS for > asynchronous script loading (from just using script tags before). The > tests pass in the other WebDriver implementations, but hang mysteriously > in HtmlUnitDriver. It seems to be quite indeterminate - but after 10 > tests it is usually hanging. It is always hanging in this loop: > *net.sourceforge.htmlunit.corejs.javascript.ScriptableObject:2007* > public static Scriptable getTopLevelScope(Scriptable obj) > Here is the stacktrace (from thread dump): > "JS executor for com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.WebClient@..." > daemon prio=6 tid=0x000000000fd48800 nid=0x257c runnable > [0x000000000f7ae000] > java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE > at net.sourceforge.htmlunit.corejs.javascript.ScriptableObject.getTopLevelScope(ScriptableObject.java:2007) > at net.sourceforge.htmlunit.corejs.javascript.Interpreter.interpretLoop(Interpreter.java:1598) > at net.sourceforge.htmlunit.corejs.javascript.Interpreter.interpret(Interpreter.java:854) > at net.sourceforge.htmlunit.corejs.javascript.InterpretedFunction.call(InterpretedFunction.java:164) > at net.sourceforge.htmlunit.corejs.javascript.ContextFactory.doTopCall(ContextFactory.java:429) > at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.HtmlUnitContextFactory.doTopCall(HtmlUnitContextFactory.java:267) > at net.sourceforge.htmlunit.corejs.javascript.ScriptRuntime.doTopCall(ScriptRuntime.java:3183) > at net.sourceforge.htmlunit.corejs.javascript.InterpretedFunction.call(InterpretedFunction.java:162) > at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.JavaScriptEngine$4.doRun(JavaScriptEngine.java:537) > at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.JavaScriptEngine$HtmlUnitContextAction.run(JavaScriptEngine.java:588) > - locked <0x00000007e7a1d2a8> (a > com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HtmlPage) > at net.sourceforge.htmlunit.corejs.javascript.Context.call(Context.java:537) > at net.sourceforge.htmlunit.corejs.javascript.ContextFactory.call(ContextFactory.java:538) > at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.JavaScriptEngine.callFunction(JavaScriptEngine.java:544) > at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.JavaScriptEngine.callFunction(JavaScriptEngine.java:519) > at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HtmlPage.executeJavaScriptFunctionIfPossible(HtmlPage.java:927) > at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.background.JavaScriptFunctionJob.runJavaScript(JavaScriptFunctionJob.java:53) > at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.background.JavaScriptExecutionJob.run(JavaScriptExecutionJob.java:101) > at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.background.JavaScriptJobManagerImpl.runSingleJob(JavaScriptJobManagerImpl.java:328) > at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.background.DefaultJavaScriptExecutor.run(DefaultJavaScriptExecutor.java:153) > at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:722) > Given, the indeterminate failures, I'm tempted to think there is some > issue with our AMD/RequireJS configuration. However, it runs fine in > other browsers, so I suppose it could be HtmlUnit specific. The HtmlUnit > log entries don't seem to indicate any errors. > So my question is, has anyone else had issues like these? Has anyone > used HtmlUnit successfully for AMD-based websites? > Thanks! > Barry

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Using HtmlUnit and RequireJS
mail.body: I have just tried it out with the latest WebDriver (2.29.1) and HtmlUnit snapshot (htmlunit-core-js-2.12-SNAPSHOT), and it still ends up hanging in the same place. Actually, the prior tests are now failing as well, with this message: java.lang.ClassCastException: com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.host.html.HTMLFormElement cannot be cast to com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.host.Window Though I suppose that could be due to an incompatibility between the WebDriver and HtmlUnit versions that I am using. Marc, if the fix that you are referring to is this one: http://sourceforge.net/p/htmlunit/bugs/1259/ , I don't think it is the exact same issue (though maybe related). That issue describes a deadlock in javaScriptEngine.doProcessPostponedActions, but I'm running into a never ending loop in ScriptableObject.getTopLevelScope. I can try put together a test case if that would help? Just wanted to check first if anyone else had experienced this before. Are there any users who have successfully used HtmlUnit on sites using AMD/RequireJS? I assume that there are... Thanks, Barry On Fri, Feb 15, 2013 at 9:22 AM, Marc Guillemot <mguillemot@...> wrote: http://mguillem.wordpress.com

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Using HtmlUnit and RequireJS
mail.body: Hi Barry, http://sourceforge.net/p/htmlunit/bugs/1259/ , I don't think it is the no this is not this issue. This was an issue that was only reported in the mailing list. Here is the commit fixing it: http://sourceforge.net/p/htmlunit/code/8033 a test case is surely the best thing to illustrate the problem. Cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Using HtmlUnit and RequireJS
mail.body: Hi Marc, Thanks for that commit URL. I realized that the commit was newer than the snapshot version that I was testing. When I looked around for where to get the latest snapshots, this page: http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/gettingLatestCode.html lists the Sonatype snapshot repo, but the latest version there ( https://oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/snapshots/net/sourceforge/htmlunit/htmlunit/2.12-SNAPSHOT/ ) is htmlunit-2.12-20130107.084917-2.jar, which is older than the commit. Would it be possible to load a newer version there? Anyway, I checked out the SVN trunk and built it, and the issue appears to be fixed, no more hanging. One other issue, the SVN URL listed here, http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/gettingLatestCode.html appears to be incorrect, I think that it should be "svn checkout svn://svn.code.sf.net/p/htmlunit/code/trunk htmlunit"? Thanks a lot! -- View this message in context: http://htmlunit.10904.n7.nabble.com/Re-Using-HtmlUnit-and-RequireJS-tp30142p30147.html Sent from the HtmlUnit - General mailing list archive at Nabble.com.

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] URL getting stuck
mail.body: Hi Marc, Thanks for resolution again. Can you please tell me when we can get a stable version of HtmlUnit 2.12 released? I need to update my libraries from 2.11 to 2.12 to get rid of this issue. But I can not use snapshots. Thanks and Regards, Saurabh Vinchurkar ________________________________ To: htmlunit-user@... Sent: Tuesday, January 29, 2013 8:35 PM Subject: Re: [Htmlunit-user] URL getting stuck Hi Saurabh, the cause was an infinite loop caused by a JS call like Object(top). It was interesting as the code involved to reproduce it was really minimal. The commit fixing it is here: https://sourceforge.net/p/htmlunit/code/8033 The fix is contained in recent 2.12 snapshots. The latest one can be found here: http://build.canoo.com/htmlunit/artifacts/ Cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com Le 29/01/2013 13:40, saurabh Vinchurkar a écrit : http://mguillem.wordpress.com ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Master Visual Studio, SharePoint, SQL, ASP.NET, C# 2012, HTML5, CSS, MVC, Windows 8 Apps, JavaScript and much more. Keep your skills current with LearnDevNow - 3,200 step-by-step video tutorials by Microsoft MVPs and experts. ON SALE this month only -- learn more at: http://p.sf.net/sfu/learnnow-d2d _______________________________________________ Htmlunit-user mailing list Htmlunit-user@... https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit with Canvas and jQuery 1.9.0
mail.body: Hello all, I'm trying to use HtmlUnit to speed up my AngularJS app by pre-processing the page on the server before handing it to the client. I've run into a couple issues and wondering if anyone has a solution for them. 1. jQuery 1.9.1 causes the following error to happen and my client to hang. Feb 5, 2013 11:24:32 AM com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.StrictErrorReporter runtimeError SEVERE: runtimeError: message=[An invalid or illegal selector was specified (selector: '[i^='']' error: Invalid selectors: [i^='']).] sourceName=[ http://code.jquery.com/jquery-1.9.1.js ] line=[4213] lineSource=[null] lineOffset=[0] 2. jQuery 1.9.0 doesn't show any errors, but causes the client to hang. All I see in the output is the following: Feb 5, 2013 11:24:55 AM com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.IncorrectnessListenerImpl notify WARNING: Obsolete content type encountered: 'application/x-javascript'. Feb 5, 2013 11:24:55 AM com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.IncorrectnessListenerImpl notify WARNING: Obsolete content type encountered: 'application/x-javascript'. Feb 5, 2013 11:24:58 AM com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.IncorrectnessListenerImpl notify WARNING: Obsolete content type encountered: 'application/x-javascript'. Feb 5, 2013 11:24:58 AM com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.WebConsole$DefaultLogger warn WARNING: JQMIGRATE: jQuery is not compatible with Quirks Mode Switching to jQuery 1.8.3 causes the same error as 1.9.1, but the client doesn't hang and the process page is returned. 3. I'm using a canvas-based clock in my app ( http://randomibis.com/coolclock/ ) and it causes the following error when parsing: ======= EXCEPTION START ======== EcmaError: lineNumber=[193] column=[0] lineSource=[null] name=[TypeError] sourceName=[ http://localhost:8000/coolclock/coolclock.js ] message=[TypeError: Cannot find function rotate in object [object CanvasRenderingContext2D].
