So i think you can ignore that. RBRi -------------------------- Wetator Smart web application testing http://www.wetator.org

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit with Canvas and jQuery 1.9.0
mail.body: Hi Matt, as explained by Ronald, the invalid selector message is normal. In fact we should probably remove the current StrictErrorReporter as it is misleading. The warnings don't matter either. But this one is interesting and we should probably investigate it: Is it hanging with a recent 2.12-SNAPSHOT? If yes, could you provide us a stack dump? http://randomibis.com/coolclock/ ) and it causes the following error when http://localhost:8000/coolclock/coolclock.js ] http://sourceforge.net/p/htmlunit/bugs/1138/ the issue was about the translate method. The rotate method was missing. I've just added it (an empty placeholder in fact) and this will be available in the next snapshot when the build server has finished. with HtmlUnit-2.12-SNAPSHOT you should try to simulate FF17 rather than FF10. FF10 simulation will be abandoned. Cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit with Canvas and jQuery 1.9.0
mail.body: On Feb 6, 2013, at 12:55 AM, Marc Guillemot [via HtmlUnit] <ml-node+s10904n30084h22@...> wrote: I believe this is just a warning from jQuery Migrate that some of the JS in my page is deprecated. No, with the latest 2.12-SNAPSHOT (I built from source), the following error occurs with 1.9.0+ Feb 6, 2013 5:07:10 PM com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.WebConsole$DefaultLogger error http://randomibis.com/coolclock/ ) and it causes the following error when http://localhost:8000/coolclock/coolclock.js ] http://sourceforge.net/p/htmlunit/bugs/1138/ This works now, but moment.js does not. Not sure why as it works fine when I don't try to process it with HtmlUnit: I've changed to this and I'm still seeing errors with Highcharts: Feb 6, 2013 5:07:23 PM com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.JavaScriptEngine handleJavaScriptException INFO: Caught script exception ======= EXCEPTION START ======== EcmaError: lineNumber=[121] column=[0] lineSource=[null] name=[TypeError] sourceName=[ http://code.highcharts.com/2.3.5/modules/canvas-tools.js?_=1360195643344 http://code.highcharts.com/2.3.5/modules/canvas-tools.js?_=1360195643344#121 )] http://code.highcharts.com/2.3.5/modules/canvas-tools.js?_=1360195643344#121 ) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.JavaScriptEngine$HtmlUnitContextAction.run(JavaScriptEngine.java:669) at net.sourceforge.htmlunit.corejs.javascript.Context.call(Context.java:601) at net.sourceforge.htmlunit.corejs.javascript.ContextFactory.call(ContextFactory.java:507) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.JavaScriptEngine.callFunction(JavaScriptEngine.java:601) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.JavaScriptEngine.callFunction(JavaScriptEngine.java:576) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HtmlPage.executeJavaScriptFunctionIfPossible(HtmlPage.java:1005) The reason I started looking into HtmlUnit was because it seemed like the most recommended way to process JS on the server when using Java. I'm actually impressed with how well it does and I'm able to process my AngularJS app on the server and return a populated page rather than waiting for it to hit the client and then contact the server for data. However, the problem I've found is that using HtmlUnit to process things takes about 5 seconds whereas if I just load up the HTML (with Angular), it takes about 1 second. This could be because my laptop is fast, but I also believe it's b/c HtmlUnit's WebClient has to refetch the HTML from the server (even though it's already on the server). Looking through the API, it doesn't look like it's possible to instantiate an HtmlPage from an existing String of HTML, so I don't know if processing JS on the server is going to work for me. If I could process the JS on the server in milliseconds, that'd be a different story. -- View this message in context: http://htmlunit.10904.n7.nabble.com/HtmlUnit-with-Canvas-and-jQuery-1-9-0-tp30076p30105.html Sent from the HtmlUnit - General mailing list archive at Nabble.com.

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit with Canvas and jQuery 1.9.0
mail.body: Hi Matt, if you can provide a way to reproduce the errors you get, we can perhaps have a look at them. A few words concerning performance: - for HtmlUnit, the correct simulation of the specified browser has higher priority than the performance, nevertheless most of the time I hear from users that HtmlUnit is fast or at least "fast enough". This being said, performance improvements are always welcome - you can easily use your own WebConnection to directly feed HtmlUnit with content and skip HTTP requests. The MockWebConnection may be the right thing for you. - if you compare the performance of HtmlUnit vs the simulated browser, remember to compare the same thing: a new WebClient instance will have an empty cache whereas your "real" browser will probably have a primed cache - you can "cache the Cache" to let HtmlUnit have a primed cache too by reusing the same WebClient instance (but it can be used only from a single thread at a time) or by configuring a shared com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.Cache instance (take care that the size is high enough). This would allow avoid HTTP requests and JS parsing. - HtmlUnit uses Rhino in interpreted mode. Personally my experiments have never showed an improvement by using the compiled mode but a user once reported me that it was the case for him. Cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com Le 07/02/2013 01:16, matt@... a écrit : http://randomibis.com/coolclock/ ) and it causes the following error http://localhost:8000/coolclock/coolclock.js ] http://sourceforge.net/p/htmlunit/bugs/1138/ http://code.highcharts.com/2.3.5/modules/canvas-tools.js?_=1360195643344 ] http://code.highcharts.com/2.3.5/modules/canvas-tools.js?_=1360195643344#121 )] http://code.highcharts.com/2.3.5/modules/canvas-tools.js?_=1360195643344#121 )

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit with Canvas and jQuery 1.9.0
mail.body: On Feb 7, 2013, at 2:19 AM, Marc Guillemot [via HtmlUnit] <ml-node+s10904n30106h4@...> wrote: You can see the app I'm trying to compile on the server at: http://static.raibledesigns.com/mc/app/index.html My goal is to have a filter that precompiles on the server and gives the full HTML app to the user, initialized with data and click events. I don't know if this is possible, but it seems reasonable. I was able to use the following method using a StringWebResponse. Is the MockWebConnection a better way? http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6136435/how-to-create-htmlunit-htmlpage-object-from-string This does seem to work - however, I'm having issues getting the html from the response. I've tried the following recommendation, but the content is always empty: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/701681/how-can-i-read-an-httpservletreponses-output-stream I've written some tests to see what the difference is b/w fetching via URL via reading a string. It looks like reading from a String is 3x as fast (3 seconds vs. 9). https://gist.github.com/mraible/4733381 That's a good idea, especially since the CSS and JS won't change per user. The JSON might - is there any way to cache certain requests and not others? Do you have an example? Thanks, Matt http://mguillem.wordpress.com http://randomibis.com/coolclock/ ) and it causes the following error http://localhost:8000/coolclock/coolclock.js ] http://sourceforge.net/p/htmlunit/bugs/1138/ http://code.highcharts.com/2.3.5/modules/canvas-tools.js?_=1360195643344 ] http://code.highcharts.com/2.3.5/modules/canvas-tools.js?_=1360195643344#121 )] http://code.highcharts.com/2.3.5/modules/canvas-tools.js?_=1360195643344#121 ) http://p.sf.net/sfu/sophos-d2d-feb https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://htmlunit.10904.n7.nabble.com/HtmlUnit-with-Canvas-and-jQuery-1-9-0-tp30076p30106.html -- View this message in context: http://htmlunit.10904.n7.nabble.com/HtmlUnit-with-Canvas-and-jQuery-1-9-0-tp30076p30111.html Sent from the HtmlUnit - General mailing list archive at Nabble.com.

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] JS executor thread stays too long
mail.body: Hi, I'm using HtmlUnit in a server architecture (inside servlets) to simulate user behaviors on web sites. But, it's a server so we need to catch every errors to keep memory and cpu resources as clean as possible. I found that some JS threads stay in memory even after calling WebClient.closeAllWindows(), even if i put a timeout for the JavaScript engine. I use HtmlUnit 2.12-snapshot build 2249 with OpenJDK 1.6.0_24 on Ubuntu 10.04 64bits. Here is a code that shows the problem. I just get a page and exit from the "execute" method after clearing WebClient instance. Then, I trace the JS executor thread each 30 seconds. It can stay more than 1 hour or, for some url, a day or indefinitely. All FIREFOX browser versions seems not to work but CHROME seems ok. HtmlUnit is a part of the core of the project so I really need help. Thanks, Ultramou -- View this message in context: http://htmlunit.10904.n7.nabble.com/JS-executor-thread-stays-too-long-tp30095.html Sent from the HtmlUnit - General mailing list archive at Nabble.com.

However, I have consistently succeeded in getting elements by the 'class' attribute. So, I suggest, try the 'class' attribute if the trash-element has value for that; otherwise try the 'class' attribute on the minimal enclosing tag with value for the 'class' attribute, then navigate to the trash-element. works, htmlunit-user@... 5:44 PM again! and the result is displayed. Now i want to change to the trash folder but this does not work. funny, because the AJAX (as seen at the inbox) works but the click does not seem to work. page = (HtmlPage) webClient.getPage(" http://www.ymail.com ((HtmlElement) erhard yea, I wanted to, but didn't have the time to.... but now: HtmlPage page = (HtmlPage) webClient.getPage(" http://www.ymail.com page2 = (HtmlPage) ((HtmlElement) sample help someone in the future.. wrote: 30.01.2013 um 21:16 schrieb Arya <arya6000@...>: >From what I've tried it will not work since Yahoo Mail is a very advanced web app. You can make it work by making custom http requests. On Wed, Jan 30, 2013 at 12:51 PM, Erhard M. Dinhobl jun. <er@...> wrote: yahoo mail (ymail.com [1]). But it does not work with htmlunit. My code: webClient.getOptions().setThrowExceptionOnScriptError(false); HtmlPage page = (HtmlPage) webClient.getPage(" http://www.ymail.com form.getInputByName("passwd").setValueAttribute("...."); page = (HtmlPage) ((HtmlElement) password which I'm using very often, so this can not be the mistake. mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] JavaScriptEnabled(false) without getting detected
mail.body: I tried setting setJavaScriptEnabled(false) and I'm making custom http requests. The problem is that the site I'm working with, finds out that Javascript is disabled. When I use c#'s httpwebrequest this does not happen. Is there anything I can so the website does not find out JS is disabled?

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit issue with login popup
mail.body: I am writing a program in Java with the purpose of using HtmlUnit to connect to one of the magazines I am a subscriber at, login and search for articles that interest me. Once I get that working it will send me an email but that's not relevant to my question. I can't get the login to work: I read the page Find the login button and click it Capture the result in a new page, extract the form and supply username/password and finally click on login button The link for the page is: http://www.investorschronicle.co.uk/ If you click on login, a popup comes up. But I can't seem to be able to capture the popup. This is my code: public void authenticate() throws MalformedURLException, IOException LogFactory.getFactory().setAttribute("org.apache.commons.logging.Log", webClient.addWebWindowListener(new WebWindowListener() public void webWindowOpened(WebWindowEvent event) System.out.println("a NEW window opened: " + @Override // TODO Auto-generated method stub @Override // Get the first page HtmlPage page1 = webClient.getPage(" http://www.investorschronicle.co.uk/2013/03/20/comment/simon-thompson/double-your-money-on-a-copper-bottomed-investment-2VRys25dPlDIE6TtOgZfLJ/article.html if ( windows.size() > 0) I get the login page, get the form and supply the fields. All that is done, but when on the second page and click login nothing happens. The same happens if you visit that page manually: http://www.investorschronicle.co.uk/login-overlay Even if you submit fields and click SUbmit nothing happens. I am looking at source of html page but can't figure out why, is it ajax or sth else in the background? Thanks in advance for any help -- View this message in context: http://htmlunit.10904.n7.nabble.com/HtmlUnit-issue-with-login-popup-tp30422.html Sent from the HtmlUnit - General mailing list archive at Nabble.com.

Have you considered turning logging on? - George -- ---------------------------------------------------------------------- * George Dinwiddie * http://blog.gdinwiddie.com Software Development http://www.idiacomputing.com Consultant and Coach http://www.agilemaryland.org ----------------------------------------------------------------------

( http://s0.investorschronicle.co.uk/rw/SysConfig/MPS/FT Publications/Common/js/prod/fancybox.js#42) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.JavaScriptEngine$HtmlUnitContextAction.run(JavaScriptEngine.java:669) at net.sourceforge.htmlunit.corejs.javascript.Context.call(Context.java:601) *Caused by:* net.sourceforge.htmlunit.corejs.javascript.EcmaError: TypeError: *Cannot find function appendTo in object* [object Object]. ( http://s0.investorschronicle.co.uk/rw/SysConfig/MPS/FT Publications/Common/js/prod/fancybox.js#42) at net.sourceforge.htmlunit.corejs.javascript.ScriptRuntime.constructError(ScriptRuntime.java:3603) Exception class=[net.sourceforge.htmlunit.corejs.javascript.JavaScriptException] com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.ScriptException: TypeError: Cannot find function ba in object [object Object]. mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Accessing elements by "id" value
mail.body: Hi, On HtmlPage class, it seems that: 1. getElementById() does not seem to work. 2. A call like: getByXPath("//div[@id='myId']") does not seem to work. What exactly should I do to directly access elements with value specified only for the "id" attribute? Any quick help is much appreciated. Thanks, Satya

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Accessing elements by "id" value
mail.body: Hi It works, that is sure. On getbyxpath try always a dot in front like: .//div.... And the obj u may want so select is not available. Print the page via page.asxml() Am 22.03.2013 um 03:03 schrieb Satyanarayana K <kri_satya@...>: http://p.sf.net/sfu/appdyn_d2d_mar https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Accessing elements by "id" value
mail.body: Hi, Thanks for your response. My understanding is that the '.' at the start is required to indicate current element, when you are querying an element within the HtmlPage. Is that notation needed for HtmlPage also? I know for sure that a call like getByXPath("//div[@class='myClass']") on HtmlPage works without any problems. So, why a special syntax starting with '.' only for 'id' attribute? Any way, I will try out your suggestion in my application and share the result with you. Thanks again, Satya ________________________________ Sent: Friday, March 22, 2013 1:02 PM Subject: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Accessing elements by "id" value Hi It works, that is sure. On getbyxpath try always a dot in front like: .//div.... And the obj u may want so select is not available. Print the page via page.asxml() Am 22.03.2013 um 03:03 schrieb Satyanarayana K <kri_satya@...>: Hi, ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ http://p.sf.net/sfu/appdyn_d2d_mar _______________________________________________ https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] c.g.h.javascript.StrictErrorReporter - invalid character?
mail.body: Hi Eric, can you provide an example allowing to get this error message? As far as I could test, it doesn't appear when simply referencing this js file from an html page (with HtmlUnit-2.12 simulating FF17). Cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com Le 01/03/2013 17:19, Eric Peters a écrit : https://images-na.ssl-images-amazon.com/images/G/01/x-locale/common/login/fwcim._V389173680_.js ]

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] c.g.h.javascript.StrictErrorReporter - invalid character?
mail.body: I found out that if I switched from FIREFOX_3_6 to INTERNET_EXPLORER_8 the warning went away, it seem to be tied to: BrowserVersionFeatures.JS_DOCUMENT_CREATE_ELEMENT_STRICT & probably the javascript createElement extended name= in the JS file: The warning in Document.java should probably be updated to be bit clearer about the bad createElement tag rather than just "invalid character" // FF3.6 supports document.createElement('div') or supports document.createElement('<div>') // but not document.createElement('<div name="test">') // IE supports also document.createElement('<div name="test">') // FF4+ doesn't support document.createElement('<div>') if (browserVersion.hasFeature(BrowserVersionFeatures.JS_DOCUMENT_CREATE_ELEMENT_STRICT) LOG.info("createElement: String contains an invalid throw Context.reportRuntimeError("String contains an else if (!browserVersion.hasFeature(JS_DOCUMENT_CREATE_ELEMENT_EXTENDED_SYNTAX) LOG.info("createElement: String contains an throw Context.reportRuntimeError("String contains Thanks! Eric On Thu, Mar 7, 2013 at 11:48 PM, Marc Guillemot <mguillemot@...> wrote: http://mguillem.wordpress.com https://images-na.ssl-images-amazon.com/images/G/01/x-locale/common/login/fwcim._V389173680_.js ] http://p.sf.net/sfu/symantec-dev2dev https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] c.g.h.javascript.StrictErrorReporter - invalid character?
mail.body: I saw the commit ( https://sourceforge.net/p/htmlunit/code/8151/tree//trunk/htmlunit/src/main/java/com/gargoylesoftware/htmlunit/javascript/host/Document.java?diff=50837636bfc09e131e76857c:8150 ) This might be a dumb question, but how can you view the LOG.info messages? The original debugging I was doing was based solely on the Exception that was thrown throw Context.reportRuntimeError("String contains an invalid character"); - so I was originally thinking that was the error message that should get updated :) Now that I see all of the LOG.info lines, I should probably make sure I enable logging and view those instead. Regards, Eric On Sat, Mar 9, 2013 at 2:59 AM, Ronald Brill <rbri@...> wrote: http://mguillem.wordpress.com https://images-na.ssl-images-amazon.com/images/G/01/x-locale/com http://p.sf.net/sfu/symantec-dev2dev https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://p.sf.net/sfu/symantec-dev2dev https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://p.sf.net/sfu/symantec-dev2dev https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

If you like, you can start here: http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-logging/guide.html RBRi On Mon, 18 Mar 2013 09:03:01 -0700 Eric Peters wrote: https://sourceforge.net/p/htmlunit/code/8151/tree//trunk/htmlunit/src/main/java/com/gargoylesoftware/htmlunit/javascript/host/Document.java?diff=50837636bfc0 9e131e76857c:8150) http://mguillem.wordpress.com https://images-na.ssl-images-amazon.com/images/G/01/x-locale/com http://p.sf.net/sfu/symantec-dev2dev https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://p.sf.net/sfu/symantec-dev2dev https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://p.sf.net/sfu/symantec-dev2dev https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://p.sf.net/sfu/appdyn_d2d_mar https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Returning a Captcha response to a Webpage
mail.body: hi in the HTML code there is an img tag which has the src="jcaptcha.do". you can do the following: 1. call the getPage on the webclient object with the url 2. call webClient.waitForBackgroundJavaScript(8000); //this waits for some ajax calls and response 3. select the image from the page by page.getByXPath(".//img[src='jcaptcha.do'] 4. convert the first object of the returned list from step 3 to HtmlImage 5. call saveAs() on the HtmlImage object http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/apidocs/com/gargoylesoftware/htmlunit/html/HtmlImage.html#saveAs%28java.io.File%29 cheers E Am 16.03.2013 20:22, schrieb Venkat: some one suggest me a way to download the Captcha image using HTMLUnit for this website? https://www.e-zpassny.com/vector/account/home/accountLogin.do?locale=en_US&from=Home [1] image content. -- http://htmlunit.10904.n7.nabble.com/Returning-a-Captcha-response-to-a-Webpage-tp22543p30350.html [2] Nabble.com. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Everyone hates slow websites. mail.body: and: the Captcha and thus the associated image? the htmlimage object then holds the image of the captcha. nothing more. cheers Am 16.03.2013 22:25, schrieb Venkat R: response. I am getting zero elements for the step 3. Here is my code. Can you pls review? startPage = webClient.getPage(" https://www.e-zpassny.com/vector/account/home/accountLogin.do = (HtmlImage)cells.get(0); // Here I get Zero elements and index out of bounds exception. getByXPath execute the Captcha and thus the associated image? Regards, 2013 20:39:34 +0100 htmlunit-user@... Returning a Captcha response to a Webpage there is an img tag which has the src="jcaptcha.do". you can do the following: url for some ajax calls and response page.getByXPath(".//img[src='jcaptcha.do'] of the returned list from step 3 to HtmlImage HtmlImage object http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/apidocs/com/gargoylesoftware/htmlunit/html/HtmlImage.html#saveAs%28java.io.File%29 cheers Could some one suggest me a way to download the Captcha image using HTMLUnit https://www.e-zpassny.com/vector/account/home/accountLogin.do?locale=en_US&from=Home [1] image content. mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Returning a Captcha response to a Webpage
mail.body: That worked. Thank you so much Erhard. Saved my day. I guess using this captcha image and prompting user to enter the text of it along with user name and password should be able to login to the site correct? As this captcha retrieval is in same session as the rest of the page content retrieval. I am asking this, since on some posts, user's mentioned that they are not able to login to the site with the captcha. Thanks, Venkat Date: Sun, 17 Mar 2013 00:22:26 +0100 From: er@... To: htmlunit-user@... Subject: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Returning a Captcha response to a Webpage Oh I see. the XPath expression should be: .//img[@src='jcaptcha.do'] The @ is missing. cheers Am 16.03.2013 22:25, schrieb Venkat R: Hi Erhard, Thank you for your response. I am getting zero elements for the step 3. Here is my code. Can you pls review? final HtmlPage startPage = webClient.getPage(" https://www.e-zpassny.com/vector/account/home/accountLogin.do HtmlImage image = (HtmlImage)cells.get(0); // Here I get Zero elements and index out of bounds exception. One question, is getting the element by getByXPath execute the Captcha and thus the associated image? Regards, Venkat Date: Sat, 16 Mar 2013 20:39:34 +0100 From: er@... To: htmlunit-user@... Subject: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Returning a Captcha response to a Webpage hi in the HTML code there is an img tag which has the src="jcaptcha.do". you can do the following: 1. call the getPage on the webclient object with the url 2. call webClient.waitForBackgroundJavaScript(8000); //this waits for some ajax calls and response 3. select the image from the page by page.getByXPath(".//img[src='jcaptcha.do'] 4. convert the first object of the returned list from step 3 to HtmlImage 5. call saveAs() on the HtmlImage object http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/apidocs/com/gargoylesoftware/htmlunit/html/HtmlImage.html#saveAs%28java.io.File%29 cheers E Am 16.03.2013 20:22, schrieb Venkat: Hi, Could some one suggest me a way to download the Captcha image using HTMLUnit for this website? https://www.e-zpassny.com/vector/account/home/accountLogin.do?locale=en_US&from=Home When I looked at the Browser Page Source, I don't see the image content. Any hint is appreciated. Regards, Venkat -- View this message in context: http://htmlunit.10904.n7.nabble.com/Returning-a-Captcha-response-to-a-Webpage-tp22543p30350.html Sent from the HtmlUnit - General mailing list archive at Nabble.com. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Everyone hates slow websites. mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Lots of javascript errors in IE9 vs IE8? quirks mode?
mail.body: I'm running the 2.12 but seeing a huge difference in the javascript errors for IE8 vs IE9 browser versions, pretty sure it's because of triggering "quirks mode" (<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN" " http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd "> ) Is "quirks mode" not necessarily supported out of the box for IE9 browser version? mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Checking if a Javascript function exists before calling executeJavascript on HtmlPage
mail.body: I was hoping someone would help me figure out what I am doing wrong. I need to execute a javascript function that is at the bottom of my page through HtmlUnit but sometimes, it gives me a script error saying the JS function is undefined. I have created a Java wait handler to test whether the JS function exists before calling executeJavascript as follows, but even after waiting for 5 minutes, the function still doesn't exist. Can someone guide me as to what I am doing wrong or if there is a better way to go about checking if JS functions exist? private boolean waitForJSFunctionExists(final String funcName, final //try 600 times to wait .5 second each for filling the page (up to 5 minutes) final ScriptResult jsResult = System.out.println(funcName + " exists: " + Then in my test, I then just wait for this before executing: Thanks. -- View this message in context: http://htmlunit.10904.n7.nabble.com/Checking-if-a-Javascript-function-exists-before-calling-executeJavascript-on-HtmlPage-tp30283.html Sent from the HtmlUnit - General mailing list archive at Nabble.com.

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] jQuery 1.9.1, Firefox and HTML string handling
mail.body: HtmlUnit version: latest trunk (2.13-SNAPSHOT) HtmlUnitDriver type: BrowserVersion.FIREFOX_17 I have run into a strange issue with jQuery 1.9.1 and parsing & appending HTML strings. I know that the default behaviour of HTML string handling changed for jQuery 1.9 ( http://jquery.com/upgrade-guide/1.9/#jquery-htmlstring-versus-jquery-selectorstring ), but I think that my usage is correct (simplified usage): For FIREFOX_17, this alerts the string whereas it should be These are my test results: FIREFOX_17 & jQuery 1.8.3 => '<div><div>This should not disappear!</div></div>' FIREFOX_17 & jQuery 1.9.1 => '<div></div>' INTERNET_EXPLORER_8 & jQuery 1.8.3 => '<DIV><DIV>This should not disappear!</DIV></DIV>' INTERNET_EXPLORER_8 & jQuery 1.9.1 => '<DIV><DIV>This should not disappear!</DIV></DIV>' I got the same results when using I was able to work around the issue like this: I wasn't able to track the issue down to what changed within jQuery to cause this, but it seems to affect all of the HTML string handling when using Firefox & jQuery 1.9.1. -- View this message in context: http://htmlunit.10904.n7.nabble.com/jQuery-1-9-1-Firefox-and-HTML-string-handling-tp30263.html Sent from the HtmlUnit - General mailing list archive at Nabble.com.

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] jQuery 1.9.1, BrowserVersion INTERNET_EXPLORER_8, and focus bubbling
mail.body: I am having some issues with HtmlUnitDriver tests after upgrading to jQuery 1.9.1. The tests were passing using jQuery 1.8.3. I am using the latest version on the HtmlUnit trunk (2.13-SNAPSHOT). My first issue is that, using BrowserVersion.INTERNET_EXPLORER_8, I am getting this error: It was occurring here (line 3558 in jquery-1.9.1.js): jQuery shouldn't be calling addEventListener for IE8, so I figured that there must be an issue with jQuery appears to have changed their feature detection for this between 1.8.3 and 1.9.1. This is their feature detection in 1.8.3: and this is the new approach in 1.9.1: I tested these and alert($.support.focusinBubbles); reports 'true' for jQuery 1.8.3 and 'false' for jQuery 1.9.1. Reporting 'false' is a problem because it causes jQuery to try patch IE using addEventListener. Using BrowserVersion.FIREFOX_17 works around this problem, but that runs into other issues (will post about that next). -- View this message in context: http://htmlunit.10904.n7.nabble.com/jQuery-1-9-1-BrowserVersion-INTERNET-EXPLORER-8-and-focus-bubbling-tp30260.html Sent from the HtmlUnit - General mailing list archive at Nabble.com.

Please open an issue ( http://sourceforge.net/p/htmlunit/bugs/ ). Will try to fix it soon. RBRi -------------------------- Wetator Smart web application testing http://www.wetator.org

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] HTML Rendering and pixel coordinates
mail.body: Hi, Does HTMLUnit render elements on a page so that we can get the pixel coordinates from an event? I don't think it does this but I wanted to check if anything has changed or see if there is some sort of workaround. The framework we are using in our application use event mouse coordinates behind the scenes in some of their event handlers (e.g. They calculate the row and column numbers for their list grid component using event x and y coordinates and performing a HTMLUnit htmlElement.click() returns unexpected results or just doesn't work). Thanks -- View this message in context: http://htmlunit.10904.n7.nabble.com/HTML-Rendering-and-pixel-coordinates-tp30257.html Sent from the HtmlUnit - General mailing list archive at Nabble.com.

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HTML Rendering and pixel coordinates
mail.body: Hi, yes it does... to some extend. HtmlUnit computes (or tries to) the size of elements when needed and therefore coordinates as well. Please open an issue if you hit a case where it doesn't work as expected. Cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com Le 06/03/2013 18:15, mgreenberg a écrit :

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Accessing dynamic .js files
mail.body: Hi, You can get all responses, have a look at http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/faq.html#HowToModifyRequestOrResponse Ahmed ________________________________ To: htmlunit-user@... Sent: Saturday, March 2, 2013 6:59 PM Subject: [Htmlunit-user] Accessing dynamic .js files Dear HtmlUnit experts, When I load a news story from CBC.ca ( example link http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/story/2013/03/01/pol-ei-investigators-manual.html ) in Firefox and "save as" a "complete webpage", among all the other stuff I receive a series of files called e.g., REL-5_004.js that contain all the comments from the article. This is true even though those files are not directly cited in the HTML source page: I am guessing they must be retrieved dynamically based on javascript commands. Using HtmlUnit and page.getByXPath, I am able to return exactly what I would see in a browser, which is the first five comments (code below; h/t matt@...). But what I would really like to do is fetch the various REL-5_00X.js files ... and if possible, skip loading the rest of the page, though that's less important. Is there some kind of "get" command I can run on the HtmlPage to obtain these files (as in firefox), or do I have to figure out the javascript that loads the comments? In the page HTML, there are a few scripts where a unique articleKey is passed as a parameter, which leads me to believe it is the comment loader, but I don't know how to use those to grab the content. Thanks in advance for any suggestions you can offer. Cheers, Jordan String url = " http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/new-brunswick/story/2013/02/28/nb-ei-.html final HtmlDivision div = (HtmlDivision) -- View this message in context: http://htmlunit.10904.n7.nabble.com/Accessing-dynamic-js-files-tp30227.html Sent from the HtmlUnit - General mailing list archive at Nabble.com. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Everyone hates slow websites. mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Page not displaying content received via JavaScript
mail.body: Hi, I'm trying to use htmlunit to parse a web page to get some data. The page can be reached in this address: http://www4.tjrj.jus.br/ejud/ConsultaProcesso.aspx?N=200400206124 As far as I was able to debug this, the content is received correctly - it appears in the httpClient wire. What it basically does, is, after loading the page "skeleton", update a div called "conteudo" with a template (it uses jQuery and jTemplates for that) and some data received in a XMLHttpRequest. This data comes in JSON format. In the skeleton, the div is empty, and it is there. I can reach it with getElementById("conteudo"). But the div is always empty, even after the page completes loading. In the debug log, I can see two times the following message: com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.host.html.HTMLDocument - getElementById(conteudo): no DOM node found with this id So it seems that the JavaScript Engine isn't able to find the div, for some reason. The code I'm using to get the page follows: HtmlPage page = webClient.getPage(" http://www4.tjrj.jus.br/ejud/ConsultaProcesso.aspx?N=200400206124 After that, the div I need to parse (id="conteudo") is empty. So... what am I missing? It seems that something is blocking the JS Engine to update the div with the data, since it is not being found. Thanks in advance, Guilherme Bradasch

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit - Execution od JavaScript code - caching support?
mail.body: Hi I think this issue would be best addressed by members of the development team of HtmlUnit. I have developed a web-scraping engine using the HtmlUnit API. While the support for executing JavaScript comes in handy for scraping large number of sites whose page content is driven by javaScript, I do find that the performance or speed is an issue, the standard browsers execute the scripts quicker. In the context of web-scraping, especially when multiple pages with similar content (as under search-result-pagination), the same JavaScript code gets executed repeatedly. Isn't there a scope for improving the performance by caching the JavaScript code? Is such a feature currently missing in the HtmlUnit API? if so, is that on the agenda for development, when can we expect it? Thanks, Satya

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit - Execution od JavaScript code - caching support?
mail.body: Hi again ;) there is currently no issue (feature request) open for this. for a list of open feature requests, see: http://sourceforge.net/p/htmlunit/feature-requests/search/?q=performance+javascript&limit=25&page=0&sort=status_s%20desc Am 20.04.2013 15:26, schrieb Satyanarayana K: this issue would be best addressed by members of the development team of HtmlUnit. HtmlUnit API. While the support for executing JavaScript comes in handy for scraping large number of sites whose page content is driven by javaScript, I do find that the performance or speed is an issue, the standard browsers execute the scripts quicker. web-scraping, especially when multiple pages with similar content (as under search-result-pagination), the same JavaScript code gets executed repeatedly. Isn't there a scope for improving the performance by caching the JavaScript code? Is such a feature currently missing in the HtmlUnit API? if so, is that on the agenda for development, when can we expect it? ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Precog is a next-generation analytics platform capable of advanced analytics on semi-structured data. mail.body: Hi, I note that xpath-selection of htmlpage-elements based on CSS class with class-name having one or more space/s does not seem to work. For example "//div[@class='cls1 cls2']". Any work-arounds for this? Thanks for your time, Satya

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlPage- Selection of elements based on CSS class - class-name with space/s
mail.body: Hi The reason why this does not work every time is, that HtmlUnit produces valid XML and the order of the css classes could be "cls1 cls2" or "cls2 cls1". so the easiest thing would be: //div[contains(@class, 'cls1') and contains(@class, 'cls2')] note: this will not exclude some other classes: "cls2 cls3 cls1" would also be a positive for the query above. cheers E Am 20.04.2013 15:18, schrieb Satyanarayana K: Hi, class with class-name having one or more space/s does not seem to work. for this? ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Precog is a next-generation analytics platform capable of advanced analytics on semi-structured data. mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] how to customize my HttpURLConnection to modify http response header?
mail.body: hi all, I am not sure it's suitable to post here. but I asked it in oracle's network forum and don't get a solution. I think you guys here are experts of java network programming, so I come here for help. orginal post in forum : https://forums.oracle.com/forums/thread.jspa?threadID=2523938&tstart=0 ------------------------------------------------------------- I have a problem with javafx brower( https://forums.oracle.com/forums/thread.jspa?threadID=2521487&tstart=0 ) I want to implement my HttpURLConnection which extends sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection. @Override if(this.url.toExternalForm().startsWith(" http://map.baidu.com/su //I want to modify response header here. but the response headers are stored in " private MessageHeader responses;". I can't modify it. I want to copy sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection out and modify it myself. but I can't get source codes of it in JDK/src.zip. I searched and found http://grepcode.com/snapshot/repository.grepcode.com/java/root/jdk/openjdk/7-b147/ but it depends so many things of sun.net package. any good method for me ? thanks.

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit Page not loading on linux
mail.body: Actually I am getting java.lang.OutOfMemoryError in above problem and so this program is not running further I have make change in catlina by alloting heap as following (My RAM is @GB) if [ -z "$LOGGING_MANAGER" ]; then JAVA_OPTS="$JAVA_OPTS -Djava.util.logging.manager=org.apache.juli.ClassLoaderLogManager" else JAVA_OPTS="$JAVA_OPTS $LOGGING_MANAGER" fi # Uncomment the following line to make the umask available when using the # org.apache.catalina.security.SecurityListener JAVA_OPTS="$JAVA_OPTS -Dorg.apache.catalina.security.SecurityListener.UMASK=`umask`" JAVA_OPTS="$JAVA_OPTS -Xms512m -Xmx2048m -XX:MaxPermSize=512m" JAVA_OPTS="-server -XX:+UseConcMarkSweepGC" but still I am getting OOM error........help me please.... -- View this message in context: http://htmlunit.10904.n7.nabble.com/HtmlUnit-Page-not-loading-on-linux-tp30456p30493.html Sent from the HtmlUnit - General mailing list archive at Nabble.com.

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit Page not loading on linux
mail.body: how many pages are you downloading. I have monitored the heap space usage of htmlunit and recognized that the usage growths up to about 120MB for hmltunit only. afterwards it is stable up to about 250 pages of downloading. then it growths very very fast! if you are not dependent on cookie information or something about that you may want to reinitialize the webclient object. cheers e On 08.04.2013 12:51, Kunal Kishore wrote: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError in above problem and so this running further following JAVA_OPTS="$JAVA_OPTS -Djava.util.logging.manager=org.apache.juli.ClassLoaderLogManager" else following line to make the umask available when using the org.apache.catalina.security.SecurityListener -Dorg.apache.catalina.security.SecurityListener.UMASK=`umask`" JAVA_OPTS="$JAVA_OPTS -Xms512m -Xmx2048m -XX:MaxPermSize=512m" JAVA_OPTS="-server -XX:+UseConcMarkSweepGC" OOM error........help me please.... context: http://htmlunit.10904.n7.nabble.com/HtmlUnit-Page-not-loading-on-linux-tp30456p30493.html [1] Nabble.com. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Minimize network downtime and maximize team effectiveness. network management and security costs.Learn how to hire talented Cisco Certified professionals. mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Download dialog
mail.body: Hi a download dialog is only a GUI issue for browsers as everybody knows. In HTMLUnit you have to create stream and download it. this is very easy. byte[] data = webClient.getPage(" http://www.xxx.cc/downloadfile.binary.aaa").getWebResponse().getResponseBody Where file is simply a File object to write to. cheers E Am 04.04.2013 11:15, schrieb phiroc@...: Hello, Download Dialog in HtmlUnit? ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Minimize network downtime and maximize team effectiveness. network management and security costs.Learn how to hire talented Cisco Certified professionals. mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Download dialog
mail.body: Thanks for your reply. The multipart/form-data form which I am trying to automate contains a table whose 20-or-so TRs (corresponding to geographical areas) contain IMAGE INPUTs, as follows: Please note that all the IMAGE INPUTs have the same name ("0.1.2.3.4" in my example), strangely enough. When the user clicks one of the images, a Download Dialog appears, letting him/her download a file corresponding to the TR. For instance, when he clicks the France TR, the France file gets downloaded, when he clicks the Brazil TR, the Brazil file get downloaded. The form's action is " action="/WebObjects/xxx.woa/wo/16.0.0.7.3.0.9.3.1"> " How can I click, say, the "France" image, and retrieve the matching downloadable file? Many thanks. mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit 2.12 Performance
mail.body: Hi .. Recently upgraded from HtmlUnit 2.10 to 2.12. We noticed a significant performance degradation. With 2.10 our suite of 1300 tests ran in 14hrs but now it is taking over 20hrs. Has anyone else seen performance hit with 2.12? I did try the suggestion to turn-off css and it did improve a lot but were unable to test some of the visual effects. Anyone knows the cause of the performance hit? Thanks Raj

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit 2.12 Performance
mail.body: Hi, which browser are you simulating? Can you give a try to a recent 2.13-SNAPSHOT to see if you get the same results? As far as I remember a performance bottleneck (for IE simulation I think) has been fixed since 2.12. Cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com Le 23/05/2013 18:20, RAJ RAJESWARAN a écrit :

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit 2.12 Performance
mail.body: Hi Marc, Thank you for getting back to me. We are simulating 2.12's default browser which is IE8. Yes, I will try latest snapshots and get back to you. Thanks Raj On Fri, May 24, 2013 at 2:27 AM, Marc Guillemot <mguillemot@...> wrote: http://mguillem.wordpress.com http://p.sf.net/sfu/newrelic_d2d_may https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit 2.12 Performance
mail.body: Hi Marc, I tried the latest snapshot and the performance has improved a lot. I used build 2303. Thanks Marc. On Fri, May 24, 2013 at 2:27 AM, Marc Guillemot <mguillemot@...> wrote: http://mguillem.wordpress.com http://p.sf.net/sfu/newrelic_d2d_may https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] htmlunit 2.13-SNAPSHOT performance
mail.body: Hi all, Continuing the performance issues i found with htmlunit where javascript and css where enabled and i saw that it was 120% slower than firefox webdriver, I made the following tests. I took 1000 urls and ran speed tests with HttpClient, HttpURLConnection, Selenium FirefoxDriver with javascript disabled, HTMLUnit with css and javascript disabled and htmlunit with javascript disabled and css enabled. The tests were made on my PC (Intel i3 with Windows7 ,Java 6 and Eclipse Kepler) I had the following results (from fastest to slowest) 1. HTMLUnit with css and javascript disabled 2.Selenium FirefoxDriver -36% slower 3.HttpURLConnection - 40%slower 4.HttpClient - 56% slower 5. HTMLUnit with css enabled and javascript disabled -57%slower. On the one hand it is very nice that htmlunit with css and javascript disabled is the fastest and it is better than performance of 2.12 (which is really nice). On the other hand with css enabled it is the slowest possibility. In massive web tests this could make a big difference. BR, David

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] max response size limit
mail.body: Hi, is it possible to set limit on response size when using htmlUnit library ? e.g. you will visit URL where is very large page and you don`t want to process it when it`s over limit e.g. 1MB Regards, Martin Vich

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] max response size limit
mail.body: Hi, no, there is not currently such an option. Cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com Le 23/05/2013 01:46, Martin Vich a écrit :

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] htmlunit javascript performance
mail.body: Hi, I changed the line from page.asText to page.asXml and tried the test with the same urls and the 2.13 snapshot. With javascript enabled htmlunit is still 120 percent slower than firefoxdriver. With javascript disabled htmlunit is now about 35 percent faster than firefoxdriver, which is impressing. BR, David htmlunit-user-request@...> wrote: https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://code.google.com/p/selenium/wiki/FrequentlyAskedQuestions#Q:_WebDriver_fails_to_find_elements_/_Does_not_block_on_page_loa http://markmail.org/thread/jcrqn6qyhcmw4pkb ). http://mguillem.wordpress.com http://p.sf.net/sfu/newrelic_d2d_may https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Fwd: What is the trade-off for disabling CSS in HTMLUnit?
mail.body: Hi all, I experienced slowness in HTMLUnit 2.12, and therefore disabled CSS as explained in http://stackoverflow.com/questions/10442803/htmlunit-super-slow-execution . I want to understand what the trade-off is. Does it mean that I cannot use XPath selectors? Are there other tradeoffs? I posted this question in stackoverflow and did not get an answer for it. http://stackoverflow.com/questions/16342119/what-is-the-trade-off-for-disabling-css-in-htmlunit Thanks, David

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Fwd: What is the trade-off for disabling CSS in HTMLUnit?
mail.body: Hi, disabling CSS may be a little bit faster in some cases but it may cause JS errors too when the site's code awaits the style to be available. Cheers, Marc. Le 05/05/2013 09:55, Michael Gang a écrit : http://stackoverflow.com/questions/10442803/htmlunit-super-slow-execution . http://stackoverflow.com/questions/16342119/what-is-the-trade-off-for-disabling-css-in-htmlunit

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] htmlunit javascript performance
mail.body: I made a performance test of htmlunit against selenium with firefoxdriver and firefox 21. The performance test was made on my windows7 machine through Eclipse. When both have javascript disabled, the performance is the same. When both have javascript turned on htmlunit 2.12 is *150%* slower than firefox. I imagine that this is due the superiority of the spidermonkey engine on rhino. Is there a way to configure rhino that it will be faster? Is there another way we can speed htmlunit up? BTW: Are there any thoughts to switch from rhino to the nashorn engine when java8 goes out? ... System.out.println( System.out.println( System.out.println( System.out.println( // And now use this to visit Google // And now use this to visit Google // TODO Auto-generated catch block // TODO Auto-generated catch block // TODO Auto-generated catch block

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] htmlunit javascript performance
mail.body: Hi Michael, your test code looks quite good as both FF and HtmlUnit will have an empty cache. Note that you should rather use page.asXml() than page.asText() to do the same than driver.getPageSource(). What may be biased depending on the urls you're testing is when the call to driver.get(url) / client.getPage(url) returns (see http://code.google.com/p/selenium/wiki/FrequentlyAskedQuestions#Q:_WebDriver_fails_to_find_elements_/_Does_not_block_on_page_loa ). Concerning Nashorn, I've already answered your email in the dev list ( http://markmail.org/thread/jcrqn6qyhcmw4pkb ). Could you perform the exact same test with a recent 2.13-SNAPSHOT in place of 2.12 and post the results? Cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com Le 23/05/2013 16:47, Michael Gang a écrit :

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Migrating from 2.9 to 2.12, log disable code is not working
mail.body: Hi, Till now I was using htmlunit 2.9, as it was generating too many log messages, I have disabled these by adding the following code at appropriate places and by changing log4j.proprieties. @Override // TODO Auto-generated method stub LogFactory.getFactory().setAttribute("org.apache.commons.logging.Log", log4j.logger.httpclient.wire=ERROR log4j.logger.org.apache.commons=ERROR log4j.logger.com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit=ERROR log4j.logger.com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.WebTestCase=INFO log4j.logger.org.apache.http.level = INFO log4j.logger.com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.level = OFF log4j.logger.com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.StrictErrorReporter.level = OFF log4j.logger.com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.host.ActiveXObject.level = OFF log4j.logger.com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.host.html.HTMLDocument.level = OFF log4j.logger.com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HtmlScript.level = OFF Now I have updated with htmlunit2.12 jar files, but still so many log messages are getting displayed on the console in spite of having all the previous log disabling code. How can I disable all these log messages in htmlunit2.12? Can any one help me please? Thanks in advance. Regards, M. N. Kishore Babu.

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Class Not found exception during the build of HTMLUni 2.12
mail.body: Hi, I have been migrating a grails web application from HTML Unit 2.10 to 2.12. I am getting the following error during grails build. Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.BaseFrameElement The same code was building fine with 2.10. I have not changed the code which uses HTMLUni 2.12 APIs. I see that new JAR files of 2.12 are there in the respective place. Any pointers to solve this problem is appreciated. Regards Vasu

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Class Not found exception during the build of HTMLUni 2.12
mail.body: Hi Vasu, is there any secret in your grails code or why do you provide not the whole stack trace and maybe also some source code. Without more details we can onyl guess. Class BaseFrameElement was introduced in 07/2012 as an replacement of BaseFrame. So my guess is that you application still use some outdated (and maybe no longer existing - because you jump over two versions) API. Try to go from 2.10 to 2.11 first, then remove all warning about deprecated API usage and then go to 2.12. Maybe this helps to get a more clear idea what has changed. RBRi On Mon, 20 May 2013 12:26:43 +0530 Vasudevan Comandur wrote:

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Class Not found exception during the build of HTMLUni 2.12
mail.body: Hi Vasu, I too jumped from 2.9 to 2.12 and got same error, class not found of some other type. Then I noticed there were some depreciated functions in 2.12 release. So I changed those functions as per new release and the code is working as usual. Regards, M. N. Kishore Babu. mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit setUseInsecureSSL not working
mail.body: The following code tries to fetch a page from wikipedia client.getPage(" https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ludwig_Van_Beethoven // TODO Auto-generated catch block // TODO Auto-generated catch block // TODO Auto-generated catch block The problem is that i get an exception javax.net.ssl.SSLPeerUnverifiedException: peer not authenticated at sun.security.ssl.SSLSessionImpl.getPeerCertificates(Unknown Source) at org.apache.http.conn.ssl.AbstractVerifier.verify(AbstractVerifier.java:126) at org.apache.http.conn.ssl.SSLSocketFactory.connectSocket(SSLSocketFactory.java:572) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.HtmlUnitSSLSocketFactory.connectSocket(HtmlUnitSSLSocketFactory.java:171) at org.apache.http.impl.conn.DefaultClientConnectionOperator.openConnection(DefaultClientConnectionOperator.java:180) at org.apache.http.impl.conn.ManagedClientConnectionImpl.open(ManagedClientConnectionImpl.java:294) at org.apache.http.impl.client.DefaultRequestDirector.tryConnect(DefaultRequestDirector.java:645) at org.apache.http.impl.client.DefaultRequestDirector.execute(DefaultRequestDirector.java:480) at org.apache.http.impl.client.AbstractHttpClient.execute(AbstractHttpClient.java:906) at org.apache.http.impl.client.AbstractHttpClient.execute(AbstractHttpClient.java:827) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.HttpWebConnection.getResponse(HttpWebConnection.java:178) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.WebClient.loadWebResponseFromWebConnection(WebClient.java:1486) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.WebClient.loadWebResponse(WebClient.java:1403) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.WebClient.getPage(WebClient.java:305) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.WebClient.getPage(WebClient.java:374) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.WebClient.getPage(WebClient.java:359) at utils.TestWikipedia.main(TestWikipedia.java:20) I am using htmlunit version 2.12 . I tried to get an answer with stackoverflow at http://stackoverflow.com/questions/16508363/htmlunit-setuseinsecuressl-not-working but with no avail

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit setUseInsecureSSL not working
mail.body: Hi The problem seems to be, that you dont have a valid certificate at your host, to connect to wikipedia. Your host tells: wikipedia could be unsecure, if you want to connect, add it to trusted sources. A first thought about this;) Cheers E Am 12.05.2013 um 17:50 schrieb Michael Gang <michaelgang@...>: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ludwig_Van_Beethoven http://stackoverflow.com/questions/16508363/htmlunit-setuseinsecuressl-not-working http://p.sf.net/sfu/neotech_d2d_may https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Deletion of Temp files during download
mail.body: Hi, I would like to know if HTMLUnit version 2.12 would delete all the temp files which were created across multiple session or only the temp files that were created during the termination of current session after calling webClient.CloseAllWindows(). Regards Vasu

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Page not displaying content received via JavaScript
mail.body: Hi, I have experienced a similar situation while trying to scrape the 'src' attribute of an <img> element in a web-page - the specific was that the image was an enlarged image, involved Flash, which is not supported by HtmlUnit. I think HtmlUnit does not parse JSON. You will probably need to subclass the HttpWebConnection class and override the getResponse() method, wherein you parse the JSON String and use the parse-result to manipulate the page-object. For parsing JSON, you can write your own code or use GSON - Google's JSON API in Java. Hope it helps, Satya ________________________________ To: htmlunit-user@... Sent: Wednesday, May 1, 2013 3:59 AM Subject: [Htmlunit-user] Page not displaying content received via JavaScript Hi, I'm trying to use htmlunit to parse a web page to get some data. The page can be reached in this address: http://www4.tjrj.jus.br/ejud/ConsultaProcesso.aspx?N=200400206124 As far as I was able to debug this, the content is received correctly - it appears in the httpClient wire. What it basically does, is, after loading the page "skeleton", update a div called "conteudo" with a template (it uses jQuery and jTemplates for that) and some data received in a XMLHttpRequest. This data comes in JSON format. In the skeleton, the div is empty, and it is there. I can reach it with getElementById("conteudo"). But the div is always empty, even after the page completes loading. In the debug log, I can see two times the following message: com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.host.html.HTMLDocument - getElementById(conteudo): no DOM node found with this id So it seems that the JavaScript Engine isn't able to find the div, for some reason. The code I'm using to get the page follows: HtmlPage page = webClient.getPage(" http://www4.tjrj.jus.br/ejud/ConsultaProcesso.aspx?N=200400206124 After that, the div I need to parse (id="conteudo") is empty. So... what am I missing? It seems that something is blocking the JS Engine to update the div with the data, since it is not being found. Thanks in advance, Guilherme Bradasch ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Introducing AppDynamics Lite, a free troubleshooting tool for Java/.NET Get 100% visibility into your production application - at no cost. Code-level diagnostics for performance bottlenecks with <2% overhead Download for free and get started troubleshooting in minutes. http://p.sf.net/sfu/appdyn_d2d_ap1 _______________________________________________ Htmlunit-user mailing list Htmlunit-user@... https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Page not displaying content received via JavaScript
mail.body: Looking further into the problem, it seems that the JS engine is running a XHR script before the main page is parsed and HtmlPage.idMap_ has all the elements in it. So the JS running (it's a simple jQuery $("conteudo") call) fails on a getElementById(). Is there anything I can do to prevent this? Or, how can I control when the JS code executes? Thanks in advance, Guilherme Bradasch http://www4.tjrj.jus.br/ejud/ConsultaProcesso.aspx?N=200400206124 http://www4.tjrj.jus.br/ejud/ConsultaProcesso.aspx?N=200400206124 http://p.sf.net/sfu/appdyn_d2d_ap1 https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Page not displaying content received via JavaScript

Or, how can I control when the JS code executes? advance, AM, Satyanarayana K <kri_satya@...> wrote: 'src' attribute of an <img> element in a web-page - the specific was that the image was an enlarged image, involved Flash, which is not supported by HtmlUnit. You will probably need to subclass the HttpWebConnection class and override the getResponse() method, wherein you parse the JSON String and use the parse-result to manipulate the page-object. For parsing JSON, you can write your own code or use GSON - Google's JSON API in Java. ------------------------- SENT: Wednesday, May 1, 2013 3:59 AM not displaying content received via JavaScript The page can be reached in this address: http://www4.tjrj.jus.br/ejud/ConsultaProcesso.aspx?N=200400206124 [1] correctly - it appears in the httpClient wire. basically does, is, after loading the page "skeleton", update a div called "conteudo" with a template (it uses jQuery and jTemplates for that) and some data received in a XMLHttpRequest. This data comes in JSON format. In the skeleton, the div is empty, and it is there. I can reach it with getElementById("conteudo"). always empty, even after the page completes loading. debug log, I can see two times the following message: com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.host.html.HTMLDocument - getElementById(conteudo): no DOM node found with this id it seems that the JavaScript Engine isn't able to find the div, for some reason. webClient.setAjaxController(new webClient.getPage(" http://www4.tjrj.jus.br/ejud/ConsultaProcesso.aspx?N=200400206124 is empty. blocking the JS Engine to update the div with the data, since it is not being found. mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Page not displaying content received via JavaScript
mail.body: Hello all, Just to clear the issue, I solved it by *NOT* using setAjaxController(newNicelyResynchronizingAjaxController()) in my WebClient. Thanks, Guilherme Bradasch On Sat, May 4, 2013 at 4:35 AM, Ahmed Ashour <asashour@...> wrote: http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/submittingJSBugs.html http://www4.tjrj.jus.br/ejud/ConsultaProcesso.aspx?N=200400206124 http://www4.tjrj.jus.br/ejud/ConsultaProcesso.aspx?N=200400206124 http://p.sf.net/sfu/appdyn_d2d_ap1 https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://p.sf.net/sfu/appdyn_d2d_ap2 http://www.master-studios.net | http://www.facebook.com/MasterStudios.net | https://twitter.com/MasterStudiosAT http://p.sf.net/sfu/appdyn_d2d_ap2 https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user http://p.sf.net/sfu/appdyn_d2d_ap2 https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Iterating through list of img elements only gives output for first element
mail.body: Hi, I need some help with clicking on each img on a page with a particular src attribute. I have a web page with a number of imgage buttons that each have the same src but direct to a different page. I want to click on each one in turn and save each page data to a text file. The code iterates through the images but I get the data of the first image link in each file. Here is the code I am using: while(i3.hasNext()) if(anElement instanceof HtmlImage) if(input.getSrcAttribute().equalsIgnoreCase("src attribute text") ) BufferedWriter out = new BufferedWriter(new catch (IOException e) Thanks, -- Marie Griffin Email: mariegriffin909@...

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] filter out annoying javascript
mail.body: Hi all, There are many javascripts which do not change the logic of the page but take the performance away. Examples for these are addthis, google syndication, ... Is there an option to say htmlunit to skip javascript of certain origins. Thanks, David

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] filter out annoying javascript
mail.body: Hi, there is no such a built in option but you can easily achieve it using for instance the FalsifyingWebConnection. Cheers, Marc. Le 10/06/2013 16:51, Michael Gang a écrit :

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] htmlunit offline cache
mail.body: Hi all, Is there an option in htmlunit to have an offline cache, meaning that javascript and css files from previous runs are saved for the next runs in a cache? Thanks, David

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] htmlunit offline cache
mail.body: Hi, you can reuse the same instance of com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.Cache among different runs. Take care to configure its size to be large enough. Cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com Le 10/06/2013 14:40, Michael Gang a écrit :

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] HTML TITLE
mail.body: Hello! I want to get the title of this homepage http://de.selfhtml.org/html/transit/anzeige/script.htm I looked up here com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HtmlButton but I can´t get it how to use the method, because there is no constructor. So how I can do it? -- View this message in context: http://htmlunit.10904.n7.nabble.com/HTML-TITLE-tp30824.html Sent from the HtmlUnit - General mailing list archive at Nabble.com.

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HTML TITLE
mail.body: Hi, what about http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/apidocs/com/gargoylesoftware/htmlunit/html/HtmlPage.html#getTitleText () ? cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com Le 07/06/2013 07:29, Horst_Hose a écrit : http://de.selfhtml.org/html/transit/anzeige/script.htm

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HTML TITLE
mail.body: Thank you for the answer!! So "com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HtmlPage" is the superclass over "com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HtmlButton" so I build the constructor and then I can implement the methods of "com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HtmlButton" ?? Iam still a Java newbie, my problem is always reading from the api. To get the object methods you have to build the constructor, but my problem is building the constructor HtmlPage(URL originatingUrl, WebResponse webResponse, WebWindow webWindow) the first one I think I have to build URL url = new URL(" http://www.google.de HtmlPage (url,...,...) This would be my projection Can you give me an example Java code, how to get the title of an html? I can´t get it! Thank you!! -- View this message in context: http://htmlunit.10904.n7.nabble.com/HTML-TITLE-tp30824p30827.html Sent from the HtmlUnit - General mailing list archive at Nabble.com.

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HTML TITLE
mail.body: Horst, On 6/7/13 11:29 AM, Horst_Hose wrote: http://www.google.de See the first example on http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net/gettingStarted.html It shows how to validate the title of a page in the 3rd line of the method. - George -- ---------------------------------------------------------------------- * George Dinwiddie * http://blog.gdinwiddie.com Software Development http://www.idiacomputing.com Consultant and Coach http://www.agilemaryland.org ----------------------------------------------------------------------

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Java script failure on page loading with both HtmlUnit 2.12 and HtmlUnit 2.13
mail.body: Hello Team, I have tried to load the page with following url. http://m.macys.com/shop/product/style-co-top-short-sleeve-embroidered-embellished-tee?ID=834814&CategoryID=118 page loading failed and found following js error, repeatedly. Exception class=[net.sourceforge.htmlunit.corejs.javascript.JavaScriptException] com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.ScriptException: TypeError: Cannot find function ba in object [object Object]. ( https://apis.google.com/_/scs/apps-static/_/js/k=oz.gapi.en_GB.B8rbLxz-D3U.O/m=iframes_styles_bubble_mobile,plusone/rt=j/sv=1/d=1/ed=1/am=EQ/rs=AItRSTPx6afRulGp5s_QAZSUWREiC8-EGQ/cb=gapi.loaded_0#2 ) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.JavaScriptEngine$HtmlUnitContextAction.run(JavaScriptEngine.java:669) EcmaError: lineNumber=[153] column=[0] lineSource=[null] name=[TypeError] sourceName=[ http://d1topzp4nao5hp.cloudfront.net/macys/11.6.909/javascript/main.js ] message=[TypeError: Cannot call method "replace" of undefined ( http://d1topzp4nao5hp.cloudfront.net/macys/11.6.909/javascript/main.js#153 )] com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.ScriptException: TypeError: Cannot call method "replace" of undefined ( http://d1topzp4nao5hp.cloudfront.net/macys/11.6.909/javascript/main.js#153 ) at com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.javascript.JavaScriptEngine$HtmlUnitContextAction.run(JavaScriptEngine.java:669) Thanks Sreenadh -- If you judge people, you have no time to love them.

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Java script failure on page loading with both HtmlUnit 2.12 and HtmlUnit 2.13
mail.body: Please advice on this.... Thanks in advance Sreenadh

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Java script failure on page loading with both HtmlUnit 2.12 and HtmlUnit 2.13
mail.body: If you disabled javascript it'll work (in the new versions of htmlunit it is active by default): For the moment it could be enough for you... You have to make a decision about the javascript at the beginning of your project depending on the site you want to get the content. Normally it is not necessary to enable javascript because of googlebot (the google crawler) can't interpret it very well. Kind regards On 5 June 2013 16:54, Sreenath <sreenathvp@...> wrote: http://m.macys.com/shop/product/style-co-top-short-sleeve-embroidered-embellished-tee?ID=834814&CategoryID=118 https://apis.google.com/_/scs/apps-static/_/js/k=oz.gapi.en_GB.B8rbLxz-D3U.O/m=iframes_styles_bubble_mobile,plusone/rt=j/sv=1/d=1/ed=1/am=EQ/rs=AItRSTPx6afRulGp5s_QAZSUWREiC8-EGQ/cb=gapi.loaded_0#2 http://d1topzp4nao5hp.cloudfront.net/macys/11.6.909/javascript/main.js ] http://d1topzp4nao5hp.cloudfront.net/macys/11.6.909/javascript/main.js#153 http://d1topzp4nao5hp.cloudfront.net/macys/11.6.909/javascript/main.js#153 http://p.sf.net/sfu/servicenow-d2d-j https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/htmlunit-user

mail.header: [Htmlunit-user] Uploading a file with HtmlUnit WebRequest?
mail.body: Is it possible to upload a file by using WebRequest? if so what would be the steps in doing so?

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] Uploading a file with HtmlUnit WebRequest?
mail.body: Hi, the easiest way to do it is probably to load an html page with a form containing the file upload and to submit this form. Cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com Le 03/06/2013 21:43, 532865423 a écrit :

mail.header: Re: [Htmlunit-user] HtmlUnit debug help
mail.body: ... and to give a try to the latest snapshot (and probably to simulate FF17). If you have constantly nearly 100% CPU usage, then it means that you have hit some infinite loop. Ideally you should look for this loop ;-) Cheers, Marc. -- HtmlUnit support & consulting from the source Blog: http://mguillem.wordpress.com Le 30/05/2013 19:36, Ronald Brill a écrit : http://www.eurocasino.com/nl/(with german source IP, because the http://pastebin.com/XC6hdcg3
